author: {'steamid': '76561198007324078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1657481700}
review:
I'm actually a bit conflicted. The plot is great, the graphics are alright (for its time, at least), the puzzles are very good, the voice acting is excellent (though the recording is bad... the voice volume fluctuates wildly, and sometimes becomes so low that it's masked by ambience; I had to turn the subtitles on). But the controls are SPECTACULARLY bad, even compared to similar games from the same era.

In order to move, you have to DRAG (why???) with the right mouse button, and it's so clunky that a lot of the time your character will climb stairs or enter a room when you wanted to go the opposite direction. This annoyance would be forgiven if the creators hadn't included a level where you have to navigate a maze while avoiding timed traps, which of course requires precision in your movement.

You interact by clicking the left mouse button. The path-finding algorithm only works if you're practically next to the thing you want to interact with; often you'll only be a couple of paces away and you'll get a message like "the way is blocked". Moreover, sometimes you get the message "I can't do that" just for standing in the wrong place, which may make you rule out solutions that would actually work. You access your inventory by clicking your character, which is something people may overlook in the beginning, because when your character is still carrying nothing, NOTHING happens when you click on them (as opposed to a message that you are carrying nothing). Personally, I had to google where the inventory is.

So all in all, it's a very interesting game, which would be one of my favourites if it were not so annoying to play. If you can tolerate this flaw, I recommend it, mainly for the original plot and the impressive atmosphere, but also for the puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048431543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1658075716}
review:
A creatively dark and surreal game with a good good bit of variety. Each one of max's hallucinations is it's own story that takes you to a weird and disturbing world with cold unforgiving atmosphere. 

The puzzles can be pretty creative at times though sometimes a real chore to find and when you finally find the answer you realise how stupid you are or sometimes just scream at how stupid the solution was. Granted I only noticed this a couple times in the game.

The soundtrack is wonderfully atmospheric especially in Chapter 2 and 4. Each track really gives feeling to each area and is worth a listen.

The voice acting can be pretty campy but in a charming way that adds to the crusty and dingy style that in my view ages well with the overall theme of the game.

The addition of combat is probably my only major gripe in terms of this game though it only happens in chapter 2 and 4 then remains absent for the rest of the game. That as well as the rather annoying maze section later but it's short and is over within seconds.



Overall this game remains a point and click classic and is definitely a favourite of mine in terms of the genre.


Just be careful not to use the Quicksave feature it crashes the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968073802', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1648717372}
review:
Sanitarium is a pretty weird game, but it's also very well made. You have tons of levels, characters, cut scenes, music, sounds and all kinds of funny, scary and horrible things happening...all at once! I must say right off the bat that I do recommend the game, but it's actually taken me some time to get through it.

First off, this game is easy to get into, because the start of the game isn't that complicated. You just need to figure out how the game works, how you pick up items, and how to use those items to progress in the game. The game requires a bit of patience, but it's completly doable without a walkthrough.

Now that is said, I did have a problem pretty early on, and had to use a walkthrough. The problem was that the place I was in was huge, and the ONLY way to get further was to litterary click on one pixels through this level. Not only was it frustrating to not find it that easily, but the background sounds in that place annoyed me so much I had to actually turn off the sounds for the game. Not very fun! For that part I did actually use a walkthrough, but I don't think I would have found it out myself, simply because it was ONE pixels in a HUGE level.

I'm not a big fan of using walkthroughs, and that part annoyed me so much, that not long after I stopped playing the game completly, for more than a year. I was also thinking about giving the game a negative review, because it really got my patience, and everytime I thought of wanting to enter the game again, I did not.

Honestly. After that long time, I started playing the game again, and this time around it was actually very good. I was already into the story from before, or at least now I began to understand it better than before, and everything made more sense. I also found the story and puzzles interesting, and I was able to figure it out all by myself...WHICH I LIKE!

Anyway. If you want an interesting point and click game (made for adults), with horror elements and an exciting, but weird story, this is the game for you. It might require some patience, but eventually you will figure things out.

I recommend this game! (And I am kinda glad I am done with it now)

author: {'steamid': '76561198048716907', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1636658888}
review:
[h1]Genre[/h1]
Point-And-Click-Abenteuer / milder, bizarrer Grusel

[h1]Entwickler[/h1]
DreamForge Intertainment (1998)

[h1]Story[/h1]
Das Spiel startet in der Irrenanstalt - und der absolut kranke Start ist noch mit das Normalste, was uns im Spielverlauf passieren wird!
Wir werden noch zu anderen Personen werden, werden auch noch andere Orte besuchen - wie (Achtung - [b][u]massive Spoilerwarnung![/u][/b]) [spoiler]den Innenhof der Anstalt, ein Dorf nur voller Kinder, einen abartigen Zirkus auf einer Insel, einen Insektenstaat und ein Dorf in der Mayakultur.[/spoiler] 

[h1]Rätsel/Spielmechaniken[/h1]
Die Rätselgestaltung ist schon recht unterschiedlich! Meist hat man schon einen groben Überblick, was zu erledigen ist. Dann aber die "Zutaten" oder benötigten Dinge zu finden, ist schon mal extrem knifflig.
Besonders der altbackenen Handhabung des Laufens, der Inventarverwaltung, allgemeiner Ingame-Hinweise und den Funktionen zu "Speichern und Laden" hätte eine Überarbeitung gut getan!

[h1]Technisches[/h1]
Die [b]Grafik[/b] ist dafür, dass das Spiel aus dem letzten Jahrtausend stammt (!) schon recht gut gealtert, finde ich. Den Videosequenzen sieht man das Alter noch eher an als der Grafik im laufenden Spiel.
Der [b]Sound[/b] ist technisch okay - es gibt hier nur einige Geräusche und Klangkulissen, die mich persönlich beim neuerlichen Spiel noch mehr auf die Palme gebracht haben, als im alten Original. Naja, alles halt irre hier - warum sollte die Klangwelt da eine Ausnahme machen?!

[h1]Umfang[/h1]
Je nach Spielerfahrung im Point'n'Click-Bereich, ein wenig "Glück" und jeder Menge "gesundem Menschenverstand" sollte einen das Spiel so um die acht bis zehn Stunden bei Laune halten.

[h1]Wertung[/h1]
[list]
[*] Atmosphäre ★★★★★ 10/10
[*] Rätsel ★★★☆☆ 6/10
[*] Grafik ★★★★☆ 7/10
[*] Sound ★★★☆☆ 6/10
[*] Steuerung ★★★☆☆ 6/10
[*] Umfang ★★★★★ 9/10
[*] Gesamt ★★★★☆ 7/10
[/list]

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Wer auf der Suche nach durchgeknallter Atmosphäre, irren Rätseln und einer ziemlich verqueren Geschichte  ist, ist bei [b]Sanitarium[/b] an [u]genau der richtigen Adresse[/u] angekommen! Ich persönlich finde den Preis des Spiels okay, im Zweifel halt auf den nächsten [b]Sale[/b] warten. 


[hr][/hr]
Und - bevor die Klagen kommen: 
[b]Zu Risiken und Nebenwirkungen lesen Sie ([u]vor dem Kauf[/u]!) auch andere Rezensionen und Erfahrungsberichte![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198086567165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 997, 'last_played': 1644540251}
review:
From the adventure games which I ever played, this one has one of the best storytelling so far. From what I recall, only other adventure games which are comparable in term how story is intriguing and how it can "grasp" you, are Gabriel Knight games. Maybe there are better adventure games when you compare puzzles or graphics or other game mechanics, but storytelling really shines in this game and this element itself is worth enough to play this game.

The game has mysterious and unsettling atmosphere which just adds to immersion. Regarding adventuring/puzzles, the game is quite easy, no over-complicated puzzles. I finished the game without walk-through easily, being stuck only in chapter 2 for 10-15 minutes until I realized what to do to move forward.

There's one 100% reproducible bug in chapter 3, but is easily avoidable (see discussion in games community section here on Steam).

All in all, great adventure game, I can recommend easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072542853', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1643531008}
review:
The story is great and fun to explore the bizarre world.  The puzzles are quite difficult as there is only one way to resolve each of the puzzles.  Many hints are subtle and it takes a lot of trial and error.  

There's a game breaking bug in chapter 3.  Make sure to save multiple saves in chapter 3 and complete the music area before talking to the hooded women in front of the church.

You are not alone and to play the right rune are the two achievements easiest to miss.  There's no chapter replay function so have to replay the whole game for missed achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000313700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 813, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1643278366}
review:
Igitt! 

Nach so vielen Jahren ists immer noch eine echt kranke Welt, die Welt von Sanitarium. Und hallo, lieber Leser. Da sind wir wieder einmal, wir zwei und Du bist hier, um Dich zu gruseln schätze ich.
Na dann kanns ja losgehen... also Obacht: 
Buh!
Ha! Das hat gesessen, jetzt läufts Dir kalt den Rücken runter, hab ich Recht?
Nicht? Tja, schade, aber ok. Aber versuchs doch dann mit diesem Game, wenn Du son hart gesottener Typ mit Nerven aus Drahtseilen bist. 

Und Du darfst Grusel im dreifachen Sinne erwarten und das zum Schnäppchenpreis. Heute scheint Dein Glückstag zu sein. 

Zu allererst darfst Du Dich mal vor der altertümlichen, unfassbar schlecht gealterten Grafik gruseln. Uuuuhhuuhuhhh... sieht das widerlich aus. Und ja, damals wars nicht hübsch und der Zahn der Zeit hat die Schauwerte dieses Spiels erst recht so richtig zerfetzt. Da gibts schon beim bloßen Hingucken die ersten Angstschweißattacken.

Noch viel schlimmer wirds aber erst bei der Steuerung, ich hab wirklich keinen Schimmer, welchem absolut kranken, perversen und verdrehten Hirn eines Wahnsinnigen mit Irrem Blick diese Ausgeburt der sieben Höllen entsprungen sein mag. Aber während ich diese Zeilen mit zitternden Händen zu Papier (digitales Papier versteht sich) bringe, versuche ich gerade, das Spiel noch einmal durchzuzocken, der Nostalgie wegen. Und ich bin einiges gewohnt, aber es ist die reinste Tortur. Ich hab erst ein Drittel durch und bin kurz davor, selbst den Kopf monoton stammelnd unablässig gegen die Wand zu rammen... so funktional und komfortabel lässt sich das Ding steuern. Brutal ist das, sag ich Dir.
Und denk mal drüber nach, ich bin natürlich ein welterfahrener Tausendsassa mit Nerven aus Stahl, festem Blick und natürlich stets Herr der Lage und all meiner Sinne. Und dennoch dreh ich fast durch.
Wie wirst Du dich dann erst anstellen  ;-)

So. Das wars, ich denk mal, ich hab Dir den Mund wässrig genug gemacht, Du kannst loslegen und viel Spaß wüns....

...ähm, was? Du bist noch gar nicht überzeugt? Puh, da hat wohl jemand hohe Ansprüche, oder wie? Pfft.

Na dann kriegst Du eben noch ein Kaufargument und ich wollte Dir ja auch drei Gruselgründe aufzählen, also stimmts schon mit Deiner Nörgelei. Also Obacht und spitz die Ohren:

Die STORY ists! Ja was denn sonst? Die ist nämlich der Hammer. Du wachst ohne Gedächtnis in einer Irrenanstalt auf und allein das definiert ja das Horrorgenre total von Grund auf neu, oder?
Ja, ich weiß, ein echter Meilenstein. 
Aber wenn Dir dieser visionäre Ansatz vielleicht auch noch nicht reicht, dann lass Dir gesagt sein: Es wird wirklich noch besser, es gibt schreckliche Kometen mit Grauen aus den Tiefen des Alls und Dörfer voller grässlich entstellter Horror Kinder und und und....

Und jahaaaa, ich weiß, das sind wirklich die hinterletzten Horror Klischees, aber die sind eben richtig gut rüber gebracht. Die Atmosphäre ist unendlich unangenehm, es wird auch mal eklig, verstörend und grausam. 
In der Spoiler Zone (die ich Dir natürlich nicht verrate) gibts ein paar schicke Wendungen und fiese Twists, nur um Dich am Ende nochmal so richtig mental durch den Wolf zu drehen. Das wirst Du nicht kommen sehen, darauf würd ich wetten.

Den Sound gibts noch obendrauf, vertont komplett in deutsch und klasse gemacht, damals war sowas bei Adventures noch drin, ein Wahnsinn oder?
Und auch ansonsten gibts sehr angenehme (ähm, ich meine unangenehme) Suspense Klänge aufs Ohr, das dunkle Piano wird Dich bis in Deine Träume verfolgen...

Du siehst also, im Grunde kriegst Du hier, was viele Horror Games heutzutage verlernt haben. Unreal Engine anschmeißen und paar Jump Scares im Grusel Wald zusammen klöppeln ist nett, aber gibts eben auch wie Sand am Meer.
Hier gibts stattdessen eine wirklich durchdachte, ausgefeilte Geschichte, mit Wendungen und toller Charakterzeichnung. Und dadurch entsteht eben ein Nähe zu den Figuren, die einen wirklich tief erschaudern lässt und nicht nur kurz hochschrecken, weil irgendein Buh-Männlein mal wieder aus dem Schrank oder Kornfeld gehüpft kam.
Das kannst Du Dir ruhig mal gönnen, obs Dir taugt wirst Du selbst entscheiden müssen, aber für die paar Euros ists wohl gut angelegte Zeit und Geld. 

Also hopp! Ab mit Dir in die althergebrachte fies beklemmende 2D Klapse und...

...viel Spaß beim Gruseln  ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074058337', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1641372107}
review:
Psicológicamente es bastante interesante a la hora de abarcar el trauma y el panorama que el aparato psíquico tiende a mostrar; bajo ciertos estados mentales al borde de la pérdida del juicio de realidad. 
Cada personaje tiene algo valioso qué ofrecer, presentando personalidades muy llamativas y outfits muy creativos. 
Debo destacar lo bien trabajado que están los diálogos e interacciones, logrando de la mano de su banda sonora, una inmersión muy enriquecedora durante la experiencia.
Los puzzles fueron un dolor de cabeza, algo que un amante de lo difícil amará, al menos hasta el punto en que te saque de quicio. 
Sí, tiene bugs y movimientos muy toscos que a ratos te harán fallar, generando frustración, sin embargo, debemos tomar en cuenta el que es una obra del año 98´.
Finalmente, lo recomiendo a pesar de los años, los gráficos no son una bomba (por razones obvias), pero deja mucho a la imaginación, lo cuál se agradece bastante tomando en cuenta su clasificación. Quizá el único aspecto que no me agradó llegado a cierto punto, fue una asociación que me pareció algo ridícula; A pesar de ello, se entiende el mensaje que buscaban generar. 
Pasando por alto dicha sección del juego (*ejem, evitando spoilers*), en general me pareció una experiencia mayormente placentera como consumidor del género, además de su estilo de juego e historia ofrecida.

review:
This game is fucking awesome! a true classic adventure game and a great game to play for people to dip there toes into the genre. From the music, atmosphere, environments, characters, voice acting, and story this game is an A+

the gameplay itself is pretty clunky as most old adventure games are....you'll probably need a walk-through.. but its worth uncovering the horrors of this fucking nightmare just for the visuals and presentation alone! there was a lot of heart put into this game and it includes very early CG renders which are awesome. id love to see a graphic adventure game project done in the same exact way but with crazy rendering capabilities of modern engines!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006307275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1639503880}
review:
This Point&Click adventure feels like a curious artefact from a bygone era, that succesfully manages to establish a vivid and somehow dizzying gameplay experience, with decent graphics and competent dubbing.

The player is tasked with making rhyme or reason of many bizarre and varied settings, whose relationship is made progressively clear by the beautifully animated video sequences, that punctuate the game most important moments.

The archaic, somehow inexplicably byzantine interface, makes it painfully evident how much videogames of this genre have evolved in the last two decades... and the decision to make some crucial gameplay sequences depend on the most frustrating movement controls I have ever seen, left me baffled and perplexed.

There's absolutely no hand-holding here: the player often has to leave their "comfort zone", try many object combinations, hunt for pixels, explore every possible nook and cranny of the map to make any progress whatsoever.

The reward is a very good story, with a likable protagonist, that explores a lot of themes that can potentially resonate with the player, even long after the game is over.

review:
This is an excellent point-and-click adventure game and one of my favorites for sure. Emulated it way back when and I finally got this copy for a second-run and it still surprisingly holds up, despite the last few chapters starting to get overly difficult and abstract with the puzzles. 

The voice acting in the game is pretty decent! I'd say it even saves the actual plot at points from being too cheesy. It's a game I'd recommend for someone looking for a point-and-click *horror* definitely, as it does a good job being both creepy and emotionally poignant with it's story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209232736', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2317, 'last_played': 1686455469}
review: I absolutely love this game; after playing other retro point and click horrors like I Have No Mouth And I Must Scream I wanted to look into more older psychological horrors and boy wasn't this a good choice! While the graphics and voice acting can be quite dated in my opinion it only adds to the eerie atmosphere. There's one frustrating thing about it and I must admit the combat can be.. quite stiff controls wise, for those sequences I recommend linking a controller or getting a mouse. The writing and story telling is great, honestly putting a summary here doesn't give this experience any justice! My heart ached, I deeply connected and feared for the fate of the characters to be honest in some more emotional moments I was on the verge of tears. Now unlike most of these retro point and clicks I would say the puzzles aged well, they are challenging but fair if you do enough digging in the environment the answers are hidden in plain sight no bullshit like finding a tiny obscure pixel at the corner of your screen. The game is very clever and along with it's fairly reasonable price I strongly recommend it.

Интереснейший квест с трогательным сюжетом, который вполне может заставить вас плакать. Все головоломки максимально логичны (и не сложные) - от вас требуется исключительно внимательность в их решении и внимательный осмотр локаций.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999444092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1632073893}
review:
Очень неплохой квест времен 90-х. Шедевром на все времена игру не назовешь, но сочетание графического оформления и сюжета очень сильно цепляет, также не подкачала музыка. Бьёт в тему. Спасибо стимовцам, за нормально работающую копию, до этого имел её образ с соответствующих источников, и вот та работала с проблемами. Конкретно - была проблема с цветом, здесь же всё работает без нареканий. Кстати, на игру с данного источника, спокойно можно накатать русскую озвучку и русский язык в меню, найти несложно - поверьте. 
И ещё маленькое замечание тем, кто поставит русскую озвучку и текст. В одной из последних глав необходимо добыть элемент воды, так вот...без прохождения добыть не получиться, т.к. наши локализаторы не совсем точно перевели речь NPC, и подсказка для решения к сожалению теряется.

review: Fun game from when I was a kid :) I do recommend it.. it has a basic story and some fun puzzles... although... it's sluggish for the modern gamer for sure and also there is one annoying thing that I have encountered which is that sometimes cutscenes don't always play or don't play till the end... good thing you can replay them though :) Classical point and click game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971284198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1633501036}
review:
Late 90's point 'n click horror classic!

It has a pretty interesting horror story, all dubbed characters, some cheeky lines, and a sorta dark humor to it... but it's gonna be all spoiled if you don't have the patience for it.
Biggest problem - your character is excruciatingly slow, and to add insult to injury, there are a ton of go fetch and come back to use objectives that always takes you from one side of the map to another... which means a whole ton of back and forth where you will be waiting a lot for your character to just move around.
It really wouldn't be a problem for me, if the character moved like 5x faster.

In line with some point 'n click adventure games of the era, there's also lots of stuff that's not all that clear, a bit subjective, or perhaps seemingly made complex just for the sake of extending the game. This is a problem lots of point 'n click games have... stuff like you need a tool to get something, there should be multiple ways to go around this, but nope, you need the friggin very specific tool or you just can't advance.

Again, this would've been a minor thing... if it didn't compound with dealing with the character sluggish pace.
So what ends happening A LOT in this game, particularly if you are not following a walkthrough, is that you get to a corner of the scenario/map, and then go - that's not right, maybe it's the other thing I didn't try just yet... OMFG, this means I have to go to the other corner of the map just to try it, which means 5 minutes of holding the damn right mouse button guiding the character there. Then after the whole ordeal, you get there, and it's also not that... and then you give up.

So there ya go... is it a bad game? Nope, it's a classic. And incredibly, it'd be a totally awesome game if the character just walked faster or there was an option to make him do it. 
So, I still recommend it for the story... it's just weird to have an interesting game like this ruined by a single mechanic. 

Perhaps there are more problems ahead since I didn't play the game a whole lot just yet... but I ran out of patience.
It looks very dated being over 2 decades old and all, but again, I wouldn't really mind the looks if it wasn't for the mechanics problem... because it has that typical, if not a bit trope-y stereotypical 90s horror. xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198065925094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1631684965}
review:
Pretty cool game. Not as long as I was expecting and the ending was a bit abrupt and a bit predictable, but worth a play-through at least once, I think. 

I managed to do the whole game without looking up anything except during the Aztec bit, but it was partially my fault because I didn't talk to the right person, but I had no idea that I had to! Overall, I'd say the Aztec part is the worst and that maze is fairly annoying, but it's not terrible, the circus is pretty cool and the parts in the asylum are quite good. The puzzles aren't very hard so don't expect a significant challenge, but I think it's substantial enough for the price point.

The game definitely starts stronger than it finishes I would say, everything up to the Aztec level is quite good, although the final level is also not too bad, but not as good as some of the earlier levels.

review: If you're looking for a creepy, atmospheric and thought-provoking old-school point and click adventure game, look no further than Sanitarium. Despite clunky game mechanics and some irritatingly difficult puzzles, Sanitarium's moving story, haunting soundtrack and beautifully macabre art design make it well worth checking out. I'll certainly never forget playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067959018', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1279, 'last_played': 1629664557}
review:
[b] Hikaye [/b]

Hava fırtınalı, gökyüzünü büsbütün kaplamış kara bulutlardan düşen yağmur damlaları yeri dövüyor ve biz tüm heycanımızla biniyoruz arabamıza. Sonrasında belkide en sevdiğimiz şarkıların olduğu cd'yi takıyoruz cd çalara. O çalmaya devam ettikçe basıyoruz gaza. Tehlike işaret eden levhalar geçiyor gözümüzden sıra sıra. Eh...kaza yapmak için gerekli olan tüm şartları sağladığımıza göre tahmin edebileceğiniz üzere "La ne oluyor?" demeye kalmadan yuvarlanıyoruz uçurumdan aşağıya.

Gözlerimizi küçücük kasvetli bir odada açıyoruz. Kulaklarımızda rahatsız edici alarm sesi eşliğinde et ile kemiğin taştan duvara çarpışının kanlı sesi var. Ne buraya nasıl geldiğimizi ne de kim olduğumzu hatırlıyoruz. Etrafımıza bakınmak için odadan dışarı çıktığımızda ise daha büyük süpriz ile karşılaşıyoruz.

Kendimizi dehşetin içerisinde, bir akıl hastanesinde buluveriyoruz. Buradan bir çıkış yolu aramaya karar vermemiz sonucu mavi önlüğümüz ve yüzümüzdeki bandajımızla beraber hayal gücünün ve deliliğin sınırlarında uzunca bir süre dolaşacağımız hikayemiz başlamış oluyor.

Bu kısmı uzun uzun anlatmak istedim çünkü oyun 98 yapımı olmasına rağmen daha en başından beni etkilemeyi başardı. Merakımın tetiklenmesi çok doğaldı aslında çünkü ne ben onun kim olduğunu biliyordum ne de o kim olduğunu biliyordu ve ikimiz de nereye düştüğümüzü anlamaya çalışıyorduk. Bunun yanında bir de oyunun atmosferi ve tüylerimi diken diken eden müzikler eklenince içine sürüklenmemek elde değildi.

Chapter chapter gittikçe aydınlanacağınız biraz karışık bir zaman çizelgesine sahip sevimli oyunumuz. Lakin sevimli dediğime aldanmayın içinizi parçalayacak çok şey göreceksiniz.
Tabii kanaatimce içinizi tek parçalayacak şey hikaye ve gördükleriniz olmayacak...işte karşınızda oynanış kısmı !

[b] Oynanış [/b]

Galiba oyunda tek beğenmediğim kısım olabilir. Point&click severim aslında ama oyunun 98 yılının imkanlarıyla yapılmasının getirdiği bir rahatsızlık vardı üstümde. Yaşlı mekanikler kendilerini hissettiriyordu.( oyunu 2021 yılında oynadığım düşünülecek olursa gayet normal) 

Oyunun bulmacaları gayet güzeldi: ne çok zordu ne de çok kolay lakin gerekli mataryalleri toplama kısmı beni dağlara taşlara vurdu, kanser etti. Hayatımda hiç 3 saat boyunca bir labut arayacağımı düşünmemiştim...(bu sadece örneklerden biri) Kısacası oyunu oynarken gözünüzü dört açmalı aktif bir şekilde diyalogları ve mekanı takip etmelisiniz.
Bunun yanı sıra oyun zevkinizi korumak istiyorsanız müsait olduğunuz her an save almalısınız. Ne demiş atalarımız: "Bug geliyorum demez." çat diye vurur kafanıza en baştan oynamak zorunda kalırsınız.

Toparlayacak olursak: Sanitarium'a kesinlikle bir şans verin derim. Oynarken yeri gelecek hüzünleneceksiniz yeri gelecek güleceksiniz. Tic tac toe oynamayı yeniden öğrenirken aklın sınırlarının ötesine geçecek ve kim bilir belkide kendinizle yüzleşeceksiniz. sağlıcakla kalın iyi okumalar, iyi oyunlar: )

author: {'steamid': '76561198929186712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1668967108}
review:
Отличный олдовый квест! Получила невероятное удовольствие от всепоглощающей шизы, преследовавшей персонажа и меня все 13 уровней. Именно загадки не такие уж и сложные, но очень много "угадай, в какой последовательности нажимать плитки", немного взбесило. Играли 17 часов, было очень интересно, чем кончится эта дичь. Сюжет очень интересный, прям затягивает, на одном месте даже чуть не заплакала. 
Минусы: 
1) иногда сложно управлять персонажем, он идёт, куда хочет
2) персонаж оочень медленно ходит, кроме личности гимуолла (вот бы все так бегали, как он!)
3) загадки на поиск предметов (именно Того Самого Камня, любой не подойдёт). Но это можно простить, у персонажа же шиза.
4) в одном месте не было перевода на русский, а именно с этим связана загадка: нужно было составить из букв предложение. Пришлось открыть гайд, каюсь.
Плюсы: всё остальное
1) офигительный эмоциональный перевод
2) диалоги и надписи на надгробиях
3) шутки 
4) сюжет
5) в общем, вся атмосфера игры, пропитанная даже страхом немного. Искренне сочувствуешь персонажам, особенно в ветке с детьми и растениями.
6) я получила все ачивки, я добилась этого (потому что я тоже немного того). Я счастлива до безумия, ибо последнюю ачивку (поговори со всеми) не могла получить очень долго. Слава шизам, я сохраняла каждый уровень в отдельной ячейке (и вам советую) и, с ужасом поняв в конце игры, что последней ачивки нет, пробежалась по уровнять и поговорила с Китсаткуатлем этим сраным, оказывается, так можно было. 
Сохраняйтесь почаще (особенно важно для получения ачивки про правильно сыгранную с первого раза мелодию), говорите со всеми, нажимайте на всё, и вы тоже сможете получить 20 из 20. 
Спасибо разработчикам и переводчикам, не пожалела, была довольна, но жопа периодически сгорала (уровни, где нужна быстрота, ловкость и сосредоточенность, я поручала парню).
Оценка: 8,5/10, топ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198977862134', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1689186802}
review:
Sanitarium is an amazing horror/thriller classic adventure point-and-click game with interesting mystery and plot twists. It elaborates on the classic motif of recovering from a kind of traumatic coma and trying to figure out what happened and what's going on. It's getting even more complicated when it turns out that [spoiler]you've not only suffered physical damage but you're also considered insane and are currently a patient in an asylum[/spoiler].

The oldschool graphics may seem outdated to some players, but for me it only adds charm to all these at times picturesque and colourful and at times dark and viscious, and yet at all times grotesque locations that we visit throughout the game. It reminds me much of the good old days of Diablo II and evokes much nostalgia.

The music is quite atmospheric as well, and emphasises the events of the game, enhancing the experience of horror and mystery throughout levels. The cutscenes and the sound may seen quite outdated, nevertheless the voice acting in the game is absolutely top notch.

Despite the game being over two decades old, it feels and plays really smoothly. The controls are incredibly simple and you only need one hand and a mouse to navigate through the game. The not much dexteriety is required, so it's a nice and relaxing experience overall. The interface is very intuitive and there is just the bare minimum of HUD, which allows you to fully sink into the world of Sanitarium. The puzzles are at times simple, and at times quite difficult but it's all nicely balanced, so that you don't get tired easily.

Max and all the other characters in all the different levels are well pretty well written and marvellously protrayed by the actors. We often change environment in the game and all the aspects of these new surroundings only make them more intriguing, never boring or tedious to go through. There aren't many repetitive features in the levels we explore or the characters we meet, and there is always space for some humor in these interractions, which is pretty nice given the emotional burden the plot carries.

Sanitarium is one of the few oldchool games that I'll always want to come back to, so it's definitely worth trying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159465271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1626612248}
review:
[h1]精神分析与原教旨AVG的碰撞[/h1]

上世纪末，起源于欧洲的精神分析曾在美国影视娱乐圈掀起一阵风潮，大卫林奇的《双峰镇》、《妖夜慌踪》、《穆赫兰道》等片时至今日也被一小撮影迷顶礼膜拜。不知是否受此影响，1998年发售的《疯人院》也以穿插着“弗洛伊德”式怪诞的梦境为舞台，演绎了一个血腥、残暴却也充满温情的故事。

游戏开篇，在车祸中失忆的男主角Max从地狱一般的精神病院中醒来，开始了自己的冒险。作为一款“原教旨”AVG游戏，《疯人院》没有如何RPG元素，玩家要做的就是通过破解一个个谜题、推进剧情发展。因此，谜题设计、情节和人物设定以及两者的结合是此类游戏的能否吸引玩家的关键因素。

[b]天马行空却不失合理的谜题设计[/b]
AVG游戏的一大挑战就是谜题既要富于新意、有一定难度，又需要在游戏场景下具备 “合理性”，让玩家可通过环境观察、人物对话等方式，确定行动目标、推理达成目标的手段。最避讳的就是为解谜而解谜、与情节缺乏关联的谜题设计。《疯人院》在这一点上做的不错，大部分谜题都有较强的目的性和逻辑性，有一定经验的玩家可以比较容易地享受推理解谜的乐趣。另一方面，游戏各章节的场景和人物设计变化极大，谜题种类丰富，较好地保存了游戏后期解谜的新鲜感。

[b]怪诞却精彩的剧情表演[/b]
除了恰到好处的谜题设计，《疯人院》的剧情演出也非常棒，不仅讲了一个跌宕起伏的故事，也将一个个谜题串联为一个有机整体，充分发掘了游戏作为互动体验的给玩家带来的乐趣。看过《双峰镇》、《穆赫兰道》等片的同学应该记得，电影中的场景变换不按照“客观常理”进行，却依照某种通常存在于梦境的“潜意识线”推进。正是这些晦暗的“潜意识线”，衔接了《疯人院》各章节怪诞却大相径庭的场景。根据精神分析的“理论（其实就是伪科学）”，梦境与现实之间存在着精妙复杂的映射关系，看似平淡的日常透过梦境的重构，也会波谲云诡。游戏男主Max的破解谜题的过程，也不过是他战胜心魔、重寻自我的过程，玩家不仅要跟随Max一起经历一连串怪诞的冒险，还要通过游玩过程中闪现的记忆碎片和象征隐喻，还原Max在现实世界的经历。这种拼图游戏一样的叙事，在解谜之上又为玩家增添了一层新的乐趣。

总之，如果你不排斥（甚至很感兴趣）怪诞的精神分析类影视作品，且不会为解谜感到头痛，《疯人院》是独一无二的佳作。

author: {'steamid': '76561198031948013', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1627235345}
review:
Plot is great. Visuals too. Atmospheric. I realy like it.
But character movement speed is hightly frustrating. Gameplay is very repetitive, and by that i mean : chapter is starting, you sloooooooowly walk around, talk with every npc/press any available conversations, you try to find items (it means that you need to find that looks like an item to pick up, then you need to inspect this item, and only then you can pick it up),  then you try to find puzzles to solve, then you realise that you dont have "key items" to solve a puzzle (because sometimes you just cant pick up things if game decides that you dontt need them) which means backtracking aka "slooooooowly going back". Repeat.
I understand that back in 90s it was , how most of the people in the comment section call it, - HIDDEN GEM ( i agree with that at some point), but...you know, its not 90s anymore, face with it already. Modern games are exist, and even if  not everyone of them have the same  great storytelling and atmosphere (like Sanitarium) - atleast they have improved gameplay or else.
Its hard to enjoy a story while your ass is on fire,because of things i mentioned earlier.
In my opinion, if you are realy into this kind of games and you are patient enough - you will get a satisfaction while playing, no doubt. 
Othervise i cant reccomend it.

PROS:

CONS:
- Controls are absolutely HORRID!
- Some puzzles make no sense. You will need a walkthrough to move forward.

Sometimes you have to drag on. But the story makes up for it, so it is recommendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118419789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1610649839}
review:
Pensa numa jogabilidade horrível... Pensa numa movimentação podre e lenta... Pensa num jogo cuja mecânica não envelheceu bem... Isso é Sanitarium.

Agora pensa, por um momento bem curto, em uma narrativa simplesmente IMPECÁVEL. Tente se lembrar de um livro ou um conto maravilhoso, com uma ambientação perfeitamente plausível e convincente, que te prendeu do ínicio ao fim e te deixou ansioso pra fazer tudo de novo, em busca de uma compreensão cada vez maior de todo o universo em questão. ISSO É SANITARIUM.

Da vontade de morrer a cada 2 segundos toda vez que o personagem vai pro lugar errado numa velocidade de aproximadamente 0m/s ? SIM, LITERALMENTE TODA HORA. 
Da vontade de esmurrar a tela do pc toda vez que você trava em um puzzle não por conta do seu QI mixuruca, mas sim porque o puzzle em si é mal feito? SIM, LITERALMENTE TODA HORA 2.0.

PORÉM, como eu disse, o enredo e a ambientação desse jogo faz tudo valer a pena. Ainda que assistir uma gameplay completa do jogo seja a forma menos nociva pra sua sanidade mental, eu realmente acredito que passar por esse sufoco por meio do seu próprio esforço é muito recompensador, te permite absorver toda a atmosfera do jogo e conhecer com profundidade todas as personagens, suas motivações, suas sinas, seus desejos, seus arrependimentos, suas frustações... É um f 0 d e n d o livrão interativo.

review:
Sanitarium is a fun, classic point & click horror/puzzle game from the late 90's that will bring you right back to your childhood. It has a well designed story with really cool environments. I really like the creepy places and vibes that all symbolize something special to your character, Max. Brace yourself for some interesting puzzles, some simple, others you'll be pulling your hair out trying to solve them. Bosses are easy, you will not be struggling with any of them, especially because you have unlimited lives.

The only issue I had with this game was the movement controls. The game suffers from the same issue with all games in the genre, the controls are awful. Once you get used to them, it isn't so bad, but I found myself mistakenly going up & down the same set of stairs because of the cursor positioning. Very minor complaint given when this game was made, and it certainly doesn't take away from anything.

Overall I highly recommend to anyone that loves the aesthetic and is a fan of classic point & click games!

author: {'steamid': '76561199179708539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1625143381}
review:
“Sanitarium” - 1998 - from DreamForge Intertainment, DotEmu. 

~ A Classic Point & Click thriller based in dark, psychological horror with a heroically moral story layered in-between. ~

“After begin injured in a car accident, Max Laughton wakes with no memory of who he is or why he is in what appears to be an insane asylum. 
As you play, Max is thrown into increasingly bizarre & surreal scenarios. From being transported to a rundown town full of mutated children & no parents to be found, to an ancient Aztec village tormented by Quetzalcoatl. Max becomes increasingly unsure whether anything that occurs is real or just the deterioration of his mental state as he falls into actual insanity.”

For me, this game is a wonderfully surreal experience rather than one of pure horror. It’s made with, what feels like, a  well established, unsettling atmosphere from beginning to end. 

While some (maybe most?) of the puzzles are not complex they can give you some struggle if you are not paying attention to details or your surrounds. But, admittedly, this game is forgiving & pushes you to continue.

From the tone of the music & art-style, to the cultural references & comments on morality & mortality, everything feeds so well into one another to give you an unsettling but rewarding adventure. 

Sometimes there are areas that are a little muddled or confusing to make your way through or items that become hard to spot. However, it really only adds to the unnerving & mysterious settings that you land in from the very beginning, which is very much the intention.

I would absolutely encourage anyone to grab it & play. More so, I’d implore those who feel nostalgic for point & click adventures games, who love a twisted story that is rewarding & who enjoy a look into maybe some more adult topics & imagery to purchase this classic!

Thank-you for reading.
Lynti  ก(≈ඒᆽඒ≈)ค

review:
J'ai beaucoup aimé ce jeu, l'histoire est fascinante autant que les graphismes, qui ont certes vieillis, mais gardent un charme indéniable. Les énigmes sont bien pensées, et certaines m'ont même donné un peu de fil à retordre. Mais parce qu'il y a toujours un mais, même plusieurs pour ce jeu, la maniabilité, à la souris en tout cas est affreuse, et pour la fin qui demande un peu de précision c'était un peu énervant. Mais ma plus grosse déception reste la fin. Je m'attendais à un final plus long et peut-être plus épique. Le jeu est incroyable et sème des cinématiques cryptiques tout du long, mais pour la fin, on a le droit qu'à une petite cinématique de quelques secondes. 
Le jeu est à faire absolument, pour son ambiance et son histoire surtout, mais le final ne lui rend pas du tout honneur.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017596953', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1624394563}
review:
[h1] Прохождение длиной в 23 года [/h1]

 Впервые этот квест увидел в ныне почившем журнале Game.EXE 8го августовского выпуска 1998го года. 
Был там в конце полный солюшн на неё. Так как компьютера в 98ом у меня не было - максимум, что я мог тогда делать это пускать слюни на картинки-скрины из игры и мечтать, что вот я в неё обязательно поиграю.
 Каким то невероятным стечением обстоятельств, но мне удалось поиграть в неё всё в том же 98ом на инглише у своего друга, который (в отличии от меня) на тот момент имел свой 133ий. Стоит ли говорить, что игра взорвала наши детские мозги и разметала куски по всей квартире. Но, как бы мы не дристали кирпичами от радости а знанием языка мы в то время не обладали (да я и щас не бельмеса), а значит пройти дальше второго уровня у нас не получилось, да и играли мы не много. Но что такое второй уровень? Это город с полуразложившимися детьми мутантами, где атмосфера дала нам по шарам ещё сильнее, так что мы сильно не переживали, когда игра пошла по рукам, как это частенько практиковалось в то время. 
 Второе знакомство с игрой произошло в 2001ом, когда у меня появился свой кудахтер, который по характеристикам не шибко отличался от компьютера моего друга. Русская версия от Логруса все дела. Там я уже прошёл гораздо дальше, до кладбища с крематорием. Вот только как в той поговорке "жили хорошо, а вам хорошо? будет xyeвo". Диск был весь в царапинах и мой 8ми скоростной знававший лучшие времена сидиром отказывался читать и переходить на следующий уровень.
 Шли годы, я уже давно забыл об Санитариуме Шизариуме. Но с появлением безлимитного интернета в 2007ом я начал выкачивать старенькие игры, которые удалось вспомнить и с которыми у меня были тёплые воспоминания. Вспомнил я и про Санитариум. Версия на двух дисках, странно, вроде я помню что она была на трёх, ну да ладно. Скачал, поставил и вот я вновь погрузился в эту шизанутую атмосферу с головой. Но и тут мне показали кукиш. После уровня деревни ацтеков игра вылетала с ошибкой.
[i] И что я только ни делал, я и бил её и орал на неё(С) [/i]
Прогуглив - решения я так и не нашёл. Вроде кто то писал, что нужна версия на трёх дисках а не на двух. Но к сожалению на тот момент версии на трёх дисков я в свободном скачивании не нашёл и забил на всё это дело большой прибор.
 Прошло ещё нцать лет и вот вижу чисто случайно Шизариум родненький, продаётся в стиме, надо брать. И вновь я с головой в той поехавшей атмосфере и вновь не могу оторваться от прохождения. Да и тут меня ожидали трудности, как глав героя. За момент прохождения у меня пару раз ломались скрипты, игра зависала и три раза успела вывалиться с ошибкой. Но я её прошёл!
                                                                             
                                                                          [b]Я ПРОШЁЛ!!! [/b]


И я доволен как слон. Очередное белое пятно в моей "геймерской карьере" закрашено.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000896253', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1599435131}
review:
7/10 Good.

Released in 1998, this game definitely shows its age. It is clunky and odd, like an elderly person plodding along with their cane.

But it is the type of elderly person that can weave a wonderfully fascinating tale. Taking place in an asylum for the insane, with our hero being one of the patients within, we delve into reality and non-reality as our protagonist battles with his mind.

It is surreal and unusual and it all works fairly well thanks to some solid writing, dialogue and voice acting (for the time period). There’s plenty to keep you guessing, is it real? Is it just psychotic? Are their layers of truth within? They’re all real questions to ask, and the journey to answer those questions is just one wild trip all the way through.

The ending could potentially leave you with a lot of questions, piecing together everything that has happened is up for interpretation. If you have this, definitely get round to playing it sooner, because being such an old game you really don’t need to let it get any older as it’s gaming systems aren’t going to age like fine wine. For now, it’s just about tolerable in terms of controls, but it is worth putting up with for the mind-bending experience of psychological horror/thriller that is something of a rarity thesedays.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165837265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1622389495}
review:
Mi sono divertita con questo giochino. Capisco che possa non avere un grande effetto sul pubblico moderno ma a me è piaciuto comunque. A volte il sistema di movimento può risultare frustrante perché il personaggio si incastra vicino alle pareti e il fatto di salire e scendere le scale in blocco a volte è fastidioso. Tutto sommato però le atmosfere sono molto interessanti e il tutto risulta abbastanza inquietante. Non spaventoso... ma inquietante di sicuro. Credo che il miei segmenti preferiti siano i primi due... dell'Asylum ed il villaggio... e poi la villa in cui guidavamo la bambina. Non so perché ma c'era un qualcosa di molto affascinante nell'atmosfera della villa.
La frustrazione comunque è reale anche perché mi è capitato di rimanere incastrata non tanto perchè non sapessi cosa fare, ma perchè per come era disegnato il paesaggio, non si poteva neanche immaginare che ci fosse un qualcosa in una certa direzione ghghghghg. E anche un paio di enigmi erano seriamente enigmatici. Niente di impossibile ma... più che altro proprio a livello di comprensione ahahaha. Sd ogni modo... credo di aver comperato questo giorno durante un'offerta e non me ne sono pentita per nulla. Rigiocabilità zero come tutte le avventure di questo tipo... ma ne è valsa la pena.

review:
I love this game, I played it when it first came out and have always loved the story and characters. I was so glad when it came to steam since it was becoming hard to run the disk version I had, due to years of use. 
While this might not hold up to the current games out there, it is well worth the play especially for the absolute uniqueness of the levels and puzzles and how each different character and level plays into the overall plot. I mean heck the first level with the creepy kids, the corn patch, and that song still haunts me. 
I would absolutely love if this game is very remastered as I think it still has a lot to offer and with updated graphic and game play more people could enjoy this wonderful title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105058204', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1619032896}
review:
[h1] Out! I wanna OUT! [/h1]

Старый и очень не добрый квест - глоток свежего воздуха из далёкого прошлого. Ни поиска предметов, ни дурацких головоломок, ни сбора всевозможного мусора, чтобы смастерить квестовый предмет. Расспрос персонажей, сбор пары предметов, сложные головоломки.

На протяжении 13 уровней наш персонаж будет то погружаться в пучины своего безумия, то выплывать на поверхность реальности... и не сказать, что там всё адекватней, чем в глубинах болезненного сознания. В безумных видениях наш герой будет перевоплощаться в других людей и существ, дабы восстановить утраченные воспоминания и осознать, что ему может грозить в реальности.

Жуткое озвучание персонажей и созданий на уровнях. Маньяческая музыка. Причудливые и искажённые безумием локации. Всё это - прекрасное наполнение квеста.

Единственное, к чему я хочу придраться - неудобное управление перемещений персонажа. Чтобы заставить героя двигаться, нужно зажать правую кнопку мыши и движением указать направление. Если рядом с персонажем лестница и мы решим пройти к ней впритык, персонаж обязательно перейдёт на лестницу! Ну а в последнем уровне все недостатки такого управления приведут к нескольким прохождениям одного и того же места!

author: {'steamid': '76561198888668726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1616873585}
review: Когда я начала играть было очень интересно, все таки играем мы за психбольного с которым происходит паранормальщина всякая. Это очень любопытно. Особенно мне понравилась локация города населенного детьми, также сюжетка про Сару достаточно неплохая. Когда началась сюжетная линия майя мне уже надоело играть. Мне в целом не близка тематика древних цивилизаций, не интересно это. Для меня это самый весомый минус который мешает пройти игру до конца. Все что предшествовало этой сюжетке мне весьма понравилось. Игру проходила с русификатором, заранее предупрежу что загадка с подбором кода к двери локализована очень криво и решается методом тыка разве что. В остальном могу рекомендовать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035085257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1618959605}
review:
mmmmm, du loin que ma mémoire puisse m'emmener je n'avais pas joué à ce classique des années 90 mais évidemment que je le connaissais de nom et de renom ce Sanitarium, un jeu qui a marqué de son empreinte l'histoire des jeux d'aventures. Ce fut 5 ans après gabriel knight, 3 ans après phantasmagoria,  1 an après diablo. Si je mentionne ces trois maginifiques jeux ce n'est pas pour rien : on y retrouve des points communs avec celui-ci, mais je n'en dirais pas plus ici.
 
sur le plan technique,
* visuellement, c'est un déplacement en vue perspective isométrique avec quelques séquences FMV pour l'avancement de l'histoire. les décors et environnements sont travaillés, l'imagination a été à l'ouvrage chez les créateurs.
* la qualité du son est à noter tout particulièrement, celui-ci a un rôle très important (jusque dans l'interface de menu) et d'ailleurs le jeu est disponible dans beaucoup de langues, c'est un signe.
* côté jouabilité, l'idée du déplacement via le clic droit est assez bizarre mais on s'y fait à la longue, et pour accéder à l'inventaire il faut cliquer sur votre personnage (j'apporte ces précisions car le jeu ne vous l'explique pas)

mais le plus important est ailleurs:
côté énigmes et interactions c'est assez faible, l'accent est vraiment mis sur la découverte de chaque scène, ce qui est assez logique au vu de la progression de votre personnage. car oui le thème du jeu est quasi unique (et attention les âmes sensibles) et l'ambiance du jeu est très particulière (ou bien est-ce l'inverse).  Avec ce qu'il faut de FMV par touche pour susciter la découverte ou pour les différentes révélations, on vous prend (un peu de force j'en conviens) par la main pour naviguer de décors en décors, plein d'inquiétude et d'effroi.

aujourd'hui les slashers, films d'horreurs etc. ont  la cote, mais sachez qu'il y a plus de vingt ans un studio a décidé d'en faire un jeu d'aventure en point&click, du jamais vu jusqu'alors et ils ont réussi leur pari. c'était certes avec les moyens de l'époque et probablement pas avec tous les différents métiers du jeu vidéo d'aujourd'hui, mais ils y ont mis de l'huile de coude assurément.
si je continue cette évaluation je vais finir par faire l'exégèse du jeu et ce serait dommage et inutile donc je m'arrête là

pour terminer ces quelques lignes : Sanitarium vous dépeint le glauque, le monstrueux, interroge l'imaginaire et prône la lenteur. je valide.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975761700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1618000962}
review: This a good traditional point and click game. You visit many cool locations with interesting characters. The levels are not absurdly large, some point and clicks suffer this. Best of all, this game is fully voiced and it is great! The best part is playing Olmec: "Woman! What say you!" The story is entertaining with no sudden twists, you are more or less just along for the ride. You watch as Max loses his mind, then regains it! The only major annoyance is the movement. It is a bit slow for one. The bigger annoyance is how the levels are isometric (diagonally), but the controls tend to want to stick to the straight directions. Though, a few games during this era have this problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997529422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1617427420}
review: Buy it now.  I don't know why I waited so long to play this.  Yeah, its an older game.  And for that it actually has creativity, an intelligent plot, mature themes, and an epic fight for what's good amidst lunacy and very dark places.  Its free from liberal, political bias, its free from the ridiculous ideologies being used to tear the nation apart, its free from the stale, bland soap box most brand new games are full of.  Pure entertainment with a creative, intelligent plot.  If you liked Harvester or I Have No Mouth And I Must Scream, you will LOVE this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115820587', 'num_games_owned': 3074, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1422967935}
review:
Le jeu date de 1998, et ça se ressent: lourdeur dans les déplacements et dans les contrôles en général, graphismes pixelisés qui peuvent parfois faire pleurer vos yeux de douleur, sons vraiment cheaps qui bousillent les oreilles. Les énigmes qui n'en sont pas vraiment, et le pixel hunting qui m'énerve au plus haut point maintenant que je suis habitué aux point'n click où il suffit d'appuyer sur un bouton pour mettre en valeur les éléments sur lesquels le joueur peut agir. Sans ça, point besoin de soluce, et j'aime pas ça, utiliser une soluce.

Mais en dehors de ça, mais quelle tuerie! Cette ambiance les amis! Mature, c'est le maitre mot. Un jeu qui traite correctement de l'introspection, de la maladie, de la médecine et surtout de la folie, même McGee n'a pas réussi cet exploit. C'est glauque, sale, mystérieux, morbide, sanglant, et en même temps profond et poétique, il faut y jouer pour comprendre.

Une nouvelle référence du point'n click pour moi.

review:
What can one say about classics?

Honestly nothing bad!

This game is pure classic; it even represents of meaning of classic. Perfect -and also sad- storyline, good musics and dialogues, fantastic drawings and relativly good playing time.

What the most I like about this game is that it is not treating you as a fool. You don't feel such feelings. One of the worst thing about this genre is extremely hard puzzles and almost none hints to solve. But this game has its own balance with those things. Puzzles are not so hard yet demands carefully observations of both environments and dialogues to solve them. That's all! With that, one can easily reach to the end but that does not mean the game is easy no! Not at all!

Then what this game is? Pure fun! With no doubt it is one of the 'must-be-experienced' games!

review:
[Quote]Per altre recensioni segui il nostro [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34310167]Curatore in lingua inglese[/url] e il nostro [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40165899]Curatore in lingua italiana[/url].[/Quote]

Cosa posso dire su Sanitarium, ci sarebbe così tanto ma al tempo stesso così poco da dire, per spiegare cosa sia stato per un'intera generazione di videogiocatori. C'è un motivo se ancora oggi è in vendita su tutte le maggiori piattaforme online.

Ero poco più che un ragazzo quando uscì, e per l'epoca era veramente inquietante... ma non lo giocai subito perché non potevo permettermelo. Qualche anno dopo, grazie alle macchine virtuali, riuscii ad ovviare a questa lacuna ma è oggi, con Steam, dopo più di 20 anni... che tante cose mi tornano in mente:

Sanitarium inquieta ancora, anche se la sua grafica ed il suo gameplay appartengono ad un'epoca ormai considerata preistoria, per questo campo. Perché, al contrario dei prodotti odierni, l'horror di Sanitarium non è nella grafica, o nel trucco del jumpscare ormai inflazionato... ma nella trama, nell'atmosfera, nella sensazione di angoscia che dà.

Non sono un fan dell'horror e men che meno dello splatter, oggi tanto di moda... per questo potete fidarvi se vi dico che con Sanitarium l'esperienza può essere diversa, potrebbe meravigliarvi.

Certo per ottimizzarla, quest'esperienza, bisognerebbe assicurarsi prima due punti fondamentali, però: in primis c'è bisogno che siate un po' cresciutelli e che vi ricordiate del periodo in cui uscì... o, se siete giovani, abbastanza maturi da capire che questo gioco ha probabilmente più anni di voi e cercare quindi di recuperare un po' dello spirito dell'epoca. Secondo poi non dovete avere fretta, non dovete essere tra quelli che vogliono tutto e subito, che giocano solo per avere più fps possibili o andare a duemila nel multiplayer del momento.

Qui c'è tutt'altro, qui ci sono le basi, la storia. Se poteste tornare indietro nel tempo cosa fareste, cerchereste il moderno o stareste attenti ad apprezzare ciò che la storia stessa avrebbe da offrirvi?


Posso riassumere così: se Sanitarium fosse portato ai giorni nostri, se qualcuno fosse in grado di dargli un aspetto moderno... beh non dovrebbe fare altro, non dovrebbe occuparsi d'altro che della grafica e del sonoro. 
E ne uscirebbe l'horror migliore di sempre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058557739', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1607002426}
review:
Hallo liebe Steam-Community,

Auf der Suche nach einem ansprechenden Point&Click-Abenteuer bin ich über Sanitarium gestolpert. Einem Spiel aus dem Jahr 1998 und trotzdem hat es mich nach den ersten Bildern nicht mehr losgelassen. Was für ein Wahnsinn sollte mich hier erwarten?

Pros:
-Detailreiche Level
-Spannende Geschichte
-Witzige kleine Rätsel zwischen den typischen Wimmelbild-Aufgaben
-Gruseliges Menü (Stimme)

Contras:
-Besonders die Sprünge zwischen den Gebieten können extrem verwirrend sein 
-Teilweise frustrierende Suche nach Gegenständen

Es ist ein schönes Abenteuer, das trotz seines Alters seinen Charme absolut nicht verloren hat. Es hat mich wirklich gefesselt und obwohl ich zwischen manchen Leveln das Problem hatte, den Anschluss zu finden, wollte ich weiterspielen. Immer wieder kann die Suche nach dem nächsten Schritt zur Verzweiflung führen, aber das gehört vermutlich einfach zu diesem Genre dazu!

Für mein erstes Point&Click-Spiel wollte ich etwas ganz Besonderes und das habe ich bekommen! Ich habe jetzt Lust auf mehr!

Let'sPlay-Playlist auf Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLVtuWiJLpxPEabaJSJHkvM57bg0Z27nPz

Mein Youtube-Kanal: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQp1F3-aw8EaI5kJhMAzhrA

Viel Spaß beim Spielen!

Ein schönes Wochenende euch Allen!

Euer ODIN

author: {'steamid': '76561198400466236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1614171326}
review:
即使从今天的眼光来看，疯人院仍旧是一款佳作。

优秀的游戏剧本，适当的流程长度，以及制作方天马星空的想象力，无疑是这部游戏最大的亮点。
游戏中看似凌乱的游戏场景变换，实际上是主人公Max思维意识的混杂，编剧通过一个个富有特色的游戏世界，为我们展示了主人公阴暗的内心世界。

当然，除了没有官方的正版中文之外，游戏右键行走的方式也是比较反人类，需要适应。

author: {'steamid': '76561198126850489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1611650456}
review:
The main issue I have with these old school adventure games (IHNMAIMS is another good example) is how uneven the tone of the story is. Sanitarium has some strong imagery, certain depiction of body horror and gore are strong and effective still today thanks to the incredible and timeless work the art department did in designing some of the most brutal sections (The Hive for example is a visual nightmare), and the writing reflects that, almost lovecraftian in describing the dread felt by the characters.

But then there are other sections filled with out of place humour or clearly toned down (i.e. most of the Lost Village or the Circus), required for some levity or just a way for the developers to have some fun with their game, but still way less impressive or memorable compared to what the game has accustomed the players to.

The story itself is pretty good but without much fanfare or twists, it wants to be a psychological thriller and horror but it plays very straight for most of the time and there isn't much room left for debate about what is going on or what the metaphors under each level mean. Not that being simple and direct is necessarily a flaw, but thematically speaking it felt like halfway through the game it had already played each of its cards and I was just left putting down the royal flush without tension or thinking required.

Also some puzzles are just a pixel nightmare dictated by noticing minute details that for the life of me are indistinguishable from the backgrounds, and the stairs' animation detection with this system of movement is trauma inducing.

Yet all in all it is certainly a timeless adventure game, son of the best the 90s had to offer despite some light missteps and almost consistently enjoyable visually, albeit clearly having some sections much weaker than others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044174896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1612658112}
review:
C'est un très bon jeu pour l'époque ! Même s'il a mal vieilli, il a toujours le charme de l'ancien qui agit sans aucun problème. C'est un jeu très particulier, unique, en terme d'ambiance et de direction artistique ! Sa plus grande force, le scénario, est aussi sa plus grande faiblesse : s'il nous gratifie d'une diversité d'ambiances très appréciables et dérangeantes, le gros problème c'est que l'histoire vire très vite au grand n'importe quoi sous prétexte de la "folie" du perso principal. Les niveaux s'enchaînent sans aucune cohérence, on se demande  ce qu'ils ont fumé les gars de chez DreamForge.

Doublages entièrement en Français, un très bon point à noter ! Super drôle le côté nanardesque qu'ils apportent au jeu.

Très bon point aussi : je suis assez étonné car sous Windows 10, le jeu n'a pour ainsi dire jamais planté, c'est nickel.

review: Ist wirklich nur den Fans der guten alten "Games to Remember" zu empfehlen, die dieses lustige Psychia-trie-tra-la-la-Abenteuer damals im Jahre 1998 (also vor ca. hundert Jahren) bereits einmal gespielt, und wie ich, sehr genossen haben. Aus heutiger Sicht sind die Zwischensequenzen im Film-Stil mit einer Aflösung von ca. 320x240 Pixel ein 256-Farben-Greuel und lauch die Auflösung im Spiel selbst mit ca. 512x384 Pixel wahrlich kein Augenschmaus mehr. Wohl dem, der das Spiel nicht in deutscher Sprachausgabe geniessen muss, denn diese ist ebenfalls, zumindest charakterabhängig, nicht sehr angenehm und klingt wie vorgelesen. Komisch, hat mich damals nicht so gestört.

review:
Great art style, fascinating setting and excellent writing. Definitely one of the best point and click adventure games out there. It's always a treat to discover what the next level holds.
Gameplay wise it's in a good place too, it doesn't play itself like modern adventure games, but it doesn't have convoluted puzzles and constant game overs either, despite how surreal it gets at times. I believe this may even be a good entry point for people interested in older adventure games.

review:
I don't know what to say other than this is a masterpiece of its time, a point and click horror adventure absolutely worth playing if you won't bitch about how the game is "clunky", or the character's movements "sluggish" or how the story ends.
It's a 1998 game, and games were like this in 1998.
Writing these few lines just to add another voice to the choir of those praising this game, because it's a true masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043315549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1610395907}
review:
Sene 98. Pc yeni alınmış.Büyük ihtimal bi dergiden çıkan cd den demosunu oynamıştım..Açılış sahnesi,atmosfer,karakterler ve senaryo benim için benzersiz bir deneyimdi.Daha önce bünye atari oyunlarından başka bir şey görmemiş. Point click nedir bilmeyiz.İngilizcenin i si var gerisi yok.Oyun hikaye ve diyalog odaklı,bizde dil yok,oyunu anlamaya çalışıyoruz kafalara gel:D
O gün bu gündür içimde bir sızıdır şu oyun.
Sene oldu 2021.Hikaye nereye bağlanacak acaba diye 23 sene hiçbir yerden spoiler almamayı başararak bugün bitirmek nasip oldu.Oldu da nasıl oldu bir de bana sorun.Yok dedim walkthrough falan bakmayacagım,bu oyunu oturup herşeyini kendim bitireceğim ama nerdeee.Nostaljinin gazıyla büyük konuşmaya gerek yokmuş.Zira oyun kabir azabıymış yemin ediyorum.

Hikaye anlatımı,seslendirme,görseller vs dönemine göre düşününce gerçekten orijinal ve çok başarılı.Tavsiye ediyor muyum? Evet.Zaten bu oyuna girecekseniz ya zamanında oynamış,nostalji yaşamanın peşindesinizdir ki nostaljinin dibidir.Ya da bu neymiş deyip bi iki bölüm bakar çıkarsınız ve zamanında adamlar neler yapmış deyip ufkunuz açılır..Her halükarda verdiğiniz paraya değer ki zaten vereceğiniz sakız parası.Bu oyunun öveni çok olur zaten başlı başına bir klasiktir.
Ben sizlere kendimce bu gün ki oyuncu gözümden eksilerini anlatayım. 

Bir oynanış var ki çileden çıkmamak elde değil dostlar.Karakterin yürüme hızını(evet koşma yok) normale çeksen yemin ediyorum oyunun süresi yarıya düşer.Yani tahammül sınırlarımı zorladı.Çocukluk ahdim olmasa hayatta inat edip bitirmeye sabrım yetmezdi.

Alışkanlıktır fakat autosave falan beklemeyin.Kendinizi dönemin save-load mekaniğine alıştırın.Uzun görevlerden sonra save etmek elzem.Zira crash problemi yaşamanız çok olası..Oyun süresince ben de bir kere save etmeden kapatmak gibi bir hata yaptım.Manyak olursunuz bak söyleyeyim.(Bir dahaaa bu yollarııı aynı hevesleeee yürür müyüm...)

Dönemin grafikleri sebebi ile mi yoksa kasten mi yaptılar bilmiyorum ama bazı itemları farketmek gerçekten kartal gözü istiyor.Yani zaten item boyutları ufacık, anlık olarak düşmüş bir itemı o an farketmezseniz bir daha görmek mümkün değil arkadaş.(yaşlandık mı la yoksa)

Karakteri istediğiniz yöne yönlendirmek için bazen anlamsız manevralar yaptırmak gerekebiliyor.Girmek istemediğiniz yere veya merdivene hata ile girebiliyorsunuz.Çok mu can sıkıcı peki? Evet.Bazı puzzleları çözerken falan da illallah ettiriyor yani.

Bir iki bölümün angaryası biraz bol geldi.Evet hikayeye hizmet ediyor kendince ama bilemedim yani ben oynarken sıkıldım baya.(Aztec ve maze bölümleri özellikle)

author: {'steamid': '76561198175430729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1677169552}
review:
Bu oyunu bana bir arkadaşım önerip hediye etmişti ve açıkçası gerçekten ilk görüşte tutulduğum oyunlardan diyebilirim. Öncelikle "eski" oyunlardan hoşlanmıyorsanız buradan gitmenizi rica ediyorum. 

Yeni oyunlardan çok eski oyunları daha fazla severim. Bana göre eski oyunlar daha gizemli, daha ilgi çekiciler. Özellikle de 2010 öncesi çıkan yapımlar. Çünkü o dönemlerde şartların nasıl olduğunu pek bilmiyorum ve bu eski yapımları benim için daha da ilgi çekici yapıyor.

Sanitarium'a ilk başladığım vakit bir açılış sahnesi vardı. Yani öyle aşırı muazzam bir şey değildi ama niyeyse bana dönemine göre çok iyi gelmişti. Zaten o sinematikten sonra "Acaba neler olacak?" diye merak edip devam ettim. 

Oyunda biraz kasvetli bir hava var, ama asla rahatsız etmiyor. Aksine oyuna gerçekten çok yakışmış. Grafiklerini de çok beğendim. Eğer bu zamanın mükemmel grafiklerine alıştıysanız size pek güzel gelmeyecektir. 

Kontrol açısından alışana kadar biraz zorlanabilirsiniz. Arada gitmeye çalıştığınız yöne gidemeyebilir, sizi daha yakınındaki bir yere götürebilir. Ama bu benim için bir sorun olmadı. Çünkü yanlışlıkla gittiğiniz yerden dönüp tekrar gideceğiniz yere gitme imkanınız var (bu arada minik bir not düşeyim; incelemede bol bol anlatım bozukluğu, anlam karmaşası vb. olabilir. çok kusuruma bakmayın lütfen, kelimeleri toparlamakta biraz zorlanıyorum.). Merak etmeyin, alıştığınız zaman her şey daha iyi olacak.

Hikaye konusuna gelirsek, 7 saat oyun sürem olduğuna bakmayın. Bunun çoğunda oyunu yanlışlıkla açık bırakıp gittiğim için oldu. Oyun ne kadar sürede biter bilmiyorum ama ben henüz bitirmedim. Bu yüzden hikaye için pek bir bilgi veremeyeceğim. "Sonra ne olacak, nereye gideceğiz, neler oluyor aman tanrım" modunda oynadığım, gerçekten sürükleyici bir oyun. Ama tabii her fikir kendine özgüdür, benim beğendiğimi siz beğenmeyebilirsiniz.

Şimdim, bunca karmaşa içinden özetlemek gerekirsek; bana göre artı ve eksilerine geçeceğim.

+ Güzel hikaye
+ Güzel ortam
+ Müzikleri ortama göre çok hoş
+ Macera türünü seviyorsanız sevebileceğiniz bir oyun
+ Mekanları çok güzel

- Arada kontroller sapıtabiliyor
- Bazı bulmacaları bana zor geldi. Ya gerçekten bazı bulmacaları zor (bazı dediğime bakmayın çok azı), ya da büyük ihtimalle bende bir sıkıntı var.
- İleride galiba böcekli kısımlar olacakmış, böcek korkusu olan birisi olarak bundan korktum.

Çok yararlı bir inceleme olmadı ama bu oyun hakkında bir şeyler yazmak istedim. Çok havada kalmış olan yerler olabilir. Öyle aşırı bir inceleme yapıp da beklentilerinizi yüksek tutturmak istemedim. Çünkü dediğim gibi oyunu beğenen olacak, beğenmeyen olacak. Siz eğer benim öznel düşüncelerime göre "Anaa, çok iyi oyun lan" deyip oynayıp, ardından beğenmezseniz lütfen buraya çemkirmeyin. Ama yine de oynayıp beğenirseniz mutlu olurum. (sanki oyunu ben yaptım he :D) Çok uzatmayayım, ben oyunu çok beğendim. Eğer bu türde oyunlardan hoşlanıyorsanız bir göz atın derim ben.

Edit: oyunu bitirebildim sonunda. Benim için biraz yorucu olan günlerde çok iyi geldi. Böcekli kısımlar korktuğum kadar değilmiş. Bence ince düşünülüp yapılmış bir oyun. Bende hep ayrı bir yeri olacak. Beni bu oyunla tanıştıran arkadaşıma minnettârım, onun sayesinde çok güzel bir oyunu oynama fırsatım oldu.

review: A truly exquisite game for its time. The story was very interesting, using all kinds of metaphors and locations to make the player ponder what's going on. The setting, the music and the characters are very well written and they fit perfectly in the crazy worldsyou discover throughout the game. I loved the dark and freaky artsyle, it was very (un)pleasant to look at. Even though its from the 90's, the gameplay is not an issue. For the lowly price of 2 euros, I recommend it to everyone who likes creepy locations, mystery, and point and click adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045814331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1707, 'last_played': 1609401590}
review:
This is a weird game. The premise is that you are a researcher who discovers a cure to some deadly disease, but you get in a car crash and your head injury causes you to go insane. You wake up in some twisted insane asylum run by a mad scientist. A lot of the time you are totally sane and know what's going on. But every time something traumatic or stressful happens, your character has a dissociative episode, and you are teleported to an alternate dimension where you need to solve some problem. 

It's an isometric point and click adventure game. The controls are extremely awkward. You will get used to navigating through the world, but it never works perfectly. The graphics are definitely nothing to write home about. But like many adventure games, you are mostly playing this for the puzzles and the storyline. If what I described above sounds intriguing and you like creepy stuff, you will probably like the storyline. If you are a point and click veteran, you may like the puzzles too. But I found a few of them to be bullshit.

In particular, I'm going to spoil the one that bothered me the most. It's not really much of a spoiler, it doesn't give away how to solve the actual puzzle... but I'll put it in spoiler brackets anyway, though I'd recommend you read it if you intend on playing this game. [spoiler] There is one scene where you  have to solve an encrypted message on some chalkboards. I solved it by hand on my phone, but couldn't figure out how to input the passphrase. Well, I broke down and looked it up. Turns out, you have to click on the letters of the chalkboard and unscramble them there, so even though I solved the riddle by hand on my own, it didn't count. I didn't know you could click on the chalkboard! There is no real indication that you can, or should! I thought I was just looking at it for clues, not that I would solve the riddle right there on the board! At least they could have had a pop up message saying "Click on the letters of the chalkboard to solve the riddle" or something!! [/spoiler] The reason that frustrated me so much is that I actually solved the puzzle, it wasn't that the puzzle was too hard, it's that the interface was confusing. There are a couple other parts in the game where you have to find an object that blends in really well and you wouldn't even think to click on, but I guess that is pretty standard for a point and click game. Other than those few times I mentioned, I was able to beat the rest of the game without assistance. But I did have to wander around quite a bit at times. 

All in all, I would recommend the game, but just barely. If you are willing to break down and look a couple things up, or are a point and click veteran, you'll do fine. If bad controls and outdated graphics are not dealbreakers, and the storyline sounds good to you, you will probably like it. Personally, I am not a fan of having to stop and look something up, I like it when I can solve it on my own, and for most of the game I could. But it is frustrating when you find out that you would have been able to solve it if the game design was just a little better. But again, these issues are kind of common with point and click games. I guess this kind of thing is why they are no longer very popular these days. 

6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198288177742', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1609141744}
review: Multiplayer ekibinden Orhun Kayaalp Abi'nin tavsiyesi üzerine oyunu aldım. Ben daha yeni nesil oyunlarla büyümüş olmama rağmen bu tür oyunlardan hoşlanırım. Yaşattığı atmosfer, diyalogların kalitesi ve hikaye güzel olduktan sonra grafikler ve zamanın zor kontrolleri benim için sorun değildir. Neyse girişi biraz uzattım, B2 seviyesi İngilizcem ile oyundaki diyalogları gayet rahat anlayabiliyorum. Ama hiç İngilizceniz yoksa bulaşmayın, diyaloglar oyunda önem taşıyor, Türkçe yaması varsa sorun yok zaten. Onun haricinde, hikaye de esrarengiz ve sürükleyici bir yapıya sahip, biraz anlatmak isterdim ama spoiler olur. Çoğu kişinin sinirini bozacak şey ise oyunun hantal ve biraz zorlayan oynanışı, tabi 90'lı yılların point&click oyunlarını sevenler için bu bir sorun olmayacaktır. 98 yapımı oyun Windows 10'da düzgün çalışıyor mu diye soracak olursanız da, zaten oyunun girişinde de yeni bilgisayarlarda açılması için port edildiği hakkında bilgiler yazıyor. Son olarak, oyun indirimde 3,60TL için gayet güzel, tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076713362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1608156980}
review:
I don't often play point & click games so when I say this is a great game I genuinely mean it.  I won't spoil anything but this game is genuinely unsettling in it's music and settings in a good way and still holds up after its 1998 release date.  My only problem is the game occasionally has some really dumb puzzles, I'm talking about the kind where you need to click on the most unsuspecting object possible in order to proceed or as some like to call it pixel hunting.  Again without Spoilers I found the story entertaining to piece together over the course of the game and it ended in a fashion I didn't see coming, although I found the ending to leave something to desire.

Overall a great game that I won't forget anytime soon, 8/10
