author: {'steamid': '76561198010221719', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1607000871}
review: Old game but worth it, it's really bizzare but the puzzles are not absurdly hard or anything so it's enjoyable. But since it's an old game it's pretty clunky controls at times. There are zero hints so you either figure it out or you may need a guide for a specific part. There's also no hints to like what you can investigate so make sure you click everywhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164016063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1606934218}
review:
pros

+ this game delves into a amnesiac man's emotions, fears and regrets such as despair, death, illness, lost of loved ones and family problems
+ game was inspired from Jacob's Ladder (1990)
+ ominous and creepy atmosphere
+ psychological and emotional narrative
+ great soundtrack perfectly fits to game's atmosphere
+ puzzles mostly enjoyable. they are not very easy or difficult
+ diverse cast of weird, creepy and interesting characters
+ there are steam achievements
+ four playable characters
+ surprising and unexpected conclusion
+ game long

cons

- outdated graphics and cut scenes
- lack of a button which shows interactable objects causes pixel hunting
- frustrating mouse controls
- there are some bad voice acting
- crashing in chapter 4
- no cards

this game is an adventure game classic but it hasn't aged well. i just wished developers remastered this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309692371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1606760982}
review:
Really solid game that remains interesting throughout, slower paced but the atmosphere and writing make up for it. Two of the final stages stumble with puzzles that are far too obtuse and then tedious (Morgue and Lost Village) The story lacked some of the emotional impact I think they wanted to get at, leaving the events to feel a bit hollow and simplistic, but how the story is told keeps it engaging and mysterious until close to the end. It's when that mystique starts to let up that it becomes a bit frustrating and leaves a "that's it?" feeling. It's best to say Sanitarium is about the journey, as you'll find most of your enjoyment exploring whichever new world is presented to you.
 
I also wish there was more time spent in a setting like the Asylum, especially it's rooftops, as Max is handily my favourite character and I missed the gothic architecture that too often gets sidelined.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012607401', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1587509620}
review:
In the distant year of 1998 I was lucky to find this game and have the opportunity to experience this work of art.

After 22 years, I decided to buy it again, and it seems to me that only that shows my opinion about this game.

At the graphic level it is quite outdated, however, everything is compensated with the great imagination of the story and all its characters. Therefore, I believe that Sanitarium should be appreciated for its argument and not for its graphic quality, for everyone who encounters this game for the first time, I ask you to take this into account.

In terms of gameplay it is perfectly acceptable for a Point & Click game with 22 years. 

Music and sound effects are another strong point of this game and both help to improve the immersion and the mystery of the game's story.

In general, I consider that the puzzles are not very difficult, it is perfectly possible to complete the game without resorting to guides.

It was a great pleasure to revisit Jack's story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987725711', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1606308518}
review:
A trippy old timey classic point and click adventure game from 1998. Surprisingly it has a sensible control scheme and doesn't have that push pull taste etc. nonsense that older adventure games had. You just point and click at stuff to interact and use the right mouse button to walk. But it isn't free of some pixel hunting for totally tiny objects, very picky and precise mouse placement to pick up the said objects and at times obnoxious puzzles, therefore have a walkthrough at the ready.

The point of the game is to understand what the main character's past was as he journeys through increasingly nightmarish and downright gorgeous worlds. Events and themes start to make sense as you progress through the game. Although there are some downright ham fisted in your face explanations of the plot which are quite unnecessary. And I was particularly annoyed with how the science of genetics was dismissed with a "some ancient tribes knew the answer thousands of years ago because maybe aliens" type of plot thread. But at the end of the day the plot is there to give you a reason to go through the gorgeous and trippy nightmare worlds.

The game doesn't like modern computers and modern operating systems, despite the "work" done on the steam version. It isn't too uncommon to see the game crash, especially during cutscenes. Here are a couple of workarounds I have found for anyone who might (let's be honest, you WILL have crashing) experience crashes:

1- Run the game as administrator, remove any compatability for older OS's (Windows 98, Xp etc.)
2- When you are ingame go to the options and disable cutscene subtitles, for some reason direct draw emulation on new OS's tends to crash the cinematics if they have the subtitles on.
3- Disable hyperthreading and/or turbo boosting on your CPU OR use an old computer without these features (the game does not like when the clock speed of the CPU constantly changes)

These are what worked for me to getting it to run on Windows 10, I used an old Q6600 processor on my old computer to play it rather than a modern CPU.

author: {'steamid': '76561199039750720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1605041410}
review:
I love a good retro point-and-click adventure game. How this was awarded game of the year, though, is anyone's guess. Sanitarium's horrible controls and interface will drive you straight to the nuthouse. The only way to move your character is to chronically hold down the right mouse button and drag them around at a GLACIAL pace. One character will move more quickly than the others which is a godsend. Keyboard controls or a double-click to auto move to a certain spot would have made this much better.

Puzzles are not very hard at all. The most difficult part is when you're backtracking to pixel-click for the one item you may have missed is an absolute chore given the glacial pace. It'll have you reaching for that hint guide so you won't have to go back and forth one more stinkin' time.

Plot is weak and the ending is a snooze especially considering console games like Silent Hill that came out at the same time. Unless you want to waste a few hours, I can't recommend this.

review:
I was introduced to Sanitarium during DansGaming's Horror Month streams several years ago. I immediately felt a shot of 90's nostalgia and I later purchased the game. It sat in my library for a number of years untouched unfortunately, but I am so glad to have finally set aside time to play from start to finish. 

This game has quite the learning curve and it may have taken me longer than the average player to finish. Many of the puzzles were quite challenging and it felt good to complete them.

The overall story was well written and I highly recommend the experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065691655', 'num_games_owned': 1456, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1595195694}
review:
Unfortunately, Sanitarium was not as good as I was hoping it would be. I get that the game is a classic, but I think it was in desperate need of the remaster treatment, especially for the asking price.

As with many point 'n' clicks, you already know you're not going to get a whole lot out of gameplay. So it's imperative to nail the plot and characters. So did it work out here? Yes and no.

First off, I did not expect the story to go in the direction that it did. I love how the first stage opens. It's very moody and sets the tone for the rest of the story quite well. The second stage rolls around, and at this point, I'm saddled in and ready to go. Unfortunately, after Stage two, things started to get a little weird, then it got really weird... and then after that, I had no idea what the hell I was watching.

I'm not necessarily saying that the story lost track. Thematically, it did stick to its themes and tone, but it just didn't quite work for me. I admit that this is subjective commentary, so take it how you will. The story IS the best part of the game, but prepare yourself to be taken on a wild albeit strange journey.

In terms of gameplay? Look, it's a point 'n' click adventure game. What were you expecting? Puzzles. Okay, fine, the puzzles weren't that bad. Some were challenging, while others were quite simple. However, none were so ridiculous that you couldn't figure it out without a guide. Okay, maybe some, but trust me, the puzzles are very manageable.

The biggest issue the game suffers from is the movement speed. The characters you control do not move with any urgency. They will slug their way through the game, and with the amount of backtracking you have to do, watch the frustration set in.

Also, this game suffers from the worst pathing I've ever encountered with a game like this. There is nothing more annoying than to click on a spot you intend your character to go, only for him to slowly SLOTH down the WRONG DIRECTION! You then click to get him back up to speed, only for you to make the SAME mistake. It's enough to pop a blood vessel.

The sound and musical score were fantastic, genuinely creepy stuff here. The voice acting is just great. Old, yes, but I prefer this acting over some Triple-A titles nowadays. It has a real campy feel to it, and you can tell the actors had genuine fun with the material.

Replay value. Replay value? There's not even a chapter select. You have to manually create a chapter select using the many save slots available, but this goes back to my original point that this needed some streamlining to be more accessible to a new audience.

Overall, I would have let all of this pass if the pricing wasn't so off. This is not a $10 effort here. It's more like a $5 effort, and to be honest, steam sells many other games priced at $5 that have way more story and content (Overlord, Civ 3, Pony Island, to name a few.)

No, I can't recommend this effort at this price. Not even on sale. I would recommend purchasing it in a bundle of other classics to justify the value.

Completionist Note: Use a guide to get all the achievements in one go. You don't want to have to play this game multiple times. Make sure you save after every chapter in case you miss stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999045600', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1603012263}
review:
I remember hearing about this game when it was new, and boy am I kicking myself now for not playing it sooner, especially since I love good point-and-click adventure games.  

This is one of the very best ones.  Sanitarium perfectly combines horror, humor and disgust to make a compelling story that sticks with you.  

The graphics still hold up well enough to this day, too, though I wouldn't mind seeing a makeover.  The often disturbing setpieces have plenty of detail and it wasn't too difficult to find the items you need to solve the puzzles.

As for the puzzles, some of these adventure games have ones that are too nonsensical to solve without trial and error, but I didn't have any problems with this game.  While some were a bit bizarre, they still made sense.  Many of them aren't too difficult, but there were some satisfyingly tricky ones especially near the end of the game.  

I enjoyed the music and sound as well.   I love how everything is fully voiced so that you don't have to spend time reading mounds of text. 

The only frustration I had involved the movement, since it's a late 90s isometric perspective game and pathing wasn't as good as it is now.  There are a couple of times where you have to be precise with movement, but not so much that it dissuaded me from finishing.  

Lastly, I'm very pleased that there is still support for this game.  Often, you will find an old game like this on Steam and it takes a lot of work to get it to run properly on newer systems.  Sometimes it won't work at all, but I had zero difficulty running and streaming Sanitarium.  

In short, if you love horror-themed adventure games, you should definitely try this one as you don't see this kind of storytelling much anymore.

review:
Sanitarium is a psichological horror-adventure point and click game with a very unique atmosphere and storyline. The plot is intense, creative, deep and flawless. The game is no only about horrors, its about emotions, flashbacks and family regret. Also it has several funny moments.

Personally speaking, if I had to preserve games for the posterity, this would be on the list, together with Silent Hill 1 to 3, Metal Gear Solid, Resident Evil, etc. This is a must play game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198989601003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1597949515}
review:
经典解谜游戏，第一次见到是在初中，网吧刚刚兴起，在网吧里面看到过别人玩，现在的印象就那么一点儿，但是画面感很强，印象很深，当时记得游戏叫”疯人院“。从此二十多年过去了，一直没忘，但是也一直没有机会再玩，后来在steam上发现了这款游戏，很快就买了，能找到很多很老的游戏，单单这一点儿，就大爱steam了（一直心心念念不忘的老游戏，sanitarium算一个，已经进入完成游戏列表了。黏土世界和阿猫阿狗还没在steam找到）。

优点：
1. 剧情没的说，想象力和构思都够意思，尤其是奇异的故事穿插着男主角的不同幻觉和身份，整个感觉控制的非常好。游戏里面穿插了哥哥对于妹妹离去的遗憾与愧疚，中间GC一段难过的要落泪；
2. 前半段的想象力和寓意都很好，带着臆想的世界直接，后半段走到埃及风格的神庙冒险，风格感觉不搭，差了点儿意思；
3. 全程语音，在当时应该是很牛的了；
4. 游戏画面现在看来很渣，当思应该是不错的。另外，GC里面除了人物行为建模僵硬，整体上GC看起来并不落后；
5. 整体上解谜难度适中，个别解谜还是比较硬核的，需要从很多人的言语中得到线索，然后组合；

不足：
1. 操作不管是当时的观点，还是现在的观点，应该都很渣，这个是比较明显的不足吧，尤其是在最后走黑白格子的游戏时，让人抓狂；
2. 小游戏普遍提示较少做的比较花哨，如果理清楚游戏意图，基本都很简单，如果理不清楚，要折腾一阵儿；

总体看可以称得上经典，尤其是二十多年前的游戏，现在玩起来，依然有味道。

author: {'steamid': '76561198097786166', 'num_games_owned': 1298, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1598534647}
review:
[h1][b]Предисловие[/b][/h1]
Случайно наткнулся на игру во время недавней распродажи, приуроченной в основном к проектам жанра [b]Immersive Sim[/b], в которых использовался знаменитый код для сейфов [i]0451[/i], отсылающий к произведению [b]451 градус по Фаренгейту[/b] [i]Рэя Брэдбери[/i]. Проще говоря, продавались исключительные шедевры игровой индустрии, ныне вымирающий вид, который не способны спасти даже такие студии, как [b]Eidos Montreal[/b] или [b]Arkane Studios[/b]. Но сейчас не об этом.

Обычно сложно найти что-то вменяемое на платформе [b]Steam[/b] из-за обильного количества нишевых проектов, заведомо разработанных быстро и некачественно и с целью выкачки денег из пользователей. Понятное дело, что все игры подразумевают желание большого заработка, правда есть огромная пропасть, разделяющая игры на два лагеря, например, разработанные "на скорую руку" и абы как, да главное продать. И этакие гибриды "приятное с полезным" в виде стремления создать значимый продукт, попутно нацеленный и на прибыль тоже, и которым не стыдно поделиться с другими.

[h1][b]Sanitarium[/b] (или [b]Шизариум[/b] в русском переводе)[/h1]
Как раз таки тот самый случай – проект хочется порекомендовать каждому, знаете, как сотрудник кампании Oriflame, назойливо втюхивать его всем и без разбору, главное сказать свое слово. Для многих игра не станет открытием, ибо, прошу прощения, ей уже 23 год пошел. Озираясь на возраст, игра-квест порядком устарела, хотя до сих пор удивляет своим визуальным видом и проработкой многих задних планов. Графика дело не первой важности, особенно спустя столько лет. 

Главная особенность [b]Sanitarium[/b] и то, что не смогли затронуть и пошатнуть минувшие годы – это сюжет. Его описание сведёт вас с ума и покажется полным бредом, однако каждая его деталь имеет смысл, причем не только в отношении главного персонажа, но и для вас, так как вместе с ним начнет приходить понимание, раскрывающее крупицы истины. Все происходящее видится как сумасшествие больного человека или ловушкой человеческого разума, обращённого в один большой пазл, разбросанный на множество кусочков. Собирая воедино кусочки пазла, из некогда бредовых ви́дений, скомканных в разных отрезках и проходящие от лица непохожих друг на друга персонажей, вырисовывается цельная картина происходящего – мучительно сложная борьба человека не только с внешним врагом, но и с внутренним Я. А чтобы увидеть цельную картину воочию, советую приобрести и пройти данную игру. Уверен, любителям хорошей истории прохождение не станет потерей времени.

[h1][b]Умереть человеком или жить монстром[/b][/h1]
Завершением хотелось бы также отметить, что проект мне приглянулся из-за веяния после просмотра замечательного фильма [b]Остров проклятых[/b], тематики сумасшедшего дома и интригующего, запутанного сюжета. Чего-то высшего не ожидал, однако оказалось все иначе, чему безмерно рад. Всегда приятно поиграть во что-то упущенное ранее, старое и в то же время нестареющее для прохождения. Ещё весьма приятно было слушать старые добрые голоса актеров дубляжа в русской озвучке от [b]Логрус[/b]; то как звучат актеры, как они говорят и интонируют голосом, навевает чувство ностальгии, слегка окуная мыслями в период между девяностыми и нулевыми. Одно могу сказать точно: подобным образом в наше время не озвучат. Разработчикам из [b]DreamForge Intertainment[/b] (ныне закрытой студии, к сожалению) удалось совместить визуальный ряд с хорошей историей, нагнать необходимой доли "атмосферы" и в добавок начинить подходящим музыкальным сопровождением.

author: {'steamid': '76561198888098221', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1598474738}
review:
Sanitarium cuenta la historia de un hombre que sufrió un accidente en coche y que le produjo amnesia. Cuando despierta se encuentra en un psiquiátrico. Desde allí comienza su aventura para recordar quién era y qué hacía.
Hay un total de nueve capítulos, todos ellos ambientados en sitios afectados por extraños fenómenos, lo cual irá generando una atmósfera de misterio, tristeza, miedo y pérdida.
Fue estrenado en 1998, cuando las aventuras gráficas estaban en el final de su apogeo; pero no por ello deja de ser recomendable tanto por su valor histórico como por haber anticipado la forma en que el género del horror psicológico evolucionaría.

El juego está en Inglés, pero gracias al usuario Kelmer de ClanDlan podemos disfrutar de una traducción en castellano que aquí en steam podrás encontrar en: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=334081963

review: This game is so good at making you feel uneasy and creeped out in a way that most modern games can't. author: {'steamid': '76561198067637805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1597723537}
review:
Sanitarium psikolojik gerilim temalı bir "point and click" macera oyunu. Eskilerde çok popüler olan bu türden şimdilerde fazla oyun göremiyoruz. Bilmeyenler için "point and click" oyunları bölümlerde mouse vasıtasıyla gezinerek nesnelerle ve canlılarla etkileşime geçtiğiniz, eşyalar topladığınız ve bu eşyaları doğru yerde kullanarak bölümü geçmeye çalıştığınız oyunlardır.

Sanitarium bugün bile oyun sohbetlerine konu olan ve geçmişten bugüne video oyunlarıyla ilgilenmiş birçok kişi tarafından kült sayılan bir oyun. Bunun sebebi oyuncuya atmosferi çok iyi hissetirmesi ve özgün hikaye anlatış biçimi. Benimsenen rahatsız edici sanat tasarımı, oyunun temasına son derece uygun. Seslendirmeler, ses efektleri ve müzikler de atmosferi destekler nitelikte. Oyun boyunca farklı karakterlerle farklı temalarda bölümler oynuyoruz. Bu bölümler için seçilen temalar da son derece ilginç ve akılda kalıcı.

Hikayeyi ve bulunduğumuz bölümleri anlamak için yaptığımız temel eylem etraftaki canlılarla diyalog kurmak ve etrafı incelemek. Sürekli farklı temada bölümlere gittiğiniz için olan biteni merak ediyor ve bölümlerin her yerini inceleme ihtiyacı hissediyorsunuz. Etraftan topladığınız eşyaları doğru yerde kullandığınız klasik macera oyunu bulmacaları, bu türün en popüler örneği olan Grim Fandango'ya göre biraz daha kolay. Bu bulmacalar dışında oyunda var olan ekstra bulmacalar oldukça zevkli fakat biraz daha zor. Oynanış mekanikleri 98'den kalma olduğu için bugün için oldukça hantal gelebilir. Yine de kesinlikle oynanmayacak durumda değil. Sağ tuşa basılı tutarak hareket etme mekaniği yerine yakın zamanlarda çıkmış Diablo gibi tıkladığın yere gitme mekaniği olsa daha iyi olurmuş. Bir de kontrol ettiğimiz karakterlerin yavaş hareket etmesi can sıkabiliyor. Sırf bu yavaş hareket etme olayı yüzünden bölümü tekrar dolaşıp keşfetmekten bıkarak walkthrough'lara baktığım oldum. Eski grafikler ve hantal oynanış mekaniklerine katlanamayacak insanlar oyunu denememeli.

Hikaye ana karakterimizin trafik kazası geçirmesi ve ardından kendini korkutucu bir akıl hastanesinde bulmasıyla başlıyor. Bölümleri tamamladıkça karakterin hatırladığı hatıralar hikayeyi anlamamıza yardımcı oluyor. Anlatımı son derece ilginç olan hikayenin kendisi ise maalesef biraz sıradan. Bu denli özgün bir anlatım içeren ve etkileyici atmosferi olan oyunun daha güçlü bir hikayesinin olmasını beklerdim.

Hikaye anlatımı konusunda günümüz oyun geliştiricilerine ders niteliğinde bir oyun Sanitarium. Oyunlarda atmosferin önemli olduğunu düşünenlerdenseniz ve yüzeysel hikaye anlatımlarından sıkıldıysanız bu oyunu denemenizi öneririm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016253960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1595969150}
review: I played the demo on an old PC Gamer disc of my brother's (basically the first level) and I was intrigued since. Every now and then over the last 2 decades I would think about this game but then forget whenever I thought about looking for a new game to buy. It's way better than I had imagined, and I think if I'd played it back when I was a kid it would be one of my all-time favourite games. It's a really creative, eccentric and imaginative (and cheesy, much more so because it's just so old now) game that's well worth £/$5. It's not as 'difficult' as say, day of the tentacle - more or less click everywhere and you'll eventually solve the puzzles. If you like point and click games then you'll love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271260907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1593360040}
review:
Sanitarium是一款恐怖解谜游戏，质量在1998年那个年代应该说是非常高了。
当然即使放在现在也是不可多得的作品，虽然质量很高但是感觉网上很多评测吹捧过度。
游戏的代入感很不错，10小时以上的游戏流程，前后剧情有相互过渡，也能看到一些联系。但是由于是老游戏，操作起来非常难受，经常角色走不准，特别是有些关卡需要一些走位来战斗的场景（南瓜地还有触手怪）就非常难受。

游戏音乐非常不错，大部分剧情由文本来展示，游戏整体英文也不是很难，读下来也不是很累，但是由于是老游戏，经常会有闪退等一系列问题，不过还是建议买来玩一玩的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198141416215', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1594164729}
review:
Gece 3 oyun bitti ve hemen taze bir inceleme yazıyorum. SPOILER ALERT
Hemen kendime göre genel puanlamamı yapayım. 
      7/10
Öncelikle oyun hakkında fikri olmayan, acaba alsam oynar mıyım diyenler hemen buradan uzaklaşsın çünkü bu oyun kesinlikle genel kitleye hitap etmiyor.
Ama "Yok ben bi eskilere dönüp o efsane macera,puzzle oyunlarından birini oynayıp üstüne harika bir de hikaye görmek istiyorum." derseniz o zaman buradan devam.
Oyunu oynamak çok zor. Bakın oyun zor demiyorum. Oyunu oynamak cidden zor. Aşırı derecede sabır,odak ve orta parmak kası istiyor. O merdiven looplarına yüzlerce kez gireceksiniz. Karakterin yavaş yavaş yürüyüşüne çıldıracaksınız. 
Hatta bazen save almayı unutup 2 saatlik oyununuzun boşa gittiği yerler olacak. bkz:ben
Anlattıklarımın hepsini oyuna girince göreceksiniz. [spoiler] Acaba kontrol ayarlardan değiştirilebiliyor muydu neyse geçti artık [/spoiler]
Dediğim gibi hikayesi cidden merak uyandırıcı ve güzel bir hikaye.Zaten oyunun en büyük olayı bu güzel hikayesi.
Oyuna başlar başlamaz zaten o merak sizi yiyip bitiriyor acaba nasıl oldu, neler oluyor diye sormaya başlıyorsunuz. 
Fakat bu merak beni oyunun sadece bir yerine kadar götürebildi. O harika birkaç bölümü oynadıktan sonra oyunun sonları artık benim için oyunun en bayıcı yerleri haline geldi. Yahu tamam bir metafor var karakterimizin geçmişiyle bağ olan bölümleri oynuyoruz
bkz: Max ilacı Aztekler üzerinde çalışarak bulduğu için Olmec'e dönüşmüş ve bilinçaltında bu şekilde görmüş ve biz de bu karakterle oynuyoruz.

Bunlar kesinlikle kötü bölümler değil. Hele sirk bölümü ve kardeşinin bebeğini bulduğumuz bölüm resmen muhteşem. Ama dediğim gibi bazı yerler var beni o kadar çok baydı ki artık ara verip devam etmek zorunda kaldım. Belki yazıdan bunları tam anlayamadınız ama oyunu belirli bir süre oynadıktan sonra bunları göreceğinizi düşünüyorum ya da sadece bana öyle geliyor.
Oyundaki puzzle' lar kesinlikle zor değil aksine kolay. Sadece anlaması güç. Anladıktan sonra hemencecik yapıyorsunuz.
Ancak oyunda bir eşyayı arayıp bulmak bence cidden zor. Çünkü eşyayı almamız gereken arka font eşyayla neredeyse aynı renkte. Tamam gözümüze gözümüze parlamasını istemiyoruz. Ama en azından seçici bir renk olup oyuncuyu o kadar zorlamasaymış cidden iyi olabilirmiş çünkü bazı 5 dakikalık yerlerde neredeyse 1 saatimin gittiği oldu.
Yani genel olarak bakarsak bu türü sevenlerin oynaması gereken.  Acaba baksam mı diyenlerin bence uzak durması daha iyi olan bir oyun.
Denemek istiyorsanız da siz bilirsiniz ama bu oyun ne kadar efsane de olsa türe uzaksanız hiç bulaşmayın derim.

review:
A nightmarish horror game with an eerie ambience and fantastic atmosphere.
The 1998 graphics might make the horror experience even more intense, but personally I found them a bit too outdated for my taste and the stiff moving around really annoyed me. The first part of the game def caught my attention and liking, but as the game envolved it got a bit too bizarre and confusing and felt more time consuming than actually fun. Still an interesting game though!
___________________________

Play this game if:
- You are a fan of em ol' 90s horror games
- You want to be thrown into a nightmare of blood, gore and death
- You are looking for a challenge, this can def be annoyingly hard at times

Do Not play this game if:
- You want a story that makes full sense
- You are not too keen on blood, gore and mutilated children


Verdict: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025257819', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1408, 'last_played': 1590861244}
review:
[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Sanitarium is a surreal and oftentimes morbid point & click adventure, that, aside from outdated graphics and some clunky mechanics, aged like a fine wine and will still captivate fans of the genre with a brilliant story that is excellently delivered, haunting settings and more than enough challenging puzzles to sink your teeth into.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
In the intro scene, we see the main character driving a car and getting into a serious accident. After the cinematic has ended, the main character awakens in an old, decrepit asylum. From there on, the character starts his journey through many surreal, haunting, and morbid scenes (including mutated children, creepy clowns, questionable experiments on unwilling human test-subjects, to name a few), which all eventually tie into one overarching story about the character's childhood, the character's recent history, and how he ended up in the car accident in the first place. On a side-note: personally, I couldn't help but noticing a lot of striking similarities between this game, and a music album by Ayreon, "The Human Equation". But I digress.

The game was released in 1998, and while the graphics are ok, they are clearly outdated. The game world and the characters are shown in a 3D isometric view. Widescreen resolutions are not supported, so you'll be playing this in an old-school 4:3 ratio. If you're willing to overlook the fact that the visuals are over 20 years old, however, you will find a lot of interesting and detailed locations, that are all very well put together. Locations, characters and objects are all very varied, and the developers clearly put a lot of effort in it. Objects do tend to "blend" into the background at times, so some "screen swiping" with the mouse to see if you can get the magnifying glass to "wiggle" (indicating that something can be interacted with) might be required. There's quite a lot of cutscenes and flash-backs, which also show their age, but they serve the story well.

Music-wise, the game is ok. There's a lot of background music, ambient effects and overall sound effects. It can get a bit repetitive, and some sounds and effects can even get irritating, as they are old, low-quality samples. After doing a new install of the game, you'll probably want to configure the sound options in the game main menu (by hitting Esc), as music and SFX are rather loud and can drown out character voice lines with the "out of the box" settings. This is just a minor nuisance that can easily be adjusted, though. Speaking of voice lines, the game is fully voice acted, meaning that [i]every[/i] dialogue option is voiced, and rather well at that.

UI and controls are very basic. By default, your left mouse cursor is a magnifying glass that lets you examine things. Left-click on an NPC first lets you look at the NPC, after which the cursor changes into a mouth that lets you talk to the NPC. Left-click on your character brings up your inventory, left-clicking on an item selects the item, after which you can use it in the environment. Right-click moves your character arouund the screen; a definite drawback of the game is that movement is very clunky. For starters, you'll have to keep the right mouse button pressed to continue welking, as there is no "single-click anywhere on the screen and let pathfinding take care of the rest". Also, the game can be very picky about where you click, and I can guarantee you that you'll be growling with frustration on more than one occasion when the character goes somewhere you don't want it to go. The fact that character movement is rather slow and there's no option to run doesn't help either.

The puzzles are of good quality. You definitely won't be zipping through this game, as most puzzles require some serious exploring, thinking, experimenting, and clue collecting. During the game, you'll "switch characters" at times, which actually ties nicely into the story. Another nice touch is that at times, you can get an idea of what the next scene might contain, based on some visual clues in the current scene. Towards the end of the game, some puzzles and mechanics might begin to feel a bit repetitive (at one point towards the end, there's a maze puzzle that I personally found outright annoying), although for me, the drive to unveil the entire story and get to the ending was more than enough to continue.

All in all, you get a decent adventure game, that will probably take you between 15 and 25 hours to complete, depending on your level of experience with these kinds of games. After finishing the story, there's little to no replay value, unless you want to go for 100% achievements (as there are a few missable ones; the quickest way to get them all is by loading up a save-game, so that you don't have to play through the entire story all over again).

[h1]Pros and cons[/h1]
+ brilliant story, excellently delivered
+ haunting, surreal, morbid yet fascinating setting(s)
+ fully voice acted
+ play as multiple characters
+ good level of difficulty

+/- dated graphics and cutscenes

- clunky and slow character movement
- some repetitiveness in the puzzles towards the end

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
Even though the graphics are dated and controls can at some times be pretty clunky, the story, its delivery, the setting(s), the atmosphere, and the puzzles easily outweigh that. When it was published back in 1998, it went up against Grim Fandango in many game award nominations for "Best Adventure Game", tieing or losing just by a thread to Lucasarts' masterpiece. It'll still give fans of the genre a good run for their money, it's absolutely worth the 10 euros.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169593839', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1589933128}
review:
Sanitarium is an atmospheric and uncanny point-and-click game where the protagonist interacts with surroundings hoping to get any info of his identity and whether he's in a dream or real world. Boundaries between madness, memories, illusions, dream and reality are shattered and you're trying to figure out the meaning behind the events you experience through the game. 
The first half of the game is great, levels and story are creative and push you to the edge with unsettling images as your story slowly gets unwrapped. Those chapters are diverse, yet linked one with another and offer more perspectives and various surreal characters and locations. That half deserves 8.5/10, but the second half of the game delivered lots of themes which made the game much more confusing and weird, watering down the atmosphere and keeping mostly surreal and grotesque theme. Voice acting is excellent, providing lots of lines and reactions to various actions and characters. Soundtrack is very good, some tracks fit way too well certain levels bringing more tense and unease. 
Despite the game being made in 1998, the graphics still look well and mechanics aren't bad, but they can get clunky. Overall, it's a solid game and worth a try for sure, though it depends on your taste how you will perceive it. 7/10

Pros: 
+ very good surreal atmosphere
+amazing voice acting, soundtrack is pretty good
+some chapters are very creative

Cons: 
-quality drops in the second half of the game, story becomes confusing and weird
-movement mechanics can get clunky

review:
Nereden başlasam bilemiyorum. Neresinden tutup eksi puan versem bilemiyorum. Hikâye kurguculuğunun en üst safhalarından bu oyun. 

Araba kazası yüzünden hafıza kaybı yaşayan ve adını dahi hatırlamayan Max'in zihninin derinliklerinde hayatını derinden etkileyen her bir olayın bilinçaltındaki yansımasını görmek ve gerçek olay ile arasındaki bağı kurmanın verdiği zevk paha biçilemez. Max'in travma, üzüntü, ihanet ve umut arayışındaki yaşamını kademe kademe incelerken belki eksi sayılacak tek kısım bulmacaların biraz zor olması ve çözümü bulmanın doğal olarak vakit alması. 

"Mother is good. Mother is the way. Mother protects us from meat, which would harm us. We are all mother's seedlings."


10/10

review:
Sanitarium isn't a bad video-game throughout. There are a lot of really interesting puzzles and the whole naritive presented is one of madness, and is quite funny. 

A few of the chapters feel rather drawn out, and whilst entertaining and rather unique they are also irritating, long and feel incredibly tedious.

I didn't enjoy all of the experience, I enjoyed very (very) little of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006829964', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1497309679}
review:
I played this game back in high school in the 90's and I remember telling friends about it for years to come. Awhile back, I saw it was on Steam, so I had to pick it up and go through the game again.

Sanitarium is a very dark and twisted point & click adventure. The story will throw you through loops and have you saying "WTF?" in the best way possible. The only negative I would say about the game is that sometimes it's difficult to see exactly where you can go in some puzzles, because it's so dark and gritty, and hard to see where walking areas are, which can cause some frustration. Besides that, I absolutely love this game! It's worth getting for the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046895151', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1587168737}
review:
An amazing story about a man who should break free from amnesia and insanity to "seek the truth". 

In this psychological horror point-and-click adventure, you wake up in an asylum, not even remembering your own name. You piece together your memories as you go through bizarre locations and events. Most of the time it's unclear what is real and what is not. The mysterious story, the gripping atmosphere and the masterful soundtracks won't let go until the end. It is written really well save for a few cliches and loose ends.

As for the gameplay, there are many good puzzles that are related to the story but also a few cheap ones. The game has obviously aged and is not flawless, mostly due to technical limitations of its time. Walking is slow (actually kind of good for the atmosphere?) and it's sometimes hard to traverse the 2d isometric levels of the game.

I think the negatives don't take away much from the experience and are far outweighed by the good parts of the game. It is a unique and unforgettable experience with next to no filler and pointless gameplay elements. Definitely worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138202754', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1587655102}
review:
В общем и целом, неплохой ремастер, но GOG'овская версия мне понравилась больше. Несмотря на проблемы той версии с цветокоррекцией (свойственной старым играм), при Alt+Tab цвета восстанавливались, и особо в игре это не напрягало. А вот что в этой версии напрягает, так это синхронизация субтитров и голоса. Кстати, о субтитрах: они выключены в настройках по умолчанию, и их нужно включать после интро. Да, в этой ремастрированной версии ещё и сделали автоматическое начало новой игры, без возможности заглянуть в настройки или ещё куда-нибудь, не посмотрев или пропустив интро. Не сказал бы, что это уж сильная проблема, но мне удобнее сначала в меню полазить, а потом уже новую игру начать.

В общем и целом, ремастер хороший, но небольшие проблемы с синхронизацией и отсутствием субтитров по умолчанию напрягают (но не сильно). Если вы любите хорошие хоррор-квесты, и у вас нет аккаунта в GOG (или же вы просто хотите понабивать здесь достижения), покупайте. Только предупреждаю, что сохранения в ремастере несовместимы с оригинальной дисковой и GOG версией, а также требуются отдельная версия русификатора (если вы захотите его поставить).

author: {'steamid': '76561198027174683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1585603764}
review:
I have just finished this game, and have come to an end of a journey like no other. Throughout, it pierced the fleshy folds of my psyche, demanded frequent usage of logic and focus, even when I was tired and about to prepare for bed some of the time, sent shivers down my spine, delivered a powerful punch to the "feels", spun me upside down yet satisfied my mood for off-beat, bizarre humour and, ultimately, made me smile with content at the finale.

The story involves a man who, after a severe car crash, rises from a coma in an old and decrepit psychiatric hospital, and embarks on a quest within his mind to recover his memories, senses, personality, destiny and piece back together the reality that shattered around him, while banishing the spirits of his past who return with a vengeance.

Now, as I try to unscramble this circus-like, Totem-pole ridden, gargoyle-guarded arena of mine, I cannot say that this has been a faultless experience. It is of its era, and no amount of mental gymnastics can change that. The gameplay mechanics are basic, mostly because the movements can be slow and clunky in each of the locations, as there is no option to run, with a lack of fluidity, a few of the puzzles in the last couple of levels are repetitive and there are themes which would not make the mainstream entertainment cutting floor in today's world, regardless of how they are supposed to be interpreted (madness, deformed circus inhabitants e.t.c). However, despite me being alive, but a month away from reaching the Terrible Twos when it came out, I found it easy to overlook its flaws, because they are, to me, totally outweighed by the positives.

After exploring the first world, I found myself slipping into an almost unshakable trance, which lasted until the end. The masterful soundtrack, with its looping hypnotic rhythms producing intoxicating waves throughout the vast and varied locations, helped me to fully soak in each detail, and the hours zoomed past, while I clawed at every nook and cranny, finding the many clues and items needed to progress, from shining Temple ornaments to mechanical claws, complex keys and even word-deciphering glass eyes. Everything seemed so real, however unreal these things might have been, and the lack of technology and resources in that department was compensated by a huge amount of creativity and originality. Water ripples and gleams in the impotent evening sun, blood drips from poor victims of power-hungry overlords, shadows dance and shift around in the brooding darkness and autumn leaves fall with melancholy in a near-deserted rural town where adults have "vanished" and an overbearing plant monster rules over creepy mutant youngsters to provide a few examples. Sometimes it can be hauntingly beautiful, and at other times grotesque and sinister, yet never violent as such and with exploration and problem-solving being more important in progressing through the levels.

The storyline is the piece that links everything together. Despite being basic and quite short in itself, it is well-written, sharp and moving, with a few twists and turns to be experienced as the main character unravels his own mystery. We discover that his insanity was also due to a number of factors aside from the car accident, that he began his quest as a flawed individual and that even the little things matter in this tale of torment, accompanied by amazing voice-acting, for the most part, and a plethora of sound-effects that fit perfectly in each scenario. It is refreshing, since a narrative with this much depth is not a common find in many point-and-click adventure games.

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed this game, and will never forget the weird and awesome, although occasionally frustrating time I've had while playing it. Under normal circumstances, I am not nearly as big a gamer as I used to be, and have grown slightly fussy, but I am glad I made the decision to try Sanitarium out, and if you are a fan of adventure, horror, mystery and/or puzzle-solving titles, then I recommend that you give it a go. Wow!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970938346', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 557, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1585580399}
review:
I was prepared for an old-school gaming experience. I grew up with these kinds of games. However the reality is that it wasn't a great game then, and it still isn't.

What they managed to do in this game, at the time, was nothing short of a technical miracle. Fully pre-rendered scenes assembled in 2D with full foreground/background/object layering and proper depth.

However, the practical outcome is that you have a character that inches around at the slowest possible pace. 98% of the time spent playing will be TRYING desperately to get your character to walk to the right place and NOT go down the stairs for the 9th time when you're NOT trying to go down them.

I thought I could see past the deficiencies. I cannot. 

If you're already into this game, my review will change nothing because you know what you're getting.

But if you're thinking this game will be a great taste of a gaming past you never got to experience.... well leave this gaming experience in the past where it belongs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364189109', 'num_games_owned': 2205, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1583938891}
review:
[h1] SANITARIUM [/h1]

Sanitarium'un başında, canlandırdığımız karakter olan Max'in önemli bir hastalığın tedavisini bulduğunu ve bunu karısına anlatmak üzere heyecanlı bir şekilde arabasına bindiğini görüyoruz. Max, yağmur şiddetli bir şekilde arabasının camında tıkırtılar oluştururken karısına telefon açar ve [u] “Sana çok önemli haberlerim var, birazdan orada olurum.” [/u] der. Yola çıktıktan birkaç dakika sonra araba yağmur nedeniyle hızlı bir şekilde kaymaya başlar. Aklında hâlâ karısına yetiştireceği güzel haber varken yolun kenarındaki bariyerleri kırmış ve havada süzülürken bulur kendini.

Max, uyandığında kendisini eski bir akıl hastanesinin iğrendirici bir odasında bulur. Gözüne ilk çarpan olay bir üst katta yer alan bir adamın kafasını duvara defalarca vuruyor oluşudur. Nerede olduğuna anlam yüklemeye çalışırken kendini adeta bir karmaşanın içerisinde bulur. Geçmişinde yaşamış olduğu bazı olayları halüsinasyon şeklinde görmeye devam eder ve bir yandan geçmişiyle boğuşurken bir yandan da akıl hastanesinden çıkmaya çalışır. İşte Sanitarium'un gizemli ve bir okadar da gerilimli hikayesi böyle başlar.

Sanitarium türünün [i] (Korku,macera) [/i] ilk örneklerinden ve çok eski olmasına rağmen hala oyuncuya yeteri kadar gerilim ve keşfetme hissi yaşatıyor. Bunun yanı sıra hikayedeki o merak uyandırıcı hava ve oyundaki muhteşem atmosfer oyunu ilerletmeye yetiyor.

Sanitarium tamamen bulmaca ve keşfetme odaklı bir oyun. Bulmaca ve keşif kısmında oyuncuya ne bir ipucu veriyor ne de [u] ''Şuraya git, şunu yap.'' [/u] gibi komutlarla oyuncuyu kısıtlıyor. Özgür bırakma ve hikayenin akışına etki ettiğimizi hissettirme konusunda Sanitarium gayet başarılı.

1998 yılında çıkmış bir oyuna göre seslendirme ve ara sahneler çok başarılı. Korku ve macera türü sever oyuncuların mutlaka bir göz atması gerekiyor. Yeni nesil oyunculara pek hitap etmese de bir bakmalarını tavsiye ederim.

[h1] İNCELEME PUANI : 75 / 100 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198149396436', 'num_games_owned': 984, 'num_reviews': 410, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1582644861}
review:
Хороший симулятор белой горячки. Огорчает, что это просто адаптированная на запуск на современных виндовсах игра, но графон в игре такой как будто кто-то неаккуратно вытер блевоту с монитора. Прямиком из 1998 года, когда был молод, горяч и не боялся засовывать в жо... опа... 
Ну хорошая игрушка, неплохая постановка и разнообразие для квеста. Ну и всё...

Эта игра пример того как пытались шокировать 20 лет назад ещё мягкого и впечатлительного игрока.
Сегодня этого жирного ретарда не испугает даже намотанные кишки на вентилятор и выдавленные глаза.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042757315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1581312992}
review:
Well, this game didn't age well. Damn.

Why should you play this game?
-It's an oldie. A classic. A pioneer. You might want to discover it.
-It's certainly creepy as hell. The art, the sound, the music and the voice acting all meld into a horrible mess. Maybe you like that.
-The voice work is actually legit and on par with games of today. Every line is voice. Rather impressive.
-There's puzzles and they're challenging. Take item and use on thing. Sometimes you gotta use your brains.
-Story is very well thought-out, imaginative, if morbid and weird.
-You've played back it the day and want a nostalgia trip.

Why should you skip this game?
-The movement is slooooooooow. There is no run and it takes way too long to get anywhere.
-Ambient sounds are irritating, disturbing and often loop continuously.
-Graphics are, obviously, dated (1998 3D). The cinematics are hard to watch. We've gone a long way in 20 years.
-Some puzzles are difficult and may require checking a walkthrough.
-You may get too creeped-out to keep playing. For me I quit after going around in circles in a town with deformed children.
-Really simply not fun in the classic sense. Too tedious.

I got it since it was 80% off which is a good deal, but had I gotten it full price I would have regretted my purchase. As it stands it was interesting but too frustrating to play for long.

I think for most people it isn't worth the full asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021087888', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1576986312}
review:
It's a game I've bought just so I can have it marked as 100%-ted on Steam. It's beautiful, creepy, clever and at times even challenging for a point and click adventure. It's also a rare case of a non-Lucas Arts oldie that's absolutely a classic of the genre, and one of those must-have and must-have-played things I'd recommend to anyone.

One of the most enduringly fascinating things about it, for me, is that it's clearly a game that got made by a team of people each interested in making a different game. That's usually a recipie for disaster, but they managed to make it work splendidly. That's very rare, making Sanitarium stand out even more. Great game!

review:
22 años después de su lanzamiento finalmente jugué y terminé este clásico. Es un gran juego, con una muy buena historia y puzzles. Claramente uno se da cuenta que en la época que salió era algo nuevo y nunca antes visto. Me encantaría una remake para que la gente que tal vez no se anime a jugarlo por ser viejo pueda disfrutarlo. Mi única queja del juego es el sistema de movimiento que eligieron en su momento los desarrolladores usando el botón derecho. Uno se acostumbra eventualmente pero nunca logra entender que se ganó con esa elección. De todos modos es un juego super recomendable incluso en la actualidad.

Puntaje final: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198014680398', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1578602249}
review:
Квест прямиком из моего детства. Тогда, в силу возраста, я не осилила. Сейчас решила наверстать и заодно посмотреть, какое впечатление он на меня произведет сегодня.

Графика: приятная, если можно так сказать. Не смотря на древность самой игры (в ней даже настроек графики нет, ну почти) картинка четкая и функциональная. Трупы, кишки, уродство и заброшенность преданны качественно. Звук иногда прыгает по громкости, но это даже на пользу погружению.

Сюжет: повествует про психические отклонения: травмы, галлюцинации и иже с ними. Предстоит побывать во всех злачных местах, связанных с этим – от классической психушки и морга до альтернативных реальностей. И вот с этим у меня проблемы. Я не очень люблю, когда повествование скачет по временной линии хаотично, а тут еще и предстоит играть за «разных главных персонажей». Мне кажется, что история теряет в напряжении. Еще мне жутко не понравился эпизод во временах ацтеков. По мне так зря добавили. По большому же счету, перед нами триллер с потерей памяти и жуткими экспериментами над людьми с примесью фантастики.

Геймплей: почти классический Point & Click. Главное отличие – перемещение. Чтобы персонаж пошел, надо зажать правую клавишу мыши и направить в нужную сторону. И это жутко, просто жутко не удобно! Локации маленькие, персонаж беспрерывно на что-то натыкается и застревает, места интереса и возможные пути могут быть скрыты текстурой и прочее. Не знаю, почему разработчики решили именно так. В остальном, загадки логичные, хотя не всегда понятно какая задача стоит перед игроком. Есть ещё интересные решения в плане локации и на этом всё.

Достижения: все на внимательность. Игра медленная, поэтому лучше проходить заглядывая в гайд (остерегайтесь спойлеров).

Вывод: старый, почти классический квест с интересными задумками и некоторыми не совсем удачными решениями. Мне, в целом, понравилось, но порекомендовать могу только тем, кто играл раньше или занимается «археологическими раскопками Steam».

author: {'steamid': '76561197994824233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1577453766}
review:
Gelmiş geçmiş en iyi macera oyunlarından biri. 90'larda da öyleydi, hâlâ öyle :) 

Point and click tarzı bir macera oyunu kendisi. Bir bilim adamı arabayla evine dönerken feci bir kaza geçiriyor ve kendini yüzü gözü sarılı, hafızasını kaybetmiş bir hâlde bir tımarhanede (Sanitarium) buluyor. Oyunun ilk sahnelerinde kafasını duvara vura vura kanatan, tavuk taklidi yapan, kendi kendine konuşan bir sürü deliyle bir arada buluyoruz kendimizi. Sonrasında bu türün âdeti olduğu üzere insanlarla konuşarak, topladığımız nesneleri başka nesnelerle kullanarak ve çeşitli bulmacaları çözerek buradan kurtulmaya çalışıyoruz.

Ama oyunun asıl parladığı nokta, kahramanımızın yaşadığı kısmi delilik ve hafıza kaybından ötürü kendini sürekli farklı yerlerde bulması. Bir bölümde yüzleri deforme olmuş, ortada hiçbir yetişkinin olmadığı bir kasabada buluyoruz kendimizi. Tüm çocuklar Anne (Mother) adındaki gizemli birinden söz ediyor.

Sonrasında küçük bir kıza dönüşüyor ve dehşetengiz bir sirke düşüyoruz. Daha daha sonra dört kollu, at bacaklı bir Tepegöz'e (Cyclops) dönüşüyor ve istilacı böcek ordusuna karşı savaşıyoruz. Bitmedi, son olarak da bir Aztek savaşçısına dönüşüyor ve felakete uğramış bir köye yardım etmeye çalışıyoruz.

İşin güzel yanı tüm bunların gerçek mi hayal mi olduğunu bir türlü anlamamamız. Ve kahramanımızın aralarda kendisini yine yeni yeniden deli hastanesinin başka bir köşesinde bulması. Daha da güzel olanıysa tüm hikâye örgüsünün inanılmaz başarılı bir şekilde birbirine bağlanması ve gördüğümüz tüm tuhaflıklara mantıklı bir açıklama getirmesi. Ama bunun ne olduğunu keşfetmeyi size bırakıyorum ki oyunun eğlencesi kaçmasın.

Evet, kontrolleri günümüzde oldukça hantal kalıyor, grafikleri de artık yaşını belli ediyor ama verdiği his, yaşattığı macera ve içerdiği ürkütücü tuhaflıklar hâlâ ilk günkü kadar etkileyici.

[quote]Daha fazla incelememe göz atmak isterseniz Steam Küratör sayfamı ziyaret edebilirsiniz: [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39265984/]Pikselatör[/url][/b][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198147112487', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1575728266}
review:
[h1]PERLA DI AVVENTURA GRAFICA ORMAI DIMENTICATA[/h1]

Trattasi di avventura grafica anni '90 punta e clicca dall'insolita visuale isometrica.
La trama è molto introspettiva e incentrata sul protagonista Max che si risveglia chiuso in un manicomio (n.d.r. non voglio fare spoiler).
All'inizio si è spaesati dalla presenza di diverse ambientazioni ma il tutto trova un senso alla fine del gioco grazie alla trama e alle cutscene pre-renderizzate presenti (anche se invecchiate male). Si va infatti da manicomi a città desolate per poi finire in un circo e così via.. ogni livello sembrerà scollegato dagli altri inizialmente, offrendo al giocatore un senso di mistero e inquietudine data dall'intreccio narrativo.
Graficamente il gioco è in 2D senza particolari effetti speciali. L'audio è sufficiente anche se i dialoghi sono recitati male (nonostante sia presente la sola lingua inglese). E' possibile abilitare i sottotitoli.
Gli enigmi molto spesso sono logici (a parte un paio) e per lo più consistono nel cercare oggetti da usare in opportuni luoghi del livello (gli oggetti dell'inventario non sono combinabili).
Il più grave problema del gioco è però il sistema di controllo; il personaggio si muove e interagisce con gli oggetti solo attraverso mouse... niente supporto a gamepad e la tastiera la si userà solo per richiamare il menu del gioco (tasto ESC). Purtroppo gli spostamenti avvengono spostando il mouse nella direzione in cui si vuol far muovere il personaggio e poi tenendo premuto il tasto destro. Tale sistema risulta oltre che scomodo anche poco maneggevole in alcune sezioni dei livelli, sopratutto in quelle dove sono presenti corridoi molto stretti.

[u] In definitiva il gioco è consigliabile agli amanti delle avventure a patto di riuscire a sopportare il pessimo sistema di movimento e la grafica ormai datata. [/u]

review: A trippy nightmare through the bowels of your own messy brain, Sanitarium is an underrated classic in the adventure genre that, while outdated in a few respects, still has the power to suck you in. The puzzles are logical and (for the most part) well integrated into the game world. The plot is twisty, imaginative, and occasionally moving. And if some design aspects are archaic (the combat sequences in particular), they're brief and don't completely overstay their welcome. In short, a game that could use some of the attention it deserved twenty years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053734082', 'num_games_owned': 1696, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1574704231}
review:
[h1]Insanitarium[/h1]

Recommended by an old high school friend 20 years ago. Time to see if we are still friends.

Largely overlooked non-typical adventure game from 1998, starting with unusual control scheme that drives this bizarro surreal physiological thriller of a game. Can't even classify it as point & click, more like point & steer. Character movement works by holding RMB in one of 8 directions where you hold the cursor relative to the character, kinda like using a joystick. It's more involved than clicking and letting the game's own pathfinding do the heavy lifting and you will often have to un-stuck the little fekker from terrain obstacles. Not the happiest control scheme ever devised but workable.

The main driving force of any adventure, the plot itself, is very vague in the beginning and only gets more and more bizarre, seemingly unrelated and misleading up until near the very end of around 10 hour voyage it will take you to finish it. Initially it will make you believe you are dealing with consequences of your own automobile accident, recovering while unconscious, tied to a hospital bed and trapped in your own mind. But things get more surreal when old memories get thrown into the mix, eventually culminating with recent evens of greed and betrayal.

It all unfolds in 10 self-contained Chapters, each size of about 6 screens on average (actually one big continuous screen) and its own distinct sub-plots, where following chapter is unlocked after solving all puzzles in the current one. You can die in some of them but there are no notable penalties and you also can't dead-end yourself, falling back to hours old save. I quite enjoyed this format of one smaller area at a time because my focus was concentrated, with less items, NPCs and puzzles to worry about and no backtracking. Each new area is more unique than the next one and you'll never be able to predict what is coming next.

You'll be playing as a visual representation of your injured self, your young deceased sister, some kind of cyclops hero from a comic book you've read as a kid, and Olmec - among ancient Aztec civilization. Locations will follow closely by being equally if not more bizarre. I admit not understanding roughly half of the game having any connection to the main plot but that cold very well be to me not being cultured enough (contemporary audience were no dummies).

Atmosphere is very well done. From stylistic menus, minimalistic but functional UI, down to unique off-the-wall but believable NPCs, ambient sounds and overall music. Despite the art style being influenced from all over the place it still felt like a cohesive whole. Some people complain about poor voice acting but I cannot confirm that. It's more than professional and suits perfectly. I later saw in credits one guy voiced 8 different NPCs yet I was not even close to being aware of such practice.

Game is very text-heavy btw, featuring over 80 NPC with extensive but well written dialogues. Yet there are almost no filler or forgettable lines. Add to that 39 FMV cutscenes that look made in some form of advanced in-game engine version and you got yourself a full plate to handle. They can all be reviewed again from the menu once unlocked. Puzzles are very much based on speaking to everyone, often multiple times. I'd say 60% is solved through conversations. Good thing is topics of discussion get grayed out once exhausted and re-lit again should new information become available. That is how it's done.
The rest are classic object manipulation (never overwhelming), and some dozen specific puzzles a la redirecting water flow via pipe grid and valves, clicking stuff is specific order, arranging symbols as hinted in nearby environment, etc. Most are logical and others require trial and error until you get the handle. All are rewarding upon completion.

* * *

Technically the game is a port made to work on modern systems, original was made for Win 95. There were no glitches on my Win 7 machine except for one: quickload crashed the game 9/10 times when executed via keyboard shortcut (shift+l), and 5/10 when done via menu, both defeating the purpose of [i]quick[/i]. Luckily loading was hardly needed (not even to fill my guess-estimated 9/10 quota), but still... Steam overlay works perfectly which I feel the need to emphasize because it is a rarity for games from the previous millennia. Good job DotEmu.

Another two things that irked however me are slow walking speed of the character. Even with small self-contained chapters it could get annoying in few places, more so when stuck in what to do next and having to walk back and forth trying sheit out. Main offender being the little girl and the circus on Chapter 4. Seriously, 3 more lines of code to adjust walking speed slider would completely rectify that. In second half you'll get to control bit faster characters so that helped.

Last but not the least are two cases of severe pixel hunting. Practically unsolvable if it were not for a guide kinda severe. Later chapters add a bit of shine to important items to make them stand out from background clutter, showing devs became aware of the problem at some point. Why didn't they go back and added shine to that damn rock in front of the Church is a mystery for the ages. That, and the 3 not so easy anagram puzzles tied specifically to English language. F that. Same thing costed FEZ my own personal masterpiece grade reward.

* * *

Definitely try it I say, you won't regret it if you remotely like a quality dose of '90s adventure games. It's on the serious and logical side of things, not light headed and random like Sierra or Lucas Arts stuff. Pretty long too, but diverse enough to make every Chapter feel like its own mini-adventure. I should call my friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157412843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1573931560}
review:
Ce jeu est particulièrement réussi au niveau de son ambiance : on retrouve les sensations que l'on aurait devant un film d'horreur psychologique avec une grosse pointe fantastique. Cependant le scénario ne voulant jamais se révéler totalement, il y a des moments où l'on ne suit plus : on se retrouve embarqué dans des "missions" trop étranges. Cela est intentionnel et se comprend par l'histoire mais casse parfois l'immersion, qui personnellement, m'a rendu des passages très ennuyeux.
Pour les habitués des point'n click, on retrouvera une ou deux énigmes inévitables : celles que l'on résout sans avoir forcément compris son mécanisme. Sinon toutes les autres énigmes sont très bien équilibrées et pas forcément compliquées.
Ce jeu est globalement facile.

review:
PROS: This game is great fun. The story and levels are inventive and very well done. It's a horror mystery point and click puzzle game in which you go through several levels of the main character's psyche to find out what happened to him and reveal his trauma. It's a great throw back.

CONS: The only thing I can't stand about this game is how slow the main character moves throughout most levels and the controls are a little more than annoying. You have to hold down your mouse button to walk and after doing it for so long, your hand gets a little tired.

If you can get past the controls, the game is quite good and I highly recommend it. I hear there's a mobile version of the game, and given the controls and puzzles, I feel like Sanitarium might be more suited to mobile, so you might want to check that out. Please give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198118918750', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1613697640}
review:
[h1]У всякого безумия есть своя логика[/h1]
Шизариум (Sanitarium) - это атмосферный психологический триллер,  в жанре «Point & Click».
Cюжет рассказывает историю о непростой судьбе главного героя по имени Макс. Однажды попав в автокатастрофу он выживает, но при этом теряет память. Главный герой оказывается в клинике для душевнобольных он должен вспомнить всё и при этом не сойти с ума.

С Sanitarium (Шизариум) познакомилась, только в этом году и знакомство с этой игрой стало для меня приятной неожиданностью. С первых же минут игра погружает тебя в атмосферу безумия и тайн, ведь игрок, как и Макc  тоже не  понимает, что за фигня вокруг происходит. Так же на атмосферу игры влияет и потрясающая музыка, а ролики могут вызвать дрожь во всём теле. Играла с русской озвучкой, местами конечно спорный перевод, но в общем, лучше так чем с оригиналом.
Загадки умные и интересные, даже есть пару достаточно сложных.
Самой главной фишкой подобных игр это сюрреализм и безумие.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1797894370
Я считаю, что в игре можно сделать практически всё что угодно и говорить на любые темы, но это должно быть уместно,  а главное в правильных пропорциях.
Если всё сделано правильно, то  получаются такие шедевры как «American McGee’s Alice» и «Fran Bow».
В Шизариум слишком много местами безумия, а местами она слишком нудная и скучная. Это её единственный явный минус.
Поэтому рекомендую ознакомиться, всем любителем жанра, если кто пропустил и тем кому понравилась игра «Fran Bow».

author: {'steamid': '76561197992809773', 'num_games_owned': 5836, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1517306042}
review:
[イントロダクション]
目を覚ますとそこは石造りの牢獄のような場所のベッドの上。
一体ここがどこだか心当たりはない。それどころか自分が誰なのかすら思い出せない。
顔は大怪我をしたらしく包帯で何重にも巻かれているので自分の顔すら分からない。
幸い鍵のかかっていない鉄格子を開け、部屋を出ると自分と同じような姿の人達に出会う。
彼らが言うにはここは病院の病棟で我々は患者なのだと。

探索を続けていくうちに自分に関する僅かな手掛かりを得る。
自分は交通事故で大怪我を負いこの病院に運ばれてきたようだ。
それ以上のことは分からない。
そうして探索を続けるうちに、今いるこの建物に危機が迫っており一刻でも早く逃げ出さないとならないことに気づく……。

こうして主人公の過去と現在、そして為すべきことのある未来を探す旅が始まる。

[概要]
オリジナルは1998年発売のWindows95向けのサイコロジカル・ホラーアドベンチャーゲーム。
Wikipediaの記事に拠れば30万本以上のヒット作とのこと。
発売された1998年はちょうどCD-ROMドライブがパソコンに標準搭載されるようになり音声や動画が使えるようになった頃でこのゲームでは当時としてはふんだんに使われています。

このバージョンは互換性の問題など修正したもので、現代の64ビットOSでも問題なく稼動します。
さらにSteamのクラウドセーブや実績機能にも対応しています。
移植は(Steam界隈ではあまり良い評価のない)DotEmuが行なっていますが、本作では特に大きな問題は発生していないようです。
私がプレイした時(2017年頃)はクラウドセーブで容量不足のエラーが出るというバグがあり、クラウドセーブ機能をオフにしてプレイしていましたが現在は修正されていると思います。

日本語には未対応。使われている英語は難しくないと思いますが、予想を越えるストーリー展開のため自分の英語力不足かと悩んだりしました。

[ゲーム内容]
ゲームとしてはオーソドックスなポイント&クリックアドベンチャーゲーム。
ホラー的な要素は意外と少なく、椅子から飛び上がるようなどっきり演出や残虐描写などもなく、サイコロジカル寄りの内容です。

プレーヤーのすることは移動(マウスのカーソルの「位置」に主人公が移動するのでなく、カーソルのある「方向」に移動するという古いスタイル)、NPCとの会話、アイテムの取得と使用、装置などの使用といったところ。
パズル的な要素があちこちに用意されていますが難易度よりも操作性の悪さに悩むかもしれません。
ストーリーは最初(あるいは終盤まで)、いったい何がどうなっているのか混乱しますが、話が先に進むにつれて徐々に明らかになって行き、脈絡のない展開も全ては繋っていることに気づきます。
特にチュートリアル的な1章に続く2章の結末は、これはいったい何のゲームなんだ？と呆然とします。
時間があればSteam実績のコンプリートを兼ねてストーリーを追うことをメインにしてプレイすることをお勧めします。

難易度はそれほどではないのですが、操作性の問題でストレスが溜るところなどがありますので、詰まったらGoogleなどで"Sanitarium walkthrough"で検索すれば、古いゲームなので完全な攻略記事(walkthrough)が見つかると思います。

[評価]
この手のジャンルのゲームが好きなら、古さゆえの操作性の悪さの除いても非常にお勧め。

現代の技術でフルリメイクしたら良いものが出来そうなのですが、残念ながら今のところはそういった話はないようです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198082765157', 'num_games_owned': 9993, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1569173977}
review:
Like many other reviewers, this is a game I vaguely remember from my childhood. I played a demo that came on a CD-ROM stuck to the cover of a gaming magazine; PC ZONE I believe. Wow, remember those ancient physical media times? My overpowering memory is that the game seemed creepy and cool and the impact was sufficient that years later when I saw it in a game bundle, I just had to snap it up.

The game is a point and click adventure set in a nightmarish world formed in the broken mind of our protagonist Max.  The puzzles in the game range from the obvious to the obscure.  There are the usual "take item from X and use in location Y" style puzzles, and then there are a few more complex machinery puzzles that involve pulling levers and pressing switches until the inner workings make themselves clear.  If point and click games are your forte, you will probably find the game reasonably easy.  For the rest of us, there is at least one very comprehensive walkthrough available in the Community Hub!

Initially the story is shrouded in mystery as Max cannot be sure what is real and what is a fabrication of his mind.  It becomes more interesting as the game progresses, and I was keen to find out what would happen next.  At times it becomes convoluted and confusing but this is largely intentional, mirroring the confusion and fractured psyche of our protagonist.  The resolution is satisfactory and most of the threads are neatly tied up.

At the time, the graphics were rather fantastic but now they look pretty crude and the FMV cut scenes are really from a different era.  An era where it looked like all FMV 3D cut scenes were modelled and animated by the same team regardless of the game, developer or publisher.  An era that unless you have some nostalgia for, you may find too jarring to visit.  Personally, I enjoyed the grainy low resolution goodness.  Characters and backgrounds are decent and well animated, again for the time.

The dialogue is fully voiced, and for the most part the cast do an excellent job.  Some characters are cheesy and their actor's hammy but I like a bit of ham and cheese.  Some are creepy and the downright deranged characters are fun to interact with.

I really enjoyed the background music.  I want to say each level has a unique soundscape, but I'm sure there are motifs that are reused throughout the game.  Again, creepy.  The music really sets the tone of each level, and manages to capture the spirit of each scene very well.

It took me a while to get there, and I needed help, but I enjoyed my playthrough to the very end.  It took me around ten hours, but there were a couple of times I had to reload a previous save and replay a few sections.  This is only the case if you are hunting down the precious achievements, some of which are possible to miss.

There are a few movie influences, the most pressing being Jacob's Ladder which released about eight years before this game.   There's also a little nod to Terminator 2 at one point which I really enjoyed.  

Basically if you were a kid in the nineties you will probably find something to enjoy here, but it is probably best suited to people who enjoy point and click games, and people who enjoy horror.  People who love horror point and click games should love it.
