author: {'steamid': '76561198018826680', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1584658498}
review:
I love this game. It's clunky here and there, it's slow in certain levels, and this was valid even back when it was released. So these are its main flaws that will get right in your face while playing and you have to be willing to overcome those to fully enjoy the game. Also saving at the beginning of each chapter is a great idea. :)

Although Sanitarium is labeled as an adventure game, while being an adventure, it's mostly one guy's struggle to return to sanity and the world of the living after having a car crash. So in this regard it feels more like a quest. The game does a very good job at putting the puzzle pieces back together, to reveal who the main character is, what got him in this situation and who was behind it. His real-world frail state (coma) gives the game a lot of freedom to explore weird environments as the backbone of his gradual recovery. This keeps things fresh and the different characters you get to play as throughout the game will also come together in a late level, where you'll have to use their specific characteristics and abilities to advance.

Now what I love about the game:
- awesome soundtrack for a great atmosphere
- overall good voice acting
- the story of the main character's self-discovery, along with the details that add substance to it
- the fact that it's not as scary as the trailer suggests, because the story stands out better without too much horror (still creepy, though)
- talking to everyone doesn't take too much time, unless patience is something you lack, and talking doesn't just help you with your little missions/tasks, but also add a bit to the overall plots of each level, and even the big picture
- the mechanics of the game and handling your items are pretty straightforward for the most part
- as an adventure/quest game, it certainly requires patience, but that's nicely rewarded with a great soundtrack and how the story gets 

What I don't like about the game:
- the movement sucks sometimes, which gets in the way of having a smooth experience, although after 2-3 levels you get used to it and shouldn't be a surprise nor bother you that much
- Olmec is pretty slow and it can be a drag, but at least the levels you get to play as him look and sound great
- some puzzles can be quite difficult, so a walk-through might be required - just try on your own for a while, for greater satisfaction :P

Thanks for refreshing it, DotEmu! I had a lot of fun replaying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995982646', 'num_games_owned': 4611, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1567093446}
review:
Sanitarium, the award winning point & click, adventure game from DotEmu, released back in 1998.You take on the role of Max, an assistant to a doctor, who is trying to find a cure for some strange disease, which befell upon the population. The game starts with an intro cinematic of you driving off a cliff with your car. Waking up out of a coma eventually, the character suffers from amnesia. Up to the player, to take Max through a strange and unsettling trip in an effort to regain his memory.

Storyline is done greatly, as the game linearly progresses, through a variety of distinctly different scenarios, effectively dividing the game up into 13 chapters.Backtracking to previously visited locations is kept limited this way. Positive for these kinds of point & click adventure games. A fair amount of backtracking, roaming and searching is required still, however.Explained through perspective of someone who has amnesia, the developers can get away with this rather chaotic approach towards plot evolution. They make up for it in the latter chapters, when all pieces puzzle together. Helped by the abundantly cutscenes, which are gritty, slightly macabre and add to the atmosphere. This variety of settings and in the various chapters, keeps the game appealing throughout the whole playthrough. The whole has a  surrealistic feeling over it. You actually get three or four games in one.

Controlling Max seems a way to add some sort of difficulty to the game as well. Movement with the mouse can be tricky from time to time, especially in the puzzles that require more precise, finicky placement of the protagonist character. Also, it can be a nuisance when the automated movement, between different height levels for instance, is accidentally, unintendedlytriggered. One has to sit out the complete animation before returning. Sometimes it is hard to see where there is a path where Max can go.

Most puzzles are about just right concerning difficulty. For sure they are not too easy, but with some common, logic sense, sometimes some trial & error, one can get the solution without having to revert to walkthroughs and/or guides. There are some mini-games as well, next to the puzzles.

Audio in this game is outstanding overall: music, ambient sounds, voice acting, sound effects, all is done perfectly.All dialogue, which can be read, is spoken as well. A tremendous effort to have implemented this. It is done in such a fashion, one can simply hear the passion and dedication that went into it. At given times these dialogues and / or monologues are outright hilarious, not to mention geniously. During the end credits, a medley is played which is masterfully compiled from the most remarkable audible comments in the game. Further admiring the keen eye for detail from the developers, even the main menu options have atmospheric voice-overs when hovering over them with the mousecursor. Just the kind of things you would here when inhabiting a mental health institute yourself.

A perfect game, all 20 achievements, can be achieved in a single playthrough. Be careful however, there are two achievements that need special attention for this to happen. There is an achievement, “You are not alone”, which can be missed easily, simply because it does not contain the necessary actions to advance storyline. It requires you talking to every character in the game. The other one, “Remember you”, requires you to solve a puzzle at the very first try. It is advised to create a savegame entry just before this point. Refer to specific guides made available by the community for further reference.

To conclude:
Personally, never having played Sanitarium in the past, I was quite relieved to complete it eventually. Simply because of the transition a person has to make between the older, more pixelated graphics of the game, and when quitting, reverting back to a full HD resolution environment. Don’t get me wrong, I knew what I was getting into, beforehand. Being an oldskool gamer myself, I know what games were alike, back then. Only can have positive remarks about the graphics in Sanitarium, must have been next gen, back in the days. Sanitarium was a welcome interlude in my tight gaming schedule. Enjoyed playing and completing this gem, all in about 11 hours.

Recommended for: point & click, adventure game lovers, retro gamers and achievement hunters.

Cheers, SultanK

author: {'steamid': '76561198044049263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 1295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1295, 'last_played': 1564914263}
review:
Sanitarium'un methini çok uzun zaman önce duymuştum ancak bir türlü oynamak nasip olmamıştı. Geçenlerde fırsat varken yaz indirimlerinde alıp bir göz atmak istedim. Kimdir, kimlerdendir, sordum soruşturdum etrafa. Herkes bir efsane olduğundan bahsedip duruyordu. Bir zamanlar çeviri yaptığım oyunçeviride ekip arkadaşım olan Mutagenic de bu oyunu bizzat çevirince vardır bir hikmeti diye düşünmeye başladım ve aldım sazı elime. Bakalım dedikleri kadar var mıydı? Yoksa şişirilmiş bir balondan mı ibaretti? Eninde sonunda görecektim. 

Sanitarium oyuna başlarken 98 yılına göre çok iyi denilecek bir açılış videosu ile bizleri karşılıyor. Bir adam neredeyse sevinçten havalara uçacak bir şey keşfediyor ve eşini telefonla arayarak bu mutlu haberi üstü kapalı bir şekilde aktarıyor. Hava yağmurlu, sert bir rüzgar insanın götünü dondururken basıyor gaza. Bir yandan da teypte Ayna'nın yağmur ne güzel yağıyor şarkısı çalıyor. Asfaltı ağlatan karakterimiz hız limitini aştığının farkında bile olmayınca bir dağ kavisinde kontrolünü kaybediyor ve şarampolden aşağı yuvarlanıyor. Gözünü açtığında bir tımarhanede olduğunu fark ediyor ve üst kattaki bir manyağın kafasını duvara vurduğunu gözlemliyoruz. Yüzümüz yara bere içinde ve sargılı... Biz kimiz, neden buradayız, yüzümüzde neden koca bir sargı bezi olduğunu hatırlayamıyoruz. Kafa bir dünya olmuş, olan bitenin farkına varmaya ve hatırlamak için mücadele vermeye çalışıyoruz. Bu noktadan sonra söz bize bırakılıyor ve Sanitarium tıkla ve ilerle olarak ifade edebileceğimiz bir korku - macera oyununun kapılarını sonuna dek aralıyor. 

1998 yılında çıkan bir oyunu henüz oynamadıysanız ve grafikler konusuna takıntılı bir oyunsever iseniz sakince klavyeyi yere bırakmanızı ve başka bir macera aramanızı rica edeceğim. Görseller konusunda Sanitarium, zamanının çok ötesinde bir yapım olsa da günümüz koşullarında 70 yaşında bulunan kokonalara benziyor. Ama ben yakışıklı ya da güzel olmasına değil kişiliğe önem veririm diyorsanız doğru yerdesiniz demektir. Çünkü Sanitarium istediğinizi fazlasıyla verecektir. İzometrik bir bakış açısına sahip olan oyunda kabuslarınızı yenmek için bir bakacaksınız ki bir sirkte yer alacak ve orayı burayı karıştıracak, bir bakacaksınız ünlü bir çizgi roman karakterine bürünüp böceklerin dünyanızı yok etmesine engel olan bir kahraman olacaksınız. Bölümleri bitirdiğinizde hayal meyal bir şeyler hatırlayacak ve kafayı yiyen sadece karakter değil acaba ben de mi cozutuyorum lan diye düşünmeye başlayacaksınız. Farklı karakter ve çeşitli mekanlarla karşımıza çıkan Sanitarium sıkmadan oynatmanın yolunu bulmuş ve deliliğin uç noktalarında gezmenin ne demek olduğunu bizlere göstermiştir. Hele o diyalogları seslendirenler, adamlar sanki karakterin içine girmiş ve onları doya doya yaşamışlar. Duyana kadar bekleyin derim. Müzikler deseniz keza öyle, oyun ile çok güzel bir birliktelik kurmuşlar. Evlilikleri yıllanmış ve içlerindeki aşkı hiç sönmemiş ihtiyarlar gibiler. 

Sanitarium konusunda yapımcılar karşısında bir şapka da ben çıkartmak istiyorum. Söylenilenlerin hepsi noktası noktasına kadar doğruymuş. Karşımızda macera oyunlarının atası bulunmaktadır. Hikayesi ve kolay oynanışıyla kendisine bağlayan ve zamanın nasıl akıp gittiğini anlayamadığımız bu oyunu iki kardeş yaratmış. Biri oyunun devamının gelmesini isterken ötekisi ise oyun çok tuttu burada bırakalım, bırakalım ki Sanitarium da efsane oyunlardan biri haline gelsin demiştir. Çok geçmemiş iki kardeşin kurduğu bu firma da kepenkleri indirmiş ve Sanitarium da efsaneler arasındaki yerini çok geçmeden almıştır. Üzerinden tamı tamına 21 koca sene geçmiş ve karşınızda hala zaman geçirmenizi sağlayacak bir oyun var. Sonuçta ölüm insanlar içindir, efsaneler asla ölmezler. Sizce de öyle değil midir?

author: {'steamid': '76561198075820042', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1565325623}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38287655-Prof.Vaharrak/]Prof.Vaharrak's Curator Group - Almost 30 years of gaming experience at your service[/url]

A literally insane third person isometric puzzle adventure game that tells a twisted story through it's many characters.

I played this back in the day on CD ROM and it quickly became one of the most memorable games in this vein that I've played. As part of an older generation of games, the controls are a bit clunky, the graphics won't offer much to the more demanding audience and there's not much of an indication of what to do next, requiring (sometimes) a little bit of lateral thinking and (sometimes) a little bit of good ol' brute forcing through trial and error. There's very little combat (and it's as ugly as you can imagine) but you don't really "die", you are only reset to a previous location.

All in all, I can still recommend this game if you like a good, old fashioned experience with a dash of suspense and psychological horror. Won't lie to ya, the controls are shit and the graphics are a throwback to a simpler era, but the experience is pure gold.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109051235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1587951805}
review: I'm a huge fan of point-and-click type games such as this. I was really interested in playing an older game, and I'd heard promising things about this game. While there is a slight camp vibe to the game, I personally enjoy this aspect. The voice-acting can be a bit goofy, and some of the animations of the characters are a bit silly, but it doesn't really deter from the rest of the game in my opinion. It has a nostalgic feel, and does provide some genuinely unsettling moments on top of the game's dark themes. The controls are fairly simple, but the pace at which you walk may drive some a bit mad. Overall, the game is fun to explore and experience at least once, so with that I highly recommend having this oddball game in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226843724', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1561909045}
review:
This game is like a breath of fresh air among modern drab projects.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ Exciting plot
+ You can play four characters
+ Interesting and diverse levels
+ Well-written NPC characters
+ No critical bugs and random crashes. 
+ You won't lose any progress after death

[b]Cons:[/b]
- The speed of the characters is very slow(except Grimwall).
- Clunky controls. The main character can't normally interact with the environment and have a boss fight.
- At some point NPCs can block the way and the main character gets stuck (this problem can occur at chapter 4. Someone mentioned it might happen at chapter 3).
- Not memorable and sometimes annoying musical accompaniment.

[b]8 'Too far away' of 10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198069152081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1701523341}
review:
One of the very first "point" and click adventures I've played and is still dearly remembered. Sadly it's quite linear so replay value is limited but story more than makes up for it. Unfortunately I can't mention anything specific about story without spoiling it. It's spooky, sinister and weird at times but overall great and very creative. Puzzles are not all that difficult but very enjoyable and creative. Controls leave a lot to be desired and they definitely show their ugly outdated nature, however I think one can get use to them and play the game without too many issues. Sound design and music however are really really good. This is something of a trend with old classics like this one, where emphasis on sound design was huge. Music in this game will add so much to the overall feeling.

Just listen to that masterpiece: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQEllLdiIAY&list=PL-RRSgfBeVysgionFUx8ioGEQCOW_kA7K&index=3

Overall if you like point and click adventures with some RPG elements, get it, it's well worth the price and you will have fun few dozen hours.

review:
Any enjoyment you get out of this game will be ruined by:
[list]
    [*]Crashes that tend to happen when you finish a chapter. Hope you saved your game, 'cause there sure as hell are no autosaves.
    [*]Getting your character stuck in the environment in the cyclops chapter near the end, after the bridge collapses. Have fun replaying from your last save point, whenever that was.
    [*]A poor control scheme, which gets extremely annoying in the maze.
[/list]
While I might forgive the last point if I'm feeling generous, the first two are really inexcusable and reflect rather poorly on the developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028860783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1425799382}
review: A classic point and click adventure game with heavy horror themes, genuinely creative and unique. It's a bit clunky, but well worth it. It manages to build up a great, unsettling atmosphere in it's multiple areas/worlds. These places are very abstract and open to interpretation to make sense of the madness (though occasionally I think it spells out some things a little too much). A great hidden gem from a golden age of gaming creativity I think.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098776664', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1550275333}
review:
Sanitarium is a pretty good game FOR ITS TIME
If you're into retro gaming, and you want something that was excellent for its time, or you want to feel a sense of madness I'd recommend this game.

I played this a while back, I am replaying it currently...
I would like to mention that if you have sensitive ears like myself, you may want to turn down the volume and not use headphones. BECAUSE the game tries to make you feel a sense of...madness...there's a lot of loud music that wraps itself around your brain and numbs your eardrums...

It's very wordy....and don't expect a lot of jump scares or action.

I wouldn't consider this "SCARY" either...it's more "unsettling" than anything else.

It's worth a playthrough for those that like story-based games and like to feel a little uncomfortable

author: {'steamid': '76561198239216388', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1549379515}
review:
Sanitarium. Ne desem bilemiyorum. Bir efsane olduğu kesin ama göklere çıkartılacak bir oyun da değil bence. Öncelikle bu, benim oynadığım ilk point & click macera oyunu o yüzden yorumlarımı ona göre dikkate alın. Benim gibi türe başlamak isteyenler varsa bu oyunu    önerebilirim ama yine de bu anlamda en iyi tercih olmayabilir. Birkaç eksisinden bahsedelim:                  


-Kriptik Bulmacalar
Bu oyunun bazı yerleri harbiden zor, bir de benim gibi internetten bakmamak için direnen biriyseniz size kolay gelsin derim. Ben oyun boyunca sadece bir yerde internetten çözüme baktım ama birkaç yerde cidden ufak çaplı sinir krizleri geçirdim. Sonra bala göte, o ya da bu şekilde bulmacaları çözdüm.


-Oyunda Koşma Olsa Mıymış Acaba?
Bu kriptik bulmacalar yüzünden bazı yerlerde haritayı bir aşağı bir yukarı dolaşıp duruyorsunuz çözümü bulma umuduyla ama bilin bakalım ne oluyor? YOK ANASINI SATAYIM YOK YOK! Mal gibi dolaşıyorsunuz öyle. Bir de o karakterin aheste aheste yürümesi sizi çıldırtıyor.


-Bazı bölümler çok çok iyiyken bazı bölümlerde oyun düşüşe geçiyor. Oyunun hiçbir bölümünün kötü olduğunu düşünmüyorum ama meh diyebilebileceğimiz bölümler de yok değil. Sizi sonuna kadar akıcı bir şekilde götürüyor, onda bir sıkıntı yok ama bunun da belirtilmesi gerekiyor çünkü oyunun abartıldığı kadar muhteşem ötesi bir oyun olmamasının ana sebebi de bu bence. 


-Merdiven Meselesi
Yönettiğimiz karakter merdivenleri otomatik olarak çıkıp iniyor. Karakteri hareket ettirmek zaten çok rahat değil, o yüzden istemeden merdivene yürürseniz o merdivenin sonuna kadar çıkacaksınız. Ufak ama biraz sinir bozucu bir detay.


Genel olarak negatif bir incelemeymiş gibi durabilir ama bu sizi yanıltmasın. Birkaç eksiği var, evet süper değil ama kesinlikle hoş bir oyun. Deneyin.

Not: Oyunu Fransızca oynadım. Seslendirmeler falan iyi, oyunun dili de çok ağır değil. O yüzden Fransızca öğrenmeye çalışanlara ekstra öneriyorum. (Alt yazıları açmayı unutmayın.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062739674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1547628490}
review:
[h1]Shut up! Shut up! I can't take it anymore![/h1]
Sanitarium is a curious game. On one hand, it's not 'scary' in the way that a lot of horror games typically are, with in your face gore and highly detailed/graphically intimidating environments to immerse you in the game. But this game is genuinely disturbing, constructing an atmosphere successfully with obviously dated graphics (which I am convinced can make a scarier game - ie, uncanny valley) and of course, the power of storytelling. It comes recommended if you are a fan of point and click adventure games (this one is focused on puzzles rather than branching storytelling), but keep in mind that there are a lot of disturbing sights in this game, with some chapters being worse than others. 

[b]Gameplay[/b]
It is an isometric point and click adventure game, meaning pretty much all you need is the mouse. You left click on stuff to interact with it, and hold right click to move your character in a certain direction. There weren't really any problems with the controls for me, with the only central issue being that there is sometimes pathfinding issues for the main character - it wasn't game-breaking or anything, and it was only ever really 'frustrating' during one of the few 'action' sequences, where the character wouldn't hit an object required without some careful maneuvering. However, the few times this comes up are cancelled out by the promise of the story unravelling ahead of you. 

[b]Story[/b]
A big part required of a game for me has to be storytelling. There also needs to be a reason they told this story in video game format rather than telling it in a non-interactive medium - does it invest the player in the world, or the characters, or the story? 
Sanitarium manages all three with it's mind-bending and as I said earlier, quite disturbing story, told through it's environments. There's a lot to be said for 'mundane horror', something I haven't seen too many games use effectively. Sanitarium uses it and then some, and with each use the developers show the mastery that they have over horror tropes. 
In modern times, I'm not sure how many people are still genuinely terrified of the practically copy and paste zombies that litter so many horror games and films. 
In great contrast, Sanitarium's unique ideas come across as spine-chillingly depraved. In one level, you enter a disgustingly organic room and find [spoiler]a giant insect hurling children into a furnace to heat it[/spoiler]. The almost off-handed and casual manner in which this is done might not be 'scary' the way many modern audiences expect their horror, but it's the kind of thing that can take root in your brain and maybe return at the worst moments. 
To say too much about the story would spoil everything, but it's safe to say the storytelling throughout the levels makes good use of the overarching story, the story contained within a chapter, and even the small stories told by the side characters. Even the small characters feel fleshed out and useful, even if in actuality they are not. The story is the best feature of this game, even if the final chapter does make the villain pretty cheesy, and the game devolves into somewhat nonsense and tedium the further you get through the game. It's by no means the best adventure game I've ever played, but the story remained compelling enough to see it through till the end. 
There's also an immense amount of symbolism contained within this game and I'd be hard pressed to find and uncover what it all means. But I'm sure it all means something...

[b]Graphics, Sound, Atmosphere[/b]
It's a game from 1998 - the graphics are fuzzy, but still detailed enough to fill in the blanks, yet probably lacking just enough detail in some areas to keep your mind working away feverishly on just what the bloody hell is going on. If you don't like older graphics, then obviously you won't like these ones. 
The sound is good, especially the music and environmental noises and background chatter. These create wonderful unique atmospheres throughout the different environments that you travel to. Where the game falls slightly flat is the voice acting. Some characters are better than others, and although most line delivery is pretty good, sometimes you get a flat or oddly delivered line that kind of takes you out of it. Also, the main/pause menu is the eeriest one I've ever experienced, just because of the voice that tells you what you've just selected. 
The atmosphere is superb, creating a strange sense of isolation and eerieness throughout the game. You go through an odd, disturbing village in chapter 2, wander through an asylum, a carnival, and more. Each one of these worlds feels like it's own world, even if you don't hang around in it for all that long. They all are developed enough to feel like they could be the center focus of a whole game by itself, but the game presents so many amazing locales all in the one package. 

[b]Conclusion[/b]
If you want a generally smart, occasionally stupid, highly symbolic story that stands on its own without the symbolism if you miss it, as well as a good amount of puzzles (with only one or two that have relatively nonsensical answers, easily resolved with a guide), then this game is for you. It's a masterful experience, tarnished only for me by the ending chapter (which made the whole thing slightly more comical and ham-fisted for me than it needed to be) and a few puzzles that were more annoying than they had to be. It is an example of how video-game storytelling can create horror more effectively than most movies, even if it crashes and burns towards the end, and a truly unique experience. Worth a try if you enjoy these kinds of games. I feel like there was more potential contained within this game, which saves it from true greatness in my mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264048470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1562462029}
review:
Best $10.00 I've spent on a game in a long time. It wasn't very long as there's only 9 chapters but I couldn't stop playing the whole time. The atmosphere, music, voice acting, all of it was incredible. It's very different from anything else I've played. I love the main character, Max and the interactions he has. I had to look up the answers to a lot of the puzzles because otherwise I would have had no idea how to complete them. But other than that, it was an incredible experience and I'm going to start recommending it to anyone who's looking for a cheap psycological horror experience! 
The gore and story itself took risks a lot of games don't take, and despite the old graphics, it still made me feel uncomfortable and had a good way of placing you in the atmosphere. I'm shocked I hadn't heard of this game up until now, but it was definitely an incredible experience.
Don't know if I'd play through it again myself, but I'll definitely show it to others and watch them play!
If you're debating on whether you should get this, just go for it. Also, if you're unfamiliar with older games, prepare for walking to be set to right click!!! If you don't have a mouse it can prove to be difficult to get used to. But once you do get used to it, it's relatively easy to do. 
This game has definitely revived my love for point and click horror experiences and I'm now going to be on the look out for anything similar!
Slice and dice, baby!!

review:
Это прекрасный представитель практически мертвого жанра КЛАССИЧЕСКОГО КВЕСТА. При этом это не просто хороший классический квест, это очень АТМОСФЕРНЫЙ классический квест. И ностальгический. 
Пусть вас не испугает устаревшая, пиксельная графика, для 1998 года (вроде бы) это было очень неплохо. Хорошая история, довольно много уровней, отличных друг от друга, простые загадки.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150458012', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1544248951}
review:
This game is super cool!  Love the surrealism! :)  It's about a guy who gets into a car accident and wakes up in a mysterious asylum in an amnesiac state, and from that point on, things really go down the rabbit hole.   The protagonist must traverse through a series of strange fantasy lands in order to regain back his memories.  During this psychotic trip, the main character will have to solve puzzles, speak to others to obtain clues, and just figure out what the heck is even going on!

Overall, I found the story to be really engaging, and I enjoyed every chapter (well, The Maze portion in Chapter 8 was pretty annoying IMO, but everything else was fun).  I like how each chapter has its own setting with its own set of characters… a couple of the later chapters may seem disjointed at first, but they all contribute to the overarching story of the game.  A must play for psychological horror fans!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042816721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1541994569}
review:
This is probably the best point-and-click game that I've played. The worlds, characters, and storyline are brilliantly imaginative, and engage the player in great puzzles that are just intuitive enough to require outside-the-box thinking, but not difficult enough to force one to have their hand held by a walkthrough. The atmosphere created is one-of-a-kind, eerie, and intriguing, but not so indulgent in the grotesque that one has to spend every second in anticipation of another shock. I found the experience to be highly enjoyable, and I had trouble putting it down. 

You can buy this beautiful experience for the price of one night's Chinese takeout, so I urge you to give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032387023', 'num_games_owned': 1898, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1539785035}
review:
Sanitarium was one of the games that I have played in my childhood (had gotten stuck at the fountain puzzle), which always stayed with me somewhere in the dark corners of my mind. Years later, I have decided that it was time to play it through and it was a mind-blowing experience. Sanitarium is an isometric adventure game. Although categorized as horror, it is more a surreal psychologically thrilling experience rather than a scary one. Game starts in a very creepy atmosphere with very dark tones, great sound effects and music. You wake up in an asylum with no memory of your own identity. Interestingly enough, this was not the only time Sanitarium reminded me of another masterpiece, Planescape: Torment. Whether it is the isometric style, occasional surrealistic dark fantasy setting, use of a similar color palette, spectacular writing, or how much it pushes the video games as a form of art, Sanitarium (despite being a point-and-click adventure game) managed to capture a similar space in my subconscious only Planescape: Torment had before. 

The general psychologically disturbing tone of the game takes different turns in later chapters to the extent it may get confusing. Fortunately, the game awards the patient player with how it wraps up everything in the end into a cohesive, unforgettable story.  It delves deep into sensitive subjects like insanity in a remarkable way. Sanitarium has taken the spot as my favorite adventure game ever and if you are even remotely interested in this genre, you owe yourself to “experience” Sanitarium. 

[b]10/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197990067358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1539550572}
review:
Collector of classic adventure games? Then you should consider this one. Warning: It is likely to linger with you.
Old adventure game, but still very playable on win10 - and very good. It's one of those games that I played a long while ago, and couldn't quite shake, so I had to grab it om Steam. And it's been a good revisit.

It is not a kid's game - the storyline is mature and very sombre. Insanity, macabre and grotesque is some of the words that comes to mind. It is perfect for a Halloween play, but as long it is not sunny and happy weather outside, you are good to go - the game mood demands that ;)

Being several years old, some of the graphics are (ofc) not of latest, but it does not hinder the story but adds to the mood setting. Voice overs are in general very good, and the controls are ok. Well, except if near staircases - the game really loves those staircases... I got maybe around 8 hours game out of it - don't mind the 10 hours listed (atm), I had the game running while doing a few RL chores.

If I had to choose only one game to recommend to a stranger, it would be this one.  If you are reading these reviews, you must like the general puzzle/psychological horror genre.  And if you like these genres, you will not be disappointed in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046965704', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1537667891}
review:
No suelo jugar este tipo de juegos (point and click) y generalmente no suelo abrirme a  videojuegos antiguos que no haya jugado ya en mi infancia, ya que usualmente suelen aburrirme o las mecanicas son muy tediosas y muy de otra época, pero realmente siento que este juego está muy bien construido y ha envejecido de maravilla, la ambientación es increible, la dirección de arte es genial y la historia, atrapante. Es un juego algo complicado, pero satisfactorio cuando encuentras la solución a los puzzles. Este juego realemente me ha marcado  desde que lo jugué por primera vez allá por el 2015, aún recuerdo su soundtrack y me es imposible no recordar los escenarios de cada nivel. Me alegra que tanto steam como gog traigan joyitas como estas para ser revividas en nuestra época.

En conclusión, realmente lo recomiendo, y me gustaría jugar más titulos similares a este en la actualidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044465810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1535498097}
review:
[h1]Ein sehr gut gealtetes, atmosphärisches Point & Click-, Adventure-Horror Game, mit Fokus auf die eigene Psyche!
Ein Retro-Klassiker unter den Adventures![/h1]

Das Videospiel, welches den Titel "Sanitarium" (dt. Sanatorium; Kurklinik oder Psychiatrische Klinik) trägt, ist anfang 1998 nur für den PC veröffentlicht worden. Die Publisher sind DotEmu und entwickelt wurde das Ganze von DreamForge Intertainment. Kategorisiert wird das Spiel eher zum Point & Click-, Adventure-, Horror-Genre, welches aus einer 2D-isometrischen Überblicksperspektive gesteuert wird.
Die zentrale Thematik beschäftigt sich mit einem Mann, der einen Autounfall hatte, durch diesen Unfall bedingt, nun unter einer Amnesie leidet, und sich in einem Sanatorium wieder findet. In diesem Sanatorium erkundet und hinterfragt der Protagonist, wie und warum er als Insasse im Sanatorium lebt. Das Ziel der Reise beschäftigt sich mit dem Herausfinden, wer der Protagonist wirklich ist.
Doch wie kann man seine wahre Identität herausfinden, wenn alle einem als "verrückt" erklären?

[b]STORY/HANDLUNG:[/b]
Der Handlungstrang verfolgt einen Mann, der durch einen Autounfall bedingt, unter Amnesie leidet und nun in einem Sanatorium lebt. Ohne Wissen und Erinnerung an sein früheres "Ich" ist, meiner Meinung nach, der "perfekte Start" um eine Geschichte zu beginnen, denn somit wird beim Spieler schon von Anfang an, solch eine Spannung und Neugierde erzielt, die einen interessanten Einstieg in die Story ermöglicht. Umso mehr ich dieses Spiel gespielt habe, desto atmosphärischer, düsterer, tiefgründiger und klarer wurde das Spiel, da man die Bruchstücke eines Individuums, erst nach und nach, enthüllen konnte. Während man erst stückchenweise über den Protagonisten erfährt, gibt man ebenfalls den Spieler genug Platz und Freiraum, zum Interpretieren und Thesenaufstellung, was ich als sehr gelungen in diesem Spiel empfunden habe, da das Spiel die ganze Zeit über mit Metaphern arbeitet. Das Storytelling wird nicht nur durch die Charaktere, mit dessen Begegnung und verbalen Unterhaltung, bestimmt, sondern auch durch kurz eingeblendete cinematic Zwischensequenzen, die, selbst heutzutage, eigentlich noch relativ hübsch anzuschauen sind. Insgesamt punktet das Spiel, story-technisch, mit einem genialen Start, eine interessante und mit Metaphern vollbesetzte, psychologische Weiterführung der Geschichte und zwei möglich erreichbaren Endings. Es gab nur einen/ein Abschnitt/Level im Spiel, welches ich als sehr langartig, sinnlos und langweilig empfunden hatte, der Rest passte perfekt zum Geschehen.

[b]CHARAKTERE/CHARAKTERDESIGN:[/b]
Den Protagonisten des Spiels, ein erwachsener Mann mit Amnesie, kann man mit diesen Charaktereigentschaften beschreiben: Glaubwürdig, bodenständig, rational-denkend, witzelnd, fürsorglich und gewissenhaft. Mit diesen Charaktereigenschaften hat man, für mich persönlich, einen sympathischen Protagonist erschaffen, den man gerne spielt und ihm auf der Suche nach der Wahrheit helfen möchte. Sein äußeres Erscheinungsbild ist ebenfalls sehr passend zur derzeitigen Situation, gewählt. Der Protagonist trägt Kleidung eines Insassens und sein Gesicht ist komplett mit einer Bandage versehen. Dieses bandagierte Detail ist so genial ausgedacht, sodass es sogar eine Bedeutung hat und diese erst zum Ende zu verdeutlicht wird.
Der Antagonist ist auf den ersten Blick nicht eindeutig im Spiel ausfindig zu machen, da man zwischendurch verschiedene Abschnitte im Spiel, in die verschiedensten Rollen, schlüpfen muss. Mal als kleines Mädchen, mal als Zyklop eines Comics oder als aztekische Gottheit, finden manche Abschnitte im Spiel statt, somit ändert sich, auf den ersten Blick, stetig der Antagonist. Dennoch finde ich den Antagonisten passend gewählt, da man ihn nicht sofort als solch einen "entlarven" würden, und seine persönlichen Hintergründe sind ebenfalls optimal und stimmig, ausgedacht.
Die Nebencharaktere sind alle glaubwürdig, gut platziert und vom äußeren Erscheinungsbild passen sie sich ebenfalls sehr gut der Situation an.

[b]SOUND/SOUNDKULISSE:[/b]
Die Vertonung des Spiels, diesmal spielte ich es auf deutsch, normalerweise spiele ich sonst alles auf englische Sprachausgabe, ist sehr gelungen! Diese deutsche Vertonung zählt zu denen, wo man sich damals noch richtig Mühe gemacht hat, und auch seine Stimme zum Geschehenen, realitätsnah, schauspielern konnte, OHNE das es gekünselt wirkt. Beispiele für alte und geniale deutsche Vertonungen sind die Gothic-Spielereihe, Dragon Age: Origins und die Animeserien namens "Dragonball" und "Yu-Gi-Oh". Die deutsche Vertonung in "Sanitarium" ist umgangsprachlich hart, aber wahr, ernst zu nehmend und auch an machen Stellen witzig. Jeder Charakter ist vertont und man hört kaum doppelte Synchronsprecher. Die musikalische Untermalung ist hingegen, als Vergleich zur deutschen Sprachausgabe, eher nur befriedigend ausgefallen. Die Soundtracks waren schon stimmig, haben sich der Situation angepasst, aber sind mir mehrheitlich nicht als "Meisterwerk" in Erinnerung geblieben.

[b]ATMOSPHÄRE:[/b]
Die Atmosphäre im Spiel ist düster, gruselig, Spannungsbogen-aufbauend und mit vielen Metaphern zweideutig (nicht in sexueller Hinsicht!) versehen.
Alles was man sieht, ist nicht das, was man denkt, zu sehen. Und genau das liebe ich sehr an diesem Spiel, dass die Welt ebenfalls man einer Bedeutung zuschreiben kann und nichts grundlos geschieht! Hier arbeitet man subtil mit den Horror, sodass er eher meistens implizit, auf der Metaebene, stattfindet und somit nicht sofort explizit offensichtlich ist. Ich liebe solche dichten und düsteren Atmosphären, bei denen jedes kleinste Detail als Reiz eine Rolle spielt, und man somit zum Interpretieren angeregt wird, was nochmal zusätzliches Storytelling darbietet.

[b]GAMEPLAY:[/b]
Das Spiel wird eher zweidimensional, in einer isometrischen Überblicksperspektive, gespielt. Die Steuerungs-Fortbewegung des Protagonisten fühlt sich oftmals unpräzise und störrisch an. Nur das Anklicken von Objekten ist ein typisches Point & Click-Element. Das Einsehen des Inventares wird erst durchs Anklichen des Protagonisten offensichtlich. Des weiteren kann man keine Objekte miteinander kombinieren. Die Rätsel im Spiel sind manchmal anspruchsvoll fordernd und manchmal etwas einfacher gestaltet. 
Doch auch bei diesem Spiel gilt die typische Point & Click-Frustration: Man weiß, wie man das Rätsel lösen kann, klickt alles mögliche an, aber findet nicht den gewünschten Gegenstand. Und im Nachinein merkt man, dass man TROTZ des vielen herumklickens, IMMER NOCH einen blöden mili-Winkel übersehen hat... Die Spieldauer beträgt ca. zwischen 8 und 10 Stunden Unterhaltung.

[b]FAZIT:[/b]
Zusammenfassend kann ich zu dem alten Adventure-, Point & Click Spiel namens "Sanitarium" folgendes sagen:
Es ist ein überdurchschnittlicher Retro-Klassiker, durch und durch! Sanitarium punktet extrem mit dem genialen Storyaufbau, fortlaufend mit der interessanten und stimmigen Story. Des weiteren ist der Protagonist und die Welt, in der er sich befindet, auf psychologischer Metabene, die implizit mit dem Horror und Storytelling arbeitet, sodass man zur eigen-Interpretation angeregt wird! Ebenfalls als sehr gut gelungen empfinde ich die deutsche Sprachausgabe und die Charaktergestaltung-, sowie Entwicklung. Der Soundtrack ist zwar eher mittelmäßig befriedigend, trägt aber nicht negativ zur Atmosphäre bei. Gelegentlich wird man vielleicht an der einen, oder anderen Stelle im Spiel, die typische "Point & Click-Frustration" erleben, die aber bei solch einer lebhaften, interesannten Welt und Storydesign, schnell wieder vergessen wird.  Folglich überwiegen, für mich persönlich, die postiven Merkmale des Spiels, sodass ich dementsprechend jeden dieses relativ gut gealterte Spiel empfehlen kann, der gerne Retro Point & Click Spiele spielt, sowie sehr hohen Wert auf eine tiefgründige und schlüssige Story, mit Fokus auf die Psyche, legt!

[b]RATING: 9/10[/b]

[i]Written by Rithleen[/i]

review:
Sanitarium é um dos adventures mais estranhos que eu já joguei.

É bizarro, é grotesco e ao mesmo tempo tem uma história intrigante cheia de momentos únicos diferentes de tudo que eu já vi em qualquer jogo de videogame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064044140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1482783955}
review:
It's one of those that remain relevant even years after being released. Hands down one of my favorite point-and-click, it doesn't feel aged at all. Of course the graphics look old, but their particular style still works very well today, and it isn't glitchy. If anything, it adds to the bizarre atmosphere of the game. The controls are still okay today, way less annoying than some other point-and-click I've experienced, the perspective might seem weird at first when you're not used to it, but it's never a bother. 

I see a lot of people praising the story, I personally wasn't too impressed with the ending (last segment of the game feels like it's too much), don't expect anything spectacular, however what truly captivated me was the atmosphere each segment of the game managed to create. I don't want to say anything about it, the less you know going in, the better. It's gonna be a pretty macabre experience is all I would say, but you'd already know that looking at pictures of the game.

I'd talk about the puzzles and the difficulty, since it's a classic adventure game... but to be honest, I don't remember much? The story is still very clear in my head (lol), but I can't remember if I was ever frustrated with a puzzle, or needed to look anything up. I guess it means it was well-balanced, and nothing made me want to pull my hair out looking for the answer. I don't remember anything with a dumb logic either. 

I'd recommend this to anyone who likes psychological horror, even if not a fan of adventure games, this one is definitely one of the easier ones to get into. For its price, it's not too much of a risk.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983157825', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1673663827}
review: I played this game years ago as a teenager, and it was one of the coolest, strangest, most inthralling games I'd ever played. Even now, the replay value is almost like playing the game for the first time. There is no action, it's decent graphics for it's day, but where this game shines it's the atmostphere and the way each stage makes you feel. It's a great phsycological horror game that will keep you playing for hours at a time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014977056', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1531609424}
review:
So back when this game came out I didn't really try to hard. I got to a few puzzles and just gave up. When it went on sale I thought why not give it a try. 5 bucks for a few hours it seemed worth it. It was. There was some legitimate creepy moments here and a few times where I could see how my taste in horror movies were shaped by this game. If you are looking for an adventure game that mostly makes sense give it a shot. The accents in the Aztec stages are problematic now but it never becomes offensive. Then again that is from the perspective of a 35 year old white male. So take that with a grain of salt. 

Good adventure game. Controls are frustrating sometimes and puzzles are fair.

review: Old but gold. It isn't super long, but this is from the old era where games could actually be hard. It's basically a puzzle game, some of which are easy, some of which can be difficult or counterintuitive. The actual movement is a bit janky, and the graphics are kinda dated but really not that bad (it basically feels like playing Fallout), and voice acting ranges from really decent to pretty bad but otherwise it's a pretty solid game. I'd recommend it to anyone who likes atmospheric, puzzle, or generally darker old school games. It's definitely worth grabbing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089599563', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1524547936}
review:
J'ai enfin fait ce jeu présenté comme culte et dont j'avais tant entendu parler pour pleins de raisons et je le trouve excellent.

Déjà premier point ce jeu a très bien vieilli il est parfaitement jouable encore aujourd'hui les graphismes sont agréables, soignés et assez détaillés, le gameplay est surprenant au début parcequ'on ne s'attend à avoir ça dans un point & click c'est à dire que vous dirigez votre personnage en maintenant le bouton droit de la souris et en pointant la souris dans la direction voulu on s'y fait très vite vous verrez. Le seul aspect dû à l'âge qui m'a un peu géné c'est le son qui est vraiment de mauvaise qualité enfin qui a la qualité de son époque mais rien de rédhibitoire.

Pour ce qui est du scénario, de l'ambiance et de l'univers, c'est prenant on veut comprendre mais je ne peux pas ne pas dire que je m'attendais à beaucoup mieux car en effet si j'ai tant entendu parler de ce jeu c'était surtout pour son scénario, arrivé à la fin du jeu je me suis dit "c'est tout ?" tellement je m'attendais à une fin et un scénario qui vous retourne la tête et vous fait cogiter un moment... Ceci dit comme je l'ai dit le scénario est bon mais pour moi il ne faut pas s'attendre à un truc de fou (héhé) comme je m'y attendais...
J'ai l'impression que ce qui a vraiment fait de la pub au scénario de ce jeu c'est sa malheureuse censure, la bien-pensance faisant des ravages à toute époque, aujourd'hui c'est clair et net que le jeu n'aurait jamais été censuré et interdit de la vente certes c'est glauque, morbide, etc... mais pas de quoi vraiment choquer surtout qu'avec l'âge c'est comme si vous regardiez un film d'horeur des années 30, vous ne risquez pas d'en faire des cauchemars...

Pour la durée de vie comptez une dizaine d'heure, les chapitres sont courts et la difficulté n'est pas élevé.

Bon jeu à faire, je suis seulement déçu de m'être attendu à bien plus...

author: {'steamid': '76561197995821256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1444447927}
review:
I have a lot of feelings about this game. I played it many times growing up, and even as an adult Sanitarium continues to be one of my all time favorite games.

The game's levels are macabre and atmospheric, and are populated with memorable NPCs and challenging puzzles. The storyline seems disjointed at first, as the protagonist is teleported to wildly different locales, and even becomes a completely different character a number of times. However, it becomes clear soon enough that there's clues in each level, until the chilling truth emerges. 

Sanitarium is truly a great point and click adventure game. Even though it came out over a decade ago, it has aged very well. I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys games with horrific settings, a great story, and interacting with twisted NPCs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096141855', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1519510358}
review:
Впервые я познакомился с этим стареньким квестом в далеком 2003м году. Тогда его издавала в толстом джевеле компания  "Новый диск" в полной русской озвучке и с полным переводом. Времена были суровые и достать игру мог не каждый. Но поиграть в такой необычный проект хотели очень многие мои друзья. Потому, когда я взял ее у друга, время на прохождение было лимитировано довольно жестко. К сожалению, в деревне ацтеков я заплутал окончательно, а потом система слетела и сейвы спасти не удалось. Диск надо было отдавать и об игре я благополучно забыл на много лет. 

Когда dotEmu переиздала игру в Steam, я немедленно взялся за кошелек. Правда, по природной кривости своей, dotEmu не выпустили игру на всех платформах, она осталась эксклюзивом для Windows, что несколько странно. Но, довольно жаловаться.

В целом - это отличный квест, с шикарной, густой атмосферой, отличной отрисовкой и интересными диалогами. По умолчанию идет в английской озвучке, но я настоятельно советую скачать русскую озвучку и текст - игра переозвучена, на мой взгляд, уверенно лучше оригинала. Парадокс, трам-пам-пам. Кстати, скачанные файлы не удаляйте, англоязычную версию бекапните - иногда наложенный перевод глючит, приходится делать подмену туда-обратно.

По сюжету нам предстоит передвигаться по фантагосморическим мирам, созданным чьей-то (интрига сюжета) больной фантазией. Главный герой - поначалу вовсе не помнит, кто он и откуда. Постепенно, нам пояснят, откуда весь окружающий нас ужас взялся, что происходит и почему происходит именно так. Постановка сценок и роликов, конечно, не архифонтан, но имейте совесть - это квест, которому уже почти 20 лет. 

Управление немного кривоватое - для ходьбы используется не пойнтер, а кликер - давим на клавишу мыши в том направлении от игрока, куда нужно идти. При зажатии клавиша обращается в стрелочку, которая указывает направление,  в котором движется персонаж. Учитывая, что стрелочка не всегда точна, а в игре есть загадки движения "наощупь" - не всегда удобно играть с тачпадом ноута. Но мышку подключал, пожалуй, только в самой финальной локации.

В игре есть лекгие аркадные вставки (типа "боссы"), но труда они не составят. Загадки полной шизой не отдают, но point-n-click тут во все поля - порой нужно достать зажигалку со стола (это при такой то изометрии!!!) и она никак не блестит и не подсвечивается. Карты, кстати, тоже нет. Весь игровой процесс - исследование, разговоры и закликивание. Читать/слушать надо практически все - часто в диалогах есть ключевые подсказки к загадкам. Ну и сюжет так гораздо целостнее воспринимается. Собеседников немного, но диалоги пространны, пусть и очень интересны. За болтливость предусмотрена отдельная, имхо, самая сложная ачивка. 

В целом, игре ставлю твердую пятерку. Развлекла, переразгадывание загадок принесло удовольствие, да и молодость вспомнил.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328157955', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1514909543}
review:
[h1]Sanitarium gerçekten abartıldığı kadar güzel mi, yoksa bir balon mu?[h1]
1998 yılında çıkmış, çoğu oyuncunun 'En sevdiğim 5 oyun' listesinde bulunan bu oyunu bitirdim.  Oyun gerçekten güzel. Sürekleyici bir hikaye , üzerine düşünülmüş karakterler, güzel bulmacalara sahip. Ama bu oyunun kötü yaptığı şeyler yok mu ?
    Deneyimlediğim kadarıyla oyunun sinematikleri berbat. Aynı zamanlarda çıkmış mgs ve silent hill deki sinematiklerin yanından geçemiyor. Neyin ne olduğu belli olmuyor, bırakın bunu karakterlerin yüzleri bile seçilmiyor.
     Bazı kısımlar aşırı zorlayıcı olabiliyor. 20 sene önce internet kullanımı bu kadar yaygın değilken insanlar bu yerleri nasıl geçmiş kafam almıyor.
     Mekan tasarımı olarak bazı bölümlerden sanat fışkırırken bazı yerler çamur gibi.Sinematiklerde olduğu gibi neyin ne olduğu belli olmuyor. 
     Hikaye 2018 e göre klişeler barındıryor ama çıkış tarihinde klişe diye birşey yoktu.

Her ne olursa olsun birbirinin aynısı , bir gecede yazılmış hikaylerle dolu,kese doldurmak için yapılmış oyunları oynamaktan sıkıldıysanız bu oyun size ilaç gibi gelicek.

review: Sanitarium is a very well made point and click adventure game that is covered in deep plot subtext and symbolism. The graphics have also aged fairly well and the cutscenes look really good. If you like a game with a great story that can be challenging at times I recommend picking it up.

review: Абсолютно самобытный,уникальный и ни на что не похожий квест из уже далекого прошлого.Приготовьтесь отключить логическое мышление, оно вам тут не пригодится.В Шизариуме все не стандартно и это делает его единственным в своем роде.Так же, для тех,кого отпугивает отсутствие русской локализации, в обсуждениях указан довольно простой способ установки руссика без потери стимовских достижений.Игра обязательна к покупе всем олдфагам, да и просто любителям хороших квестов.Поверьте мне, Шизариум вас очень удивит и навсегда останется в памяти, как самый странный,но безумно увлекательный игровой опыт.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970619776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1421, 'last_played': 1512988706}
review:
Al tempo della sua uscita, dove aver giocato la demo, cercai questo gioco per i negozi di videogame (unica fonte di acquisto di un tempo) senza riuscire a trovarlo. Non ho perso quindi occasione di acquistarlo su Steam.

Allora... il gioco è curato nei minimi dettagli e incredibilmente la grafica riesce ancora a fare la sua figura ed a creare un'atmosfera notevole.  Il gioco è longevo, e gli enigmi ben fatti. A mio avviso, il gioco e la trama vengono un pò rovinati da alcune locazioni esotiche che rompono troppo  il ritmo sia in termini di trama che di atmosfera. Per esempio il livello "The Hive" l'ho trovato orribile, mentre  noiosissimo quello del villaggio.

Quasi capolavoro quindi : a mio avviso lo sarebbe stato se avesse continuato fino alla fine  sulle atmosfere dei primi tre capitoli.
Il gioco però è talmente ricco, che si fa perdonare momenti di calo. Stupenda l'idea dell'epilogo nella storia nella sigla....come pure la sigla. Un  gioco che ricorda tempi passati in cui gli sviluppatori inondavano di passione i loro progetti e che  in Sanitarium si vede tutta.
Avventura lunga, articolata e  impegnativa cmq.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129936651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 477, 'playtime_forever': 1801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1771, 'last_played': 1510707419}
review:
Sanitarium is a great old school Point & Click game. It’s got a good story, a good hero and a great villain, but let’s start with the story.

You play as Max, after a car accident knocks him unconscious, he awakes up in a part of a derelict sanitarium going up in flames. But even worse than that, Max does not know who he is, or how did he got into sanitarium, or why is his face all 
bandaged up. 

He is able to escape from the burning tower of the sanitarium, by way of a taking Statue and taking him to a creepy and weird little town just what is going on? That is what Max must find out.

Now what I liked about this game. I really liked the story; it had a good bit of twists and turns. Liked the mix of both horror and fantasy. 

Why’ll this game is not crap your pants scary, it well sometimes leave you with a feeling of being disturbed or creeped out. I liked the music. Liked the creepy atmosphere of the game. Liked levels going from derelict sanitarium to creepy little town to a demented circus surrounded by water.

But what I really loved was the villain, even those you can see he is bad guy right off the bat; he does have a good bit of Deep to him. Voice acting was okay for the game was okay too, but does show its age.

Now for the bad. There is really nothing bad about this game it just shows its age.

So with that said get this game if you want a creepy classic old school Point & Click game this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082273759', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1510573263}
review:
Отличный флешбэк. С удовольствием перепрошел игру, которая в свое время заставляла сломать голову(еще бы в 6 то классе). Сейчас стал уже понятен сюжет, а в то время игра представляла кучу несвязных историй. И на этот раз знания уже позволили пройти на языке оригинала. Рекомендую все олдфагам.
Кто-то может сказать что таких игр уже не делают и у игры нет аналогов - не правда. Присмотритесь  к игре The silent Age - достояный сюжет, похожий геймплей и потрясающая атмосфера.

review: Hakkında konuşacağım oyun;Sanitarium.Gerçekten harika bi' oyun neredeyse imkansız ve şimdilerde benzerine pek rastlanmayan bi' türden oyunu değerlendireceğimi bilmenizi isterim.Korku-gerilim ve point and click tarzlı bu oyunu oynaması gayet zevkli hikayesi açısından değerlendiricek olursak sonununa kadar merak unsurunu devam ettirmeyi iyi beceriyor.Kısacası eski (retro) oyunları seviyorsanız ve iyi bi' senaryoya tanıklık etmek istiyorsanız kesinlikle alın diyorum.''is still getting new content after all these years.''

author: {'steamid': '76561198077328736', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1501508892}
review:
Долго всё же не решался написать обзор на эту игру, но в один момент решил переслушать саундтрек, что меня сильно вдохновило. Я постараюсь снять очки ностальгии и оценить игру такой, какая она есть. 

Пожалуй, начну с минусов, так как многие решают их не затрагивать. 
Самый очевидный - игра, к сожалению, довольно сильно устарела. Нет, не в плане графики, я отнюдь не про это. Она устарела в плане геймплея. Сегодня игра кажется чересчур медленной, из-за отсуствия бега как такового. В игре довольно большие локации, по которым главный герой передвигается не очень-то быстро. Так еще и некоторые места приходится посещать не один раз. Поначалу не сильно обращаешь на это внимание, так как все твоё внимание сконцентрировано на интересных задниках, твои уши наслаждаются саундтреком. Однако при повторном прохождении становится уже тяжело смотреть на походку "в развалочку". 
Второй минус в принципе является не совсем объективным, скорее всего вы даже со мной не согласитесь.
Так вот, на мой взгляд, главы, в которых мы играем за других персонажей блекнут на фоне безумных приключений за забинтованного незнакомца, страдающего амнезией. Несомненно, они играют важную роль в сюжете, формально мы все ещё тот же самый персонаж, но черт возьми, как же я начинал скучать по старым-добрым уровням в санатории каждый раз, когда меня знакомили с новым героем. Город детей-уродов до сих пор у меня в сердце. Он был не только безумно атмосферным, пугающим, но и нагонял на вас некий саспенс, вам поскорее хотелось узнать, что происходит в этом странном месте. 
Однако, отдам должное создателям, они всё же попытались развлечь игрока, предоставив его вниманию разные миры, разных персонажей и совместив маленькие истории в одну. 

Вроде разобрались с тем, где Sanitarium "хромает", теперь я хотел бы затронуть положительные аспекты игры, благо есть, что разобрать. 
Итак, самая-пресамая важная сторона игры - это сюжет, дизайн и этот необыкновенный мир в целом. Очевидно, что разработчики вкладывали душу, придумывая образы героев, расписывая диалоги и своебобразный юмор. Всё это сочетание создает невероятные ощущения от каждой минуты, проведенной в "Шизариуме". Старания DreamForge Intertainment донесли до нас по-настоящему оригиальную, запоминающуюся игру. Как бы вы ни старались, вы никогда не найдете что-либо похожее на нее (серьезно, я пробовал). Что интересно, создатели могут идеально гармонировать между некой дурашливостью, несерьезностью и мрачностью. 
Конечно, этот сеттинг идеально дополняет по праву фантастическая музыка за авторством Джейми Мак-Менеми и Стивена Беннета. Есть в эмбиенте от этих двух композиторов что-то ужасно завораживающее, достаточно лишь послушать композицию под названием The Innocent Abandoned. 
Не могу также не упомянуть, что во всей игре нет ни одной бредовой головоломки, чем частенько страдают самые различные адвенчуры и квесты. Все загадки честные и интересные, а для их разгадки не обязательно иметь определнный склад ума. 
Ну и то, что меня удивило, так это наличие достижений. Правда, всегда рад получать всякие ачивки, да и не я один. Именно поэтому благодарствую за данный порт в Steam. Ведь это отличный повод купить игру и перепройти её, даже если вы её уже успели оценить в далёком прошлом. Надеюсь, всё больше старенькой годноты будет портировано таким образом.

Итак, что же можно сказать в итоге. Sanitarium - это, как мне кажется, самый недооцененный квест. Понятия не имею, почему многие обходят его стороной, но лично я получил от него исключительно положительные эмоции, да и с радостью приравнял бы его к той самой классике, которую должен оценить каждый. 
Однозначно рекомендую вам хотя бы попробовать это творение, вполне возможно, что оно вас сильно зацепит, собственно, как и меня. Сегодня аналогов данной игры просто-напросто не существует.

Youth Hides the Key to Salvation

TLDR: The engine played beautifully out of the box on Win1064bit+Ryzen+Polaris. This game is very memorable and easily comes recommended.

Sanitarium is divided is multiple very varied chapters and it takes the fullness of those chapters to unfold to really get all the juice out of the story which is nice. The game uses its own custom control scheme and UI but the adjustments are quickly made, learning curve is still low. Some puzzles are cryptic and a walkthrough can be recommended at times however for the most part the game does not overload you with items and interactable hotspots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007747398', 'num_games_owned': 937, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1502856996}
review:
Despite that it was released in 1998, Sanitarium has aged well. I find this game fascinating. It's got all kinds of elements : [spoiler] Weird mutant kids, alien plants, worms and insectoids, centaurs, ghosts, morgues, ancient evil Aztec god, crazy grusome experiment, asylums,mazes.... [/spoiler] nearly everything you can think of - it's there. I mean , take the chapter of [spoiler]insectoid war [/spoiler] for example, it can easily be extended to a whole game ! The atmosphere is great and the story line is still intriguing.  But the control seems a little clumsy and the voice acting sometimes are silly. xD Nonetheless, it is absolutely a gem among a whole bunch of point&click psychological horror game. 

When i was a kid I was too chickensh*t to play Sanitarium, now in my late 20s this game still gives me the chills. 

If I ever have kids, 10/10 will make Sanitarium their bedtime stories

review:
Kaç yıl önceydi hatırlamıyorum, 2000'lerin başıydı muhtemelen Sanitarium ile tanışmam. Küçüktüm, bir elimde sözlük oyunu anlamadığım halde beni kendi atmosferinin içine çekmeyi başarmıştı bu oyun. O zamanlar oyunu bitiremediğimden sonunu hiç öğrenememiştim. Hem hikayeyi anlayarak bitirmek hem de böyle bir efsanenin sonunu görmek bugüne kısmetmiş.

İtiraf ediyorum günümüz oyunlarının hiçbirinden bu oyunun yarısı kadar keyif almadım. Neden? Bana göre nedeni günümüz oyun yapımcılarının artık oyunları tutku için değil de maddiyata yönelik yapmalarından. Tamam eski oyunlarda grafik yoktu, oynanabilirlik tekdüzeydi ama hikaye yönünden zengindi, oynarken seni kendi dünyasının içine çekiyordu. Şimdi bas grafiği, doldur ara sahnelere sinematiği, yüzeysel karakterler ile klişe senaryoyu da dayat, yetmezmiş gibi üstüne fahiş fiyatı da ekle oyuncuların önüne sun. BAK YİNE SİNİRLENDİM

Neyse oyuna geri dönecek olursak bu oyun beni nadir duygulandıran sayılı oyunlardan biri oldu. Kız kardeşimizle olan sahneler, oyuncağı arayışımız bulamayışımız (KAÇ PARA ULAN Bİ OYUNCAK ;_;) garibim Max'in "i can't find it sarah, i can't find it" diye kahroluşu, ha bu arada Sarah ile evi dolaştığımız sahne de oyunun en vurucu sahnelerinden biri bana göre. Çok yazıp Spoiler vermek de istemiyorum, herkes oynasın, kimse bu güzellikten mahrum kalmasın bence

10/9 hmm vodka!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119319611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1499625049}
review: I have never played this game before, so buying it was not simply nostalgia for me. The plot was pretty good, not a usual one. Until the end I was never really sure, if the main character was crazy or not, so I think it was done well. The graphics are still fine, given that it's an old game. The world had an interesting atmosphere, but I found it more disturbing than scary. I only had two problems. One, the character moved so slowly, two, I felt like two chapters were a bit unnecessary, and that was tiring. However, the chapters are not so long, since I could finish the whole game in 8 hours, so it was not a big problem. The game never crashed and I didn't have a problem with saving, either. All in all I think it is worth to give it a try if you like psychological horror.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220039531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1498609420}
review:
已经是很优秀的作品了，故事线很丰满，再编个故事硬往里塞就会感觉很多余，所以写些干货。

全文链接：
[url=http://play.163.com/17/0731/15/CQMBH07600318QDE.html]与《疯人院》里的病友们探讨下病情[/url]

[h1] 引言	[/h1]

      人之本性就注定我们会被那些神秘的、宗教的、超自然的未知事物所吸引，就像《沉默羔羊》里霍普金斯饰演的汉尼拔，他的优雅魅力就算时隔多年仍然激起着观影者们的好奇欲，这是七百万年来人类发展至今的必然，想想古老的欧洲医者们聚集在一个环形的剧场似的大厅里，围绕着一个精神病人开颅时，没人能界定出这是魔鬼还是天使，就像达尔文的进化论，要想成为更好的我们，除了循序渐进的渐悟外，也有基因突变的顿悟，而解谜就是人类发展岔路口上的“捷径”。

      谜语与密码，符号与预言，古埃及的金字塔误差为何这样小？玛雅的历法为何这样精准？为什么几大文明语系的母亲都叫“mama”？这种古老的游戏从山顶洞的壁画时期起就刻印在了人类潜意识的每一个毛孔里，比如你天生为何怕蛇和昆虫，为何恐高？这一切谜题都是古人穿越了时空与我们做的一场游戏。

      从向外的维度上讲，现代物理学让我们发现引力波，而相反的方向，从人的大脑构造出发，我们也在不断探究人的意识与无意识，比如“福尔摩斯演绎法”与“微表情”之类就是无意识的外在表现，因为我们常说“要想遇见对的人，首先要从遇见自己开始”。

[h1] 分析	[/h1]	

     《疯人院》Sanitarium这部经典大作讲述的就是从意识的最深处，一点一点认知自我并且巡回的故事。谜题很精致，推理的过程很有趣，机关设计的也很精巧，比如那个“韦天克”的机器，完全可以满足解谜爱好者的求知欲。无奈我的猜谜天赋初始值不太高，尤其烦到处找零件的过程，所以想从另一个角度谈一谈。

      游戏通篇让我想到的是荣格的“集体潜意识”，二分心智里的那个“神格”，不受控的思维具象化，塔内的自己、独眼英雄、妹妹、石像人。有点像宗教里信奉的“渡人”，打败了大魔王，被你救了的人最后都将变成你的力量，存活于你的生命。不过荣格的解释是“自我”和“自己”的关系，说的形象点，就是你的大脑被打碎，然后重新的将它们一个个的组装回来，比如游戏里的那个天使雕像，每个故事线存有一块，最后拼贴起来麦克斯就醒了。所以就有了那句“人终其一生，不过是在完善不健全的“自我”，而所谓的修行，也不过是不断的修复和行走，最后进化成为更好的“自己”。

      一篇关于这游戏不错的文章[url=http://www.g-cores.com/articles/24755@]《疯人院》：旧时代的心理恐怖[/url],里面说不知道南瓜园，石像鬼，停尸房，墓地和天使代表的含义。记得妹妹那章的动画里，他的爸爸叫妹妹“小南瓜”，所以很可能在麦克斯眼里南瓜园并不是完全的纯净之地。停尸房和墓地暗示着摩尔就是害他的大魔王，之后用从小信仰的英雄投影“独眼巨人”打败了他，在潜意识中这种力量越是神秘越是强大。石像鬼在西方宗教里是守护者，羽蛇神是阿兹台克的善神，所以寻访其他神邸吸收神力最终打败了大邪神。而天使那是他脑内的“神格”，基督教里天使的寓意就是“救赎”不是么？（我个人认为很可能宗教就是集体互通的无意识）同样荣格也有个长者型人格。

      不管怎样，贯彻自己良知与拿活体做实验唯利是图的摩尔作斗争的麦克斯，是值得赞颂的，他的妹妹一定在守护着他。（从这点上讲，如果把妹妹的戏份提高到帮助他打败大魔王就更耐人寻味了）

[h1] 感知	[/h1]	

      最让我感动的是“解开心结”的那章，妹妹为了不让哥哥更悲伤，在生命即将结束的那刻，与哥哥签订了最后一条羁绊——让小丑娃娃陪他捉迷藏，代替她永远的陪伴着哥哥。而麦克斯也是个善良的孩子，他不饶恕自己的无能，并让妹妹永远的停驻在了自己的精神世界里。

      有位居士她姓尹，是我见过的最好的心理医生，曾对我说，“你要看透那些对你恶语相向背后蕴含的意义”，我想应该就像如何看破这个游戏里的妹妹那样吧，我们可以说妹妹的用意是有私心和恶毒的，但是藏在这种私心的背后却是对哥哥无法割舍的依恋啊，而后你会惊然醒悟，那些小小的恶作剧不过似乎像是恶魔的小可爱而已。蔡康永说“美丽善良的人都是沾染了因果，有佛心的人”。

[h1] 结语	[/h1]	

      不断的克服自己内心的恐惧和纠葛，直面与拆解，直到谜底揭开，从而达到一个更完美的“我”，让自己的意识归于和谐与平静，我想这就是人类的“终级解谜游戏”吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198014622873', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1498667126}
review: Quel curieux objet que ce Sanitarium ! Je viens de le finir là et il faut avouer que ce point'n'click est une oeuvre vraiment originale ! Il ne fait pas que traiter le thème de la folie : la construction du jeu et les différentes parties paraissent complètement aléatoires et folles également ! Cela dit, le jeu est de qualité et rien n'y est réellement gratuit : la cohésion de l'ensemble est assez surprenante. Certains passages sont vraiment inoubliables, notamment le premier monde visité, qui m'a fait penser à une excellente nouvelle de Stephen King. L'ensemble est de très bon niveau, avec un niveau de difficulté relevé. Dommage que le système permettant de déplacer notre protagoniste soit si peu pratique : cela gâche certains passages demandant de l'adresse et de la rapidité. Autrement, le voyage en vaut la chandelle : Sanitarium vaut le détour pour tous les amateurs d'univers fantastiques, d'histoires dérangeantes et de retrogaming bien sûr !

author: {'steamid': '76561198078415617', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1480232045}
review:
[i]«После диалога с пациентом психбольницы, я начала сомневаться кто из нас понимает все, а кто наивный дурачок.»[/i] 

Безумие и психические заболевания всегда привлекали заскучавшего зрителя или игрока. Ведь что может быть лучше смеси страхов, неожиданных поворотов и интересной, хоть и болезненной, истории о хитросплетениях в сознании нездорового персонажа? Сегодня все игроки знакомы с Ваасом из Far Cry 3 и Джокером из Batman: Arkham Asylum, но мало кто из них знаком с Максом Лаутоном из 18тилетнего квеста Sanitarium(Шизариум). Что, на мой взгляд - вопиющее недоразумение.

На атмосферу и дизайн игры, по заявлению от создателей, повлияли такие фильмы как «Город потерянных детей», «Лестница Иакова», «Полёт над гнездом кукушки», и «Именно так зло и происходит» (по роману Рэя Брэдбери «И духов зла явилась рать»). Помимо этого, пытливый взгляд сможет подметить очевидные отсылки к Стивену Кингу и его клоуну Пеннивайзу из романа «Оно», а также можно проследить дух отца Ктулху - Говарда Лавкрафта.

После запуска игры и заставочных роликов вас встретит нагнетающая жути музыка, болезненные глаза, не выпускающие из вида ваших движений курсором, а также пункты меню, которые озвучиваются апатичным и потусторонним женским голосом. Само меню навевает нечто подавляющее и ужасающее, но мы не робкого десятка, начинаем новую игру. Завязка игры проста до абсурда – ночь, дорога, дождь, автомобиль, нервничающий герой, действия которого приводят к автомобильной аварии. На этом скучная часть игры заканчивается. С этого момента мы находимся в очень странной психиатрической лечебнице, больше напоминающей старой поместье или даже замок. Наша голова опутана, словно паутиной, бинтами, вокруг творится невесть что, само окружение и атмосфера изначально рисует нам картинку чего-то мерзкого, сырого, затхлого и склизкого. У нас, как и у нашего главного героя появляются резонные вопросы - Где я? Кто я? И что вообще, черт побери, происходит вокруг? 

Здесь можно немного упомянуть о названии игры - Sanitarium, или, по версии русских локализаторов, Шизариум (слово «sanitarium» это американская форма английского слова «sanatorium», которое в переводе на русский означает «санаторий». Вероятно, в данном случае имеется в виду психиатрический санаторий. Русская же версия звучит, на мой взгляд, более интересно и играючи). 

Чтобы пройти игру, нужно пройти символичное количество глав, а именно 13. По мере прохождения, мы будем все больше и больше убеждаться в том, что психика главного героя действительно пострадала. К примеру, один из уровней - это городок, населенный исключительной детьми, у каждого из которых имеется собственная мутация или уродство. Или же представьте себе остров с труппой клоунов и циркачей, которые не могут покинуть свою обитель(остров), а как вам побывать в роли ацтека или супергероя из комиксов - всё это вы найдете в игре.

Игра пестрит различными загадками, головоломками, обильным количеством флешбэков, трагичных воспоминаний, отсылок и специфичным юмором. Также есть неочевидное ломание четвертой стены. (Если повторно попросить гадалку с острова циркачей предсказать судьбу, игрок может услышать отсылку к своему будущему: "У тебя есть мощная машина, на которой ты играешь в игру "Шизариум".) Игроку некогда скучать, он постоянно находится в водовороте событий или же ломает голову над очередной шарадой. Нельзя не отметить атмосферу этой игры, мрачность мелодий, голоса, звуки, игра красок, да-да, насколько бы мрачной не была эта история - здесь есть места, где краски взрывают ваше сознание. По погружения в подсознание Макса, мозаика прошлого складываются в целостную картину, и мы вместе с ошеломленным героем узнаем ответы на все тревожащие нас и его вопросы.

Сделать мир более живым и пространственным позволил 2.5D движок, также его называют изометрической перспективой. Управление в игре интуитивно-понятное - осваивается на раз-два. Все загадки решаемы, не будет такого, что вам придется шерстить интернет в поисках ответа - все можно решить своими силами. Многие игроки даже сетовали на то, что загадки в игре слишком просты, что делает прохождение игры более быстрым, чем им хотелось бы.

Завершая свой обзор, хочу сказать, если в свое время по неведомым мне и вам причинам, вы пропустили эту игру, то настоятельно рекомендую вам исправить это обидное недоразумение. Хотя жанр квестов в наши дни можно назвать ушедшим в прошлое - с большой уверенностью могу заверить вас, что иногда, покопавшись в горе старых и забытых вещей, можно найти нечто неожиданное и интересное.

review:
One of THE best designed games of all time. Not just "the early times", I mean ever.
The settings, the voice acting, the puzzles...all top rate. 
It's got humor and a creepy atmosphere. I loved how the protagonist reacted with everyone. The plot is the best i've seen in a long time. The game never crashed once, and the saves were available. The dialog was enjoyable, but could be skipped if you wanted to.
It will go down as one of the true classics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019031970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1494514534}
review:
I've been a fan of this game for a long time but I'm going to try to give it a fair and thorough review. (Content warnings at the end). Despite its lack of story choices, single ending, and short play time (11 hours) I feel Sanitarium has a lot of replay value because the story is compelling, well written, and fun to come back to.

Even after all these years I think the story still stands out from other horror games. It starts out in a bizarre asylum that looks more like a castle than a mental hospital. The player character has no memory of anything before this point but seems to be a patient in the asylum. As you progress through the game things continue to get stranger and reality quickly becomes uncertain.

Amnesia is a common trope in horror and I've seen it used artlessly many times. The writers us it well here and don't expect it to do the work for them. While the main character recovering his identity is part of the story there is much more going on and far higher stakes than just his own well being. 

The game has a creepy and sometimes ominous atmosphere. There are a lot of disturbing concepts and scenes in the game and much of the time what is real isn't certain. Reality seems to lie in one direction, and then another, and another as you make your way through nightmarish places all marked by imminent yet unseen threats, insanity, and disease. Over the chapters the truth is slowly revealed and it's notably different from what I find in most horror games.

On the technical side of things: the controls are clunky and sometimes irritating. I don't like holding down the right mouse button to move my character and I wish the walking speed was faster. I had some problems activating staircases by accident. There were a few times when I ended up walking up and down the stairs several times before I could escape. I found I couldn't activate objects when my character was standing behind them. The game thought I was clicking on my character and brought up the inventory instead. Cinematics are also very easy to skip by accident. Other than that the game seems to have no problems.

The game has a very basic combat system which is used infrequently. The player is temporarily given an improvised weapon and must click accurately on enemies to kill them. The combat controls are clunky but combat isn't too difficult once you figure out the trick to it.

The puzzles in the game are fairly simple; especially in early levels. In the last few levels the difficulty goes up noticeably. The types of puzzles vary a lot but are fairly standard: numerical codes, item hunts, mechanical puzzles, social puzzles, simple codes, riddles, and mazes. These puzzles are based on knowledge provided to the player in game and here are usually plenty of clues for major puzzles.

In terms of graphics and sound the game has not aged well. The graphics are pixelated and fuzzy. The cinematics actually hold up pretty well but have black lines that are distracting on newer monitors. The animations for 3D models seem good. The game's sound is tinny all round. That said, the voice acting is decent. Its seems like the actors really gave it their all and had fun doing it. The music is atmospheric and variously maddening, creepy, beautiful, and haunting.

Content Warnings and Spoilers.
There are gory scenes usually of dead bodies, medical horror, mentions of suicide, depictions of “circus freaks” and deformed people as monsters, child abuse, child death, mentions of domestic violence, cruelty to animals, and inexpert depictions of mental illness for both horror and humor.
