author: {'steamid': '76561198112866114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 1698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1505389190}
review:
A 1998 point and click adventure originally created by an American company known as DreamForge Intertainment which unfortunately no longer exists and later thanks to a French company known as Dot Emu ( http://www.dotemu.com/ ) was ported to Steam and other mediums with achievements added.

While the game is no doubt dated graphically, the game has stood the test of time thanks to its superlative and artistic use of storytelling. Unlike cheap jump scares used in many stories today, the main story here and many of its sub plots concentrate on having the gamer enthralled with concepts teetering in the morbid and with adult themes that constantly confounds you with the creepy and bizarre mysteries that make you want to push forward and learn more. 

The Main story follows a man that has stolen a male nurse’s car from an Asylum accidentally plummeting it off a cliff while he drove down a mountainous and dangerous road. Next thing you know, is that you’re simply back in the Asylum from which you were fleeing, this time in one of its Gothic towers surrounded by patients that seem to be on the loose and guards that are nowhere to be found. To add to the mystery you have no recollection exactly who you are and your face is completely rolled up in bandages. As you begin to chat with the various patients each telling you their bizarre encounter stories and delusions, you eventually find yourself experiencing those same dreams and stories first hand, even changing characters as you do so. How is this possible? Why do you have a connection with each patient in that tower?

Each sub plot will take you to a quirky landscape, filled with its own dark stories and secrets. For instance a village filled with deformed children, a preacher with a following of wooden mannequins, a circus being terrified of the sea and a god whose people no longer give obeisance too. As you gradually push forward through each, you will be rewarded with flashbacks and the eventual fill in the blank sections of memory loss. While many Hollywood such stories usually end with a cheap supernatural idea that you’re simply dead and experiencing some sort of afterlife, instead this story rewards you by exposing how the various idiosyncratic common threads of each sub plot connects to your main characters real life.

The puzzles, the randomness, the character development is so perfectly balanced that you will probably even forget your playing a point and click adventure. In short if you’re a little crazy and you like the creepy, this is a nuthouse you should enjoy. I know I did because I finally found people crazier than I. 

On a side note: If you enjoy this game you should enjoy 'Stasis' it’s considered to be Sanitarium's spiritual successor. Though I must admit I have not played it myself yet. Below is the first chapter to see if this point and click horror game has a story which you might enjoy.

https://youtu.be/YlTq7zmGEzA

author: {'steamid': '76561197994133292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1484360981}
review:
Oto jedna z tych gier, o których kilkanaście lat temu słyszeliśmy od znajomych, ale niekoniecznie mieliśmy jak ją samemu sprawdzić. Niektórzy w jakiś sposób zdobyli tę grę, ale szybko rezygnowali z powodu groteskowej i przerażającej atmosfery jaka w niej panowała. Możliwe, że znasz osobę, której nawet udało się ukończyć "Sanitarium", choć wątpię w to... Dziś ta gra, w swej niezmienionej "prehistorycznej" postaci jest dostępna na Steam, choć mało kto tak naprawdę pamięta, że takie coś w ogóle istniało... Właśnie zdobyłem wszystkie osiągnięcia - po jedenastu godzinach gry. W końcu zrozumiałem fabułę - po kilkunastu latach...

Gra nie zachwyca graficznie, fabuła jest pokręcona, ale na końcu składa się w solidną całość (choć nie do końca, ale nie czepiajmy się wybujałej wyobraźni twórców). To co tak naprawdę mnie ruszyło, to POZIOM TRUDNOŚCI. Choć brak tu jako-takiego systemu walki (poważnie - nie stworzono tej gry do testowania zręczności i refleksu) to zabójczy jest poziom zagadek! Jeśli nie zraża cię ta "prehistoryczna" grafika i lubisz wyzwania, to polecam spróbować "Sanitarium". Oczywiście znajdziesz sporo poradników w internecie, ale ja uważam, że żeby zrozumieć, że deweloperzy w tamtych czasach nie pier*****i się z graczami i lubili stawiać im wyzwania, trzeba spróbować TEJ GRY na własnej skórze.

Polecam na 100%, sam kupiłem i przeszedłem tylko z sentymentu, pewnie więcej już tej gry nie uruchomię, ale nie żałuję ani minuty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005309828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1484801132}
review:
Aucun problème pour le lancer et y jouer sous XP. Ca pique un peu les yeux, surtout lors des cinématiques, mais Sanitarium reste le must des jeux "point & click aventure / horreur". Sorti en 1998, aucun autre jeu n'est parvenu depuis à combiner aussi bien le glauque et le poétique. Des passages sont franchement émouvants et d'autres limite trash. 
Bref, une expérience inoubliable que je conseille vivement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014589969', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1480183343}
review:
Отличный квест, который просто наполнен символизмом и сюром! И т.к. на первый вгляд между уровнями мало взаимосвязей - тем интереснее находить скрытые детали, связывающие каждый элемент игры воедино.
Да, этому квесту скоро 20 лет, но играть в него до сих пор интересно: головоломки логичные, персонажи проработанные, озвучка и музыка превосходные, каждый уровень уникален и со своей историей, а между строк прослеживается одна сильная драма.
Все, кто любит пойнт-н-клик квесты или игры с глубоким сюжетом - однозначно берите.
10\10
P.S. почему-то в метках к игре стоит "хоррор" - его здесь нет. Это, скорее, психологический триллер.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993061750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1483233835}
review:
Game is old and ugly, character movement is slow and janky, and the voice acting veers into absurdity as often as possible. 

Still love it. Part of it is nostalgia, certainly, but the atmosphere is legitimately creepy, and the story itself holds up pretty well. The Aztec stuff is sort of cheap and is easily the least entertaining part of the game, but aside from that, there's little to complain about in terms of level design choice. You won't have a hard time with much in the way of puzzles; it's definitely not a Mensa test. 

You can breeze through this story in less than 10 hours, easily, and will enjoy it the whole time. Especially if you're a fan of point-and-clicks.

review: К своему стыду, я поиграл в Шизариум только в 2016-м. Я помню, что в свое время меня отпугнуло от покупки Jewel CD с игрой в магазине именно название и "упоротость" обложки )) Но теперь я воздаю должное! Игра оставила очень сильное впечатление. Без сомнения займет место в пантеоне любимых адвенчур. Отзыв оставил на эмоциях после прохождения, возможно, дополню его позже. Если ты ценишь этот жанр и еще не играл в Шизариум, однозначно рекомедую. Кстати, играл с русской озвучкой, локализация от Логруса очень понравилась. Претензий по озвучке нет, атмосфера выдержана на 100%.

review:
A nice and interesting old graphic adventure (1998) that will entertain and even gift you some feelings and emotions.....
Overall my judgement is quite positive altough some flaws are present in the game---
Main issue that made me lower a lot the final score is the presence of a good number of annoying puzzles, not impossible ones but very annoying ones, i really hate musical puzzles....
Overall i must say that most of the puzzles were of a good logic, so nothing was impossible.
Another relative flaw was the movements of the main character who was moving really too slow and there was no way to move from one room to another in one click, also, sometime, going up or down of a ladder and moving trough different layers of the screen was a bit of a pain, but nothing that can not be forgiven.

My Final Score is

[h1] [b]84[/b] /100 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197965202782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1479960852}
review:
Nostalgia glasses rating 9/10
Reality 3/10

This game has not aged well at all. If you played it as a kid, be happy with the memories and don't ruin them with a replay.

I played about 2/3 through this game when I was a kid and loved it. Apparently I stopped playing at the correct point. Initially, the puzzles are well thought out and the story very intriguing. This changes by the half-way point, and the game completely falls apart in the last act; walking a fine line between absolute tedium and the worst kinds of point-click puzzles. No more physical puzzles, simply long conversation trees that MUST be completed in order to proceed. The final part of the game makes use of a specific character who walks slower than cold molasses. I'm surprised I still have any hair on my head, it is absolutely infuriating!

And don't forget the maze, everyone loves those! 

Very little puzzling takes place after the initial chapters, it simply becomes an exercise in patience. Every now and then they'll throw you a puzzle bone and you think it is turning around....but don't be fooled.

I recommend reading the development diary for this game, it not only explains the huge deficits of the game, but it has a far more compelling story.  Out of 13 chapters, 6 are worth the time, the rest are simply terrible.

*Spoiler*
[spoiler]If you do manage to make it to the end of the game, enjoy the after thought of an ending. It could only be worse if I they actually stuck a thumb-tack in my LCD monitor where they attached it to the "story". [/spoiler]

I am a huge point-click fan, but this game is a perfect example of why the genre fell off the face of the earth for a decade. Movement is painful, as well as inventory management. Add that to the fact that all logical puzzles have disappeared by the half-way point in the game, and you'll understand why after an unsaved game crash very near the end I opted to watch the ending on YouTube instead of enduring the suffering any longer.

There are far better representatives of the point-click genre than this forgettable relic. Take your money and brain power elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094494117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1479837172}
review:
Hikaye, karakterimizin o gün keşfettiği bir şeyi eşine anlatmak için eve giderken araba kazası geçirmesiyle başlıyor. Gözümüzü açtığımızda ise bir akıl hastanesindeyiz ve kim olduğumuzu bilmiyoruz. Oyun boyunca da kim olduğumuzu, ne yaptığımızı ne yaşadığımızı arıyoruz.

İlk bir kaç saat gerçekten ürkütücü ve dolu bir atmosferde geçerken hikaye yavaş yavaş açığa çıkmaya başlıyor. Ortaya çıkan potansiyel ve neyin gerçek neyin hayal olduğunu bilemememizden kaynaklanan sır bizi oyuna daha çok bağlıyor. Ama ne zamanki biz bu ayrımları yapabilir hale geliyoruz işte o zaman işin büyüsü kaçıyor.

Bulmaca kısmına gelirsek 2000 öncesi oyunların nasıl zor olduğunu biliyoruz, bu oyun ise 1998'de çıkmasına rağmen son derece dengeli hatta zaman zaman da kolay bulmacalar ile süslenmiş.

Herşey bittiğinde diyorum ki keşke o potansiyel bütünüyle çıkmış olsaydı hikaye adına ama ne yazık ki sonuç beklendiği gibi karmaşık değil son derece basit bir şekilde noktalanıyor.

Bir eksiyi de oyunun gereksiz uzun tutulmasından keseceğim, özellikle bir kaç bölüm var ki hikayeye de pek bir şey katmadıkları için keşke olmasaydı dedirtti.

Oyunun ilk 1 saatinden aldığım tat ile son 1 saatinden aldığım tat keşke uyuşsaydı diyorum ama bu atmosfer, gizemli hikaye, bulmacalar ve seslendirme ile sizi esir alıp, aldığı tüm övgüleri hakettiğini görüyorsunuz.

Notum: 8/10

Edit: Hikayenin bağlanışıyla ilgili hayal kırıklığım yazıya fazla yansımış ama aradan zaman geçip bakınca diyorum ki olağanüstü bir oyun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972311844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1478775591}
review:
1998 dieses Spiel zum ersten Mal angespielt. Tatsächlich bin ich früher nie über die ersten Kapitel hinaus gekommen.
Als ich dieses Spiel im Halloween-Sale sah, musste ich zuschlagen.
Sofort kamen die Erinnerungen von damals wieder auf.
Aber genug von damals. Wie sieht es heute aus? Kann man es heute noch spielen? 

Wer Adventure-Spiele und einen leichten hauch von Horror / Psycho mag, sollte definitiv zugreifen!
Eines sollte unbedingt gesagt werden. Dieses Spiel ist langsam, sehr sehr langsam! Das laufen wird NICHT mittels Point&Click bewerkstelligt. Vielmehr zeigt man mit der Maus in die gewünschte Richtung und lässt den Finger brav auf der Taste. 
Diese Zeit kann natürlich wunderbar zum Denken anregen. Die Rätsel sind nämlich stellenweise sehr knackig.

Die Synchro?! Naja...in den 90er und pre-2000er hat man da nicht das große Budget für verbrannt. Bekannte Sprecher sind zwar vorhanden aber die Dialoge und Emotionen in diesen sind wirklich schlimm. 
ABER: So war es damals und irgendwie ist es auch sehr amüsant!

Ich gebe 9/10 Punkte. Für ´nen 10er gute 1€ pro Stunde. (Abhängig von Rätselskills)

review:
Muy recomendado y mas al precio que esta que es de chiste, una joyita antigua, si te gustan las aventuras graficas los points and click este juego le tienes que probar.

recordaba buenos momentos de peque jugando a este juego pero ahora que lo rejugue me sorprendio bastante de momento es un juego que el titulo es engañoso te puedes llegar a pensar de que todo transcurre en un manicomio o similar pero nada que ver con eso la historia es increible y te llevara a multitud de sitios muy muy extrambolicos y abstractos jajaja te pegas todo el juego sin saber muy bien de que va la historia sorprendiendote por cada nuevo capitulo y los lugares donde vas apareciendo, mi preferido y mas loco (La Colmena) veras que es todo muy loco pero vamos al final todo cobra sentido como siempre, o no. :P

me encanto volver a jugarlo pero eso si los controles son horribles siendo un juego en el que te tienes que menear bastante por los escenarios es una putada que sea todo tan tosco, me he llegado a pegar en las mismas escaleras subiendolas  y bajandolas 2 o 3 minutos facil, no se como explicarlo supongo que cuando lo pruebes te daras cuenta a lo que me refiero jajaja y teniendo en cuenta que algunos puzzles requieren precision en el movimiento puede llegar a ser una tortura, pero te acabas acostumbrando, un Remastered de este juego a lo Day of the tentacle no estaria nada mal ;)

los puzzles todos tienen logica dentro del juego sin necesidad de desesperarte y acabar tirando de guias, algunos son dificiles aunque no mucho y los vas haciendo casi del tiron sin querer con pura logica a base de lo que vas conversando con los extrafalarios personajes, asi que te pondras a jugar y del tiron siguiendo la historia te lo pasaras sin dificultad.

Suerte y a disfrutarlo juegazo ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198023013735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1475866506}
review:
[h1]Неизгладимый след в памяти оставляющий квест о скитаниях в самых темных глубинах воспаленного сознания.[/h1]

Игра, создающая ложное впечатление произведения в жанре мистики и ужасов, на самом деле, несмотря на полное отсутствие чего бы то ни было тут ирреального, а, в некоторой степени, с сюжетом даже основывающимся на вполне правдоподобных вещах, наполнена в сравнении с вышеупомянутыми направлениями даже большим количеством фантасмагорических и сюрреалистических, но главное небеспочвенно возникших образов. Ибо преподносит все происходящее, делая весьма неуклюжие попытки придания всему этому неочевидности, в форме разыгравшегося воображения главного героя.

Невзирая же на отмеченную «неуклюжесть» подачи творящегося в «[b]Шизариуме[/b]» сумбура, как чего-то таинственного и будто неизвестно из чего проистекающего, на более поздних стадиях игры такая манера повествования сказывается весьма положительно на погружении. Подобно страдающему явными галлюцинациями главному герою, игрока, столкнувшегося с переплетением местного реального мира с воссозданным в мозгу протагониста, так же, как и последнего, окутывают различнейшие сомнения, касающиеся того, где простирается эта незримая, отделяющая настоящий мир от иллюзорного черта, и сколь многослойна страна больных грез.

Заостряя внимание на жанровой принадлежности, проявляющейся помимо акцента на сюжете еще и в повсеместных загадках, балансирующих на грани логики и отсутствия какого бы то ни было здравомыслия в принципе, кощунственно будет не упомянуть обрамляющий каждую имеющуюся в игре головоломку, даже прозаичнейшую, мотив и антураж проходимого этапа. Благодаря этому чувства отрыва от основного повествования из-за повсеместных мини-игр не создается, и они хорошо вписываются в сам мир.

Сложность же определяется желанием и готовностью самого игрока решать задачи, подавляющая часть которых задействует исключительно логическое мышление, однако особой легкостью при этом не отличается, никоим образом тщетные попытки слепой интеракции со всем имеющимся на экране не вознаграждая. Толику негатива привносят нечастые и по своему объему небольшие, но отнюдь не за превосходное исполнение запоминающиеся «экшн-эпизоды», требующие уже скорости реакции. Портят впечатление они не столько изначально заложенной в них, на самом деле, нехитрой механикой, сколько ее техническим исполнением, делая врагом геймера уже не виртуальных оппонентов, а само код игры, рассеивая столь кропотливо и неспешно нагнанную на проходящего атмосферу.

Неоднозначный оттенок всему происходящему придает и русская озвучка, неизвестно, намеренно ли или нет преисполненная отсутствующими в оригинале переигрываниями и патетикой, моментами лишая происходящие события присутствующей в англоязычной версии серьезности. Пускай вкупе с сюрреалистичным окружением критичным этот фактор не яваляется, но неизбежно вредит авторской задумке.

Испортить общую картину может и упущение сценаристов в виде доходчивого объяснения посредством монологов большинства аллегорий и метафор, воссозданных в воображении протагониста, при вдумчивом прохождении без того очевидных.

Желающим прикоснуться к явлению в своей необыкновенности и психоделичности весьма логичному и символичному ознакомиться с творением студии [b]DreamForge[/b] я рекомендую, предостерегая, однако, что в своей сюжетной и идейной законченности игра практически не дает пищи для размышления, но все же оставляя сильный эмоциональный отпечаток после прохождения.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249237304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1473931700}
review:
Originally released in 1998, Sanitarium is a PC adventure game created by Dreamforge and more recently re-released and made playable on modern machines. Despite receiving a mixed reaction from adventure outlets back in the day, it is still often cited by fans of the genre as a classic for its twisted and unsettling atmosphere. 

[h1] The premise [/h1]
The premise of the game is pretty simple: you're an amnesiac waking up in an asylum, swathed in bandages and completely sane. Over the course of nine chapters, you need to discover what happened to you.

Unfortunately, you discover what happened to you in the opening cinematic. So the actual premise is kind of different: reveal the Bad Guy's evil plan and stop him. How do you do that? By wandering through your own twisted psyche while escaping from the asylum.

An hour into the game, you'll unravel the real actual premise: wade through a handful of disjointed puzzles to win the next cinematic sequence that reveals the Bad Guy's evil plan.

Confused yet?

[h1] Misleading advertisement? [/h1]
The game advertises as a dark, disturbing exploration of an insane mind. This, of course, is not true in a number of ways. First, the game is rated T (ages 13+). How dark and disturbing could it be? As it turns out, not very. Second, the exploration is of the different worlds, not the insane mind, and anything you discover during gameplay has little to no relevance to the plot. It's really a game and a movie in one, but in a bad way. "Solve these puzzles. Watch that movie." Finally, you're not exploring an insane mind at all. You're exploring the imaginations of a perfectly sane mind.

[h1] Some major complaints [/h1]
Perhaps the biggest disappointment is the destruction of the mood. The first two chapters, I must admit, are brilliant. The puzzles were imaginative and realistic, except for one, where [b]*SPOILER ALERT!*[/b]   [spoiler] the combination of a lock is discovered by counting how many times a child was beaten in tic-tac-toe.[/spoiler] [b]*SPOILER FINISHED!*[/b] This, of course, made no sense whatsoever. The rest of the puzzles were perfect. They required observation, simple logic, and no random clicking whatsoever. In addition, some of the puzzles and their solutions were thoroughly disturbing, and I found myself mumbling, "I really don't want to do that. I really don't want to do that," more than a few times.

Beginning with chapter three, however, the game makes its slow, unhalting slide into mediocrity. The disturbingly suffocating mood simply disappears, and, in its place, an unfittingly humorous tone is adopted. To make matters worse, the game suffers the common adventure-game-failure disease: the puzzles lose their ingenuity and logic, and you just know that the designers suddenly ran out of ideas. From there on in, the puzzles are no longer challenging, some solutions even seem random, and the story becomes a race to finish before giving up in disappointment.

It's from here that the other problems with the game become apparent. First, the voice-acting, while passable in the beginning, suddenly becomes painful. It's not that the acting quality dropped; it's that the rest of the game suddenly loses its darkness and difficulty, leaving the lacks in the nuances (like voice-acting) embarrassingly obvious. What's worse is that one of the worst voice-actors is the main character himself, and you know you're stuck with him for the rest of the game. 

Second, the controls are not only unorthodox, but they're incredibly inconvenient. Reminiscent of those favoured by Telltale’s Tales of Monkey Island series, the left-mouse-button is used for all interaction, while holding down the right-button moves the character in the direction of the cursor. Without Tales of Monkey Island’s keyboard alternative however, the latter becomes extremely tedious after several hours of gameplay; the frustration exacerbated by the vast amount of walking back-and-forth done in some chapters,  and the result is that you end up walking up and down the same flight of stairs three or four times before you can convince your character to walk past it, not to mention the poor placement of NPCs who unintentionally block potential shortcuts. 

[h1] Is it really that bad? [/h1]
That said, Sanitarium offers a few saving graces. The sound effects are simply wonderful. The sound bytes for the game menu are very eerie, and I found myself saving and loading just to hear the voice whisper, "save game." And when you walk next to other characters, you can hear them mumbling or chattering away in the background. And unlike GOG's version of this game, I haven't encountered any crash problem or anything, other than one bug that you can see here: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=758971994
[h1] Final thought [/h1]
In the end it would be unjust to suggest that Sanitarium is all bad. However the handful of interesting locations, intriguing sub-tales and decent puzzles cannot make up for the blandness and lack of imagination that characterises the game as a whole. The game does make a statement about the designers' ideas on sanity and the human mind, but it also leaves you wondering why they decided to call it a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009810921', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1471140985}
review:
Sanitarium tells the story of a damaged mind searching for answers through a convoluted journey across wildly varied areas - each of dubious reality - which is surprisingly connected into something meaningful. Each step of the way can be painful though as the controls of this nearly two decade old game are not as suited to the fast-paced action sequences or unforgiving puzzles that break up the basic maneuvers demanded of a point-and-click, and even those simpler elements can rely too heavily on trial and error at times. Some pathways are unintentionally hidden and investigation points oscillate between being too broad and too exacting, leaving players wandering aimlessly when they should be charging towards the next piece of the puzzle. Gladly, these frustrations don't break immersion, despite interrupting the flow of storytelling which is at the very core of the experience. 
The game hasn't aged very well either. The visuals, as horrifying and compelling as they are, can often be stilted and blurry which damages their impact. And even the superior DotEmu version randomly crashes occasionally. 
There's plenty wrong with this game and that can stand as a roadblock to what it has to offer. But I can say nothing better about Sanitarium than this: when I played the XS Games version a few years ago, the game crashed at every cinematic, so one would have to save before each transition - many of which came without warning - and restart the game after that. I still finished this ten hour game under those conditions with fond enough memories that I bought a second version to experience it again. It's interesting, it's inventive, and most importantly it sticks with you. However poorly the 'game' aspects of Sanitarium could possibly have aged now or in the future, there will always be something worth experiencing here.

I’ve never played this game out because it still has some serious bugs which forced me to restart the game. Just keep in mind to use a very conservative saving strategy, because the bugs can really take the fun away. There are not too many bugs, but these few are rather severe (like items or gates that won’t work properly and block you from moving on because you probably did something in the wrong chronological order).

author: {'steamid': '76561198124781570', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1466607131}
review:
[h1]Bazen ''Oyun'' adı altında bir başyapıtı yaşarsınız hani... 10/10[/h1]
Bakmayın 1 saatlik oynama süreme, yıllar, uzun yıllar evvelinde henüz steam öncesi bırakın saatleri, günlerce, hatta kaldı ki defalarca tekrar tekrar oyun sonu getirmişliğim var diyebilirim sizlere. Nereden başlasam bilemiyorum, çünkü başlıkta yazdığım gibi ''Oyun'' adı altında çok önemli bir başyapıt var karşımızda. Hani bir film izlersiniz, bir kitap okur yada bir müzik dinlersiniz... o an içinize, derinlerinize işler. Atmosferinde kaybolursunuz ve artık var olduğunuz o dünyada değilsinizdir. Beyniniz ve ruhunuz bambaşka bir evrene çeker sizi. Havayı solursunuz ciğerlerinizde, halbuki mental olarak evinizde, kendi odanızın dört duvarı arasındasınızdır. Buna rağmen o yapımda var olan tüm karakterler görünmez bir şekilde yanı başınızdadır hani, seslerini işitirsiniz, kimi zaman duygulanır, kimi zaman ürperir ve kimi zaman ise göz yaşlarınıza hakim olamazsınız. Şaşırırsınız, endişelenir, kendiniz için endişelenirsiniz. Çünkü o başyapıtın karakteri o noktadan itibaren siz olmuşsunuzdur artık. Fazla dramatize gelebiliyor şuan bu yazdıklarım kulaklara ama inanın, Sanitarium harfi harfine bana yukarıda okuduklarınızı yaşattı sonuna kadar. Kimi efsaneler vardır bilirsiniz, yılların devirgenliğine rağmen o size yaşattığı hissiyatı hiç bir zaman kaybetmezler. Neredeyse asırlık olacak olan bu oyunlarda grafik aramazsınız.  Çünkü öyle bir an gelir ki, yeni nesil grafiklerle yapılmış göz alan o oyunlar, tarihin tozlu vitrinlerinde duran bu oyunların eline su dökemez. Benim gibi düşünen bir çok insan için de Sanitarium'un aynı değerde olduğunu düşünüyorum ve henüz oynamamış ve ilk kez oynayacak olan kişilere şunu öneriyorum, [u]günümüz oyunlarındaki o şatafatlı grafik beklentilerinizi Sanitarium için bir kenara bırakın, çünkü size çok, çok daha fazlasını verecek.[/u] Sanitarium, adventure ve point and click tarzı dediğimiz eski lakin bir o kadar türünde hala tahtını koruyan eşsiz bir yapım. Karşınızda tüylerinizi diken diken edecek, sizi defalarca şaşırtacak, ürpertecek ve kimi zaman gözlerinizin dahi dolmasına sebep olacak olan bir senaryo var. Bunula beraber, oyunun öyle soundtrackleri var ki, sizi içinde bulunduğunuz atmosfere katbekat bağlıyor ve inanın bana o melodiler adeta sizin duygularınızla oynuyor. Grafiklere gelecek olursak eğer, kendi adıma daima eskiyi özleyen ve oldschool'un tadını yeni nesil çoğu yapımda arayan ve bulamayan bir insan olarak diyebilirim ki çıktığı zamana göre kusursuz görsellere sahip oyunumuz. Günün birinde Sanitarium'un remastered versiyonu ile karşı karşıya kalırsak eğer biliyorum ki, oynarken daha bir ürperecek, daha bir kafayı yiyor olabileceğiz. Eğer bir oyun, müzikleri ve o eski eşsiz grafikleri ile bunu yaşatabiliyorsa, yenilenmiş bir şekilde neler hissettirir bilemiyorum. Ha aslında remastered'a gerek var mı onu da tam olarak bilmiyorum hatta şöyle bir düşününce hayır gerek yok bile diyebiliyorum. Çünkü efsane aradan bunca yıl geçmiş olmasına rağmen hala ilk kez oynuyormuşum gibi etkiliyor beni. Biliyorum farkındayım, oyuna ve senaryoya dair çok fazla bir şey anlatmadım sizlere ama inanın anlatmak istesem de yapamıyorum. Çünkü emin olun yazacağım ve sizin okuyacağınız her şey, o eşsiz senaryoya dair bir spoiler niteliğinde olacak ve ağzınızın tadını kaçırmak hiç istemiyorum, bizzar sizin yaşamanızı istiyorum. Sadece diyorum ki, eğer oynamadıysanız ve türden hoşlanıyor, bir de benim gibi oldschool meraklısıysanız, karşınızda duran oyun sizin için bir biçilmiş kaftan niteliğinde. Emin olun, yaşadıktan sonra pişman olmayacaksınız. Son olarak şunu unutmayın "Kurtuluşun anahtarı gençliktedir." yada daha karamsar bir bakış açısından bakılacak olunursa eğer ''Gençlik kurtuluşa giden yolun anahtarını saklar.'' Hepinize iyi oyunlar dilerim.

Dipnot: Büyük bir Metal Gear Solid Saga hayranı olarak, The Phantom Pain'e başladığım andan bitene kadar emin olmamakla beraber sevgili Kojima'nın TPP'de Sanitarium'dan etkilendiğini ve küçük küçük noktalar alarak oyuna eklemiş olabileceğini düşünüyorum. Eğer The Phantom Pain oynadıysanız ve bitirdiyseniz (Özellikle Paz diary görevlerine dikkat!), Sanitarium'u oynadıktan sonra siz de benim gibi düşünebilirsiniz.

review: Albeit filled with tired and harmful imagery related to the asylum and its patients, [i]Sanitarium[/i] manages to maintain an undeniable charm throughout the whole game. There is a reason this is considered one of the greats of the 90s adventure point-and-click games alongside [i]Grim Fandango[/i] and [i]Alone in the Dark[/i]. With its completely off the rails narrative, its bizarre sense of humour, memorable level design and colourful cast, [i]Sanitarium[/i] is definitely worth the price for those seeking a wild, wild ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999706146', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1460121385}
review:
Great game, software.
Sanitarium is a great game, good plot, intersting riddles, atmosphere, top notch adventure game.
However the software (at least on win10) is terrible.
The game crashed 3 times during my playthrough.
I have a dual screen setup, and everytime i would scroll my mouse away from one screen, even by mistake (which happened because of the drag to move mechanic) the game wouldnt work.
well, it did work, but it became a black screen.
Also, a few instances where I couldn't exit to the menu, so I was forced to play though the screen, (although this might be by design, not sure)
Its a shame that from a technical standpoint this game is shit.
(I would also loved to see some of the features they released for android and IOS version)
If youre willing to overlook the technical details, the game is great.
Its a shame that these bugs hurt the overall very positive experience.

I would recommend playing it, but on Android or iOS, because its cheaper, and works better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028032411', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1459279109}
review:
WARNING: This review may have spoilers, please read at your own risk.

I've had this game on my wish-list for a long ass time. I loved watching people do video walkthroughs of it over and over and I finally got it and finished it!

So here it is folks, my review of Sanitarium.

STORY: You play as an amnesia stricken patient in an insane asylum dealing with the various psychologial issues he has.

As you go through various crazy levels such as a town where theres nothing but mutated children and overgrown plants, an island circus, and an alien world filled bugs, cybernetics, and cyclops, you will know more about the character you're playing and it smoothly helps the game along.

For me I thought the story was very excellent. The levels help correspond and relate to the characters memorys/issues and it works well. The only issue I have is the voice actors are okay/below average at best. 8.5/10

GRAPHICS: Now of course I'm gonna get this out of the way. This game came out in the late 90's, of course the graphics are gonna be dated.

Other than that I will say though that the game looks nice for its time and it didn't really bother me that much. 8/10

GAMEPLAY: This is an isometric click and point adventure game. Some puzzles in my honest opinion kinda sucked, some were a bit too easy and others were in the right amount of difficulty for me.

There are 13 levels to go through and depending on how good you are at puzzles this game will probably only take you a few hours to beat unfortuantley.

For the average adventure gamer I would say this game will probably take you longer. 

Also SLOW MOVEMENT. 7.5/10

VERDICT: Sanitarium is a nice psychological horror game. 

Granted its not gonna spook you to death, but it brings in a great story, nostalgic graphics and fine gameplay.

Just remember though its dated okay?;D 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198017536559', 'num_games_owned': 1078, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1666294775}
review: Последний квест, который после Петьки и ВИЧ меня поразил (а прошел я их за свою жизнь пару раз (третий раз в стиме)). Наткнулся на него в далеком 2000 году, три диска от ФАРГУСА и мне тогда смущал не всегда верная обложка игры - на некоторых переводных версиях почему-то написано, что это RPG, а это не так. И буквально с первых минут игры понял - эта та игра, которая мне мама не давала играть в эту игру, т.к. в нем содержит психические расстройства (это тогда так сказала моя мама). Это неповторимо, это гениально. Это не очередной Петька и Вич, и даже не красивая, но по сути простая и поверхностная Сибирь. Это просто на грани разумного, и название (особенно русское) прямое тому доказательство.

review: This was a blast from the past - so great to revisit a game that I had such great memories about. But, technology has really dated this one. The movement of the character was clumsy, the graphics are grainy, and the sound effects are annoying. The biggest drawback is the TERRIBLE VOICE ACTING - could be some of the worst I have ever heard!!!! Even still the story alone makes you want to finish this one. It is just as intriguing today as it was in 1998. If any game is worthy of a reboot, this one would be in my top 10. Would love to see this updated for today's audience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083973537', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1455467054}
review:
This one of the greatest games I ever played from the 90's! 
I played it many years ago but I haven't the chance to finish it until now.

Sanitarium is a game that the phsicology, metaphores, logic... Play with you. The idea of the game from begining is like having you to sort out conclusions of what happens -or it happens- with the protagonist. Most of the ambience or 'worlds' are amazing, also the most of the melodies in it. It also makes you think a lot for the many puzzles it has. So, it's not recommended if you don't have enough patience to resolve some of them, though is something minor in comparison with the rest. 

In my opinion one of the most important things in the game is the story behind. The story in general and the little stories from the worlds. It's so entertaining to try to put together pieces of the different stories to know the main story completely.

But in resume, it's high recommended!
Remember! 2d old games can also be great & very interesting, too. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049701098', 'num_games_owned': 3699, 'num_reviews': 832, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1454951834}
review:
Sanitarium is an old school cult classic point and click adventure title from 1998. You play as the main protagonist, Max, who wakes up in an insane asylum with amnesia; he doesn't even remember his own name, how he ended up in the asylum, or any events surrounding his life. It is up to you, the player, to put the pieces of the story together through cutscenes and dialogue.

The main thing that Sanitarium accomplishes is giving the player an overwhelming sense of confusion at the beginning, which places players into the mindset of Max, and gives way to the emotions that he may experience due to his amnesia. The confusion slowly deteriorates throughout the course of the 13 levels as more information is obtained. It's easy to become immersed in the experience of the title, as there is absolutely no foreshadowing of events or dramatic irony present. This leaves it up to the player to continually think about what is happening from moment to moment, until the next piece of the story is revealed. In order to fully understand what is going on by the end of the game, it's extremely important to interact and talk with the other characters that will be available in each level. Unlike many other games of this nature that may leave loose ends once the game is finished, Sanitarium does a good job of cleaning them all up so that the player has solid knowledge of what really has transpired.

The port itself is exceptional, as it performs just as the original did back in 1998. There are no crashes, glitches, bugs, or lag present, and absolutely nothing that renders the game unplayable. The cinematics still have their scan-lines, which really brings out the old CRT vibe of the game. One weird thing that I did encounter is that the game does run at 15-17 FPS, but the puzzles render at 60 FPS. You can tell how much more smooth the puzzle sections are versus the rest of the game, but back in 1998 it was standard for isometric PC titles to run at 15 FPS; I'm just unsure as to why the puzzle sections have a higher output. Either way, we can thank DotEmu for another fantastic port of an underdog retro title.

The gameplay itself is simple enough, the right mouse button is held down to make the character walk and the left mouse button is used to interact with people and objects. Sometimes the walking mechanic can be mildly irritating if you're attempting to maneuver around stairs; quite often you may end up descending and ascending the same staircase by accident. Every single piece of dialogue is coupled with a voice-over, including the buttons in the main menu and the items in the player's inventory; I must say, for a game made in 98' the voice acting is superb, as are the various voice effects on creatures such as insectoids and specters. 

The maps are quite small, and while some may push that this was a limitation of late 90's technology, I will point out here that Diablo was released in late 1996. While the original Diablo did not exactly have monstrous maps by any means, they were at least 3-4 times larger than any given map present within Sanitarium. This doesn't really set the game back, however, as each of the 13 levels have their own distinct map; each of which are radically diverse from one another. The visuals stand up to the test of time, and are as outstanding as they are gory. The music and sound effects are equally as captivating, and they really help to submerge the gamer into the realm of the title.

So in wrap-up, Sanitarium is an excellent cult classic from 1998 that has stood the test of time. The game has received a flawless port by DotEmu, and it's worth a pick up to fans of old point and click adventure isometrics. To those on the fence, if you've played current generation games such as Stasis and Primordial, and have enjoyed them, then Sanitarium should be a hit with you as well. While I don't believe that $10.99 CAD is too steep for this title, on sale for $5.50 is even better. If you're using a guide, the title shouldn't run more than 7-9 hours.

[h1]Rating: [b]5.0/5.0[/b] - An amazing achievement, this game must be played.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1414871297}
review:
J'ai pu profiter de sa présence sur Steam pour enfin jouer à ce jeu mythique dans son intégralité après avoir en vain essayer de faire tourner entièrement des versions récupérées sur des sites d'abandonwares. J'avais jamais pu  l'acheter en version boîte à l'époque car il avait vite été retiré de la vente dans de nombreux magasins, ce qui a contribué à son image sulfureuse,

J'ai été séduit par l'ambiance, les thèmes abordés et le côté old school que j'adore dans les jeux des années 90.

On pourra reprocher les problèmes rencontrés parfois pour guider avec précision un personnage pourtant particulièrement lent. On pourra aussi regretter des objets trop bien cachés et qu'on découvre un peu par hasard.
La durée de vie est plutôt limitée et les énigmes plutôt faciles.

Mais la grosse déception, c'est le scénario. J'avais une grosse attente à ce niveau, ça part sur des bases prometteuses et on imagine alors que le jeu va nous entraîner dans son univers et nous emporter dans des rebondissements multiples. Et en fait, non. L'histoire s'égare avec de multiples personnages et la révélation finale (si on peut appeler ça comme ça) correspond à ce qu'on avait imaginé dès le début du jeu.

En conclusion, jouez à ce jeu parce que c'est un mythique témoin d'une époque révolue mais n'en attendez pas trop...

author: {'steamid': '76561197964103368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1449732873}
review:
Where to start? This is a puzzle solving game with many dark themes running throughout the plot.  

This game came out in 1998 and plays from a top down 3rd person perspective common to other games from its time. It also features many FMVs - Full Motion Videos. Not real life actors in front of a camera like the C&C franchises often employed, but (again for its time) really well rendered videos of the different characters and locations in the game. They are used mainly as segues to explain plot elements with better drawn scenes in the form of short videos and then move back to the top down perspective again. True, this shows the game's age and the crudeness of the videos by today's standards - but this game still shines even 17 years later despite the limitations in video rendering from a bygone era.

You awake as a patient within a mental asylum with a severe case of amnesia. After a few conversations though you quickly surmise that though you are called crazy (even by the other inmates!), you're probably the MOST sane person in the entire facility. As you progress through the different chapters a very subtle plot thread is pulled at until the pieces start falling into place roughly 3/4 through the game, leaving me rather impressed at how the loose ends were tied together by game's end. 

One of the more intriguing aspects of the game comes with the establishing of the persona of the character and then his frequent "jumps" throughout the different areas. Our protagonist tavels to a wide range of distinct locales to diffuse a myriad of situations and problems. Each area has a distinct identity to it and leaves you pondering at what some of the upcoming twists and turns in the plot might be, only to have something *completely* different than what you could have even imagined suddenly occurring - I was not prepared for what awaits in Chapter 7!

The puzzles feel oddly open ended perhaps due to the different dialog options to explore when conversing with the many characters. The reality however, is that you usually are solving the puzzles in a direct linear fashion...do A, to get to B to be able to move to C. It's rather surprising how well they mask this sense of linear gameplay because theres always SO MUCH to explore and discover. 

All in all, this game is a gem. A diamond in the rough. I don't recall if this game ended up making a big splash when it was originally released, but its a great ride from beginning to end. I back this game 100% as a great adventure game well ahead of its time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1650656532}
review:
[code]Puedes ver más reseñas como esta en la mentoría [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]
[code] Hay disponible una traducción al español (España) [url=http://www.clandlan.net/foros/topic/80671-traduccion-sanitarium-2da-edicion/][u]AQUÍ[/u][/url][/code] 

[h1]Esta reseña no contiene spoilers[/h1]

Sanitarium es uno de las mejores aventuras gráficas de terror que puede encontrarse hoy en día. Disfruté y me dejé sorprender allá por el 2001 cuando lo jugué por primera vez, y ahora lo volví a rejugar en Steam y una vez más la experiecia ha sido magnífica.

Sanitarium tiene la gran virtud de ofrecernos terror muy variado y en más de una ocasión nos recordará novelas de Stephen King, con payasos macabros, un pueblo maldito, y los desesperados habitantes que lo ocupan donde la locura se asienta tranquilamente y las deformidades más absurdas y febriles campan a sus anchas.

Pero Sanitarium no es solamente un juego de terror, es mucho más. Lo que en un principio parece ser una rayada de proporciones épicas desde el primer segundo del juego, se irá convirtiendo en un exhaustivo zambullir en la psique del personaje principal, sus miedos, sus traumas y sus anhelos más vitales. Todo ello contado en un goteo constante que no acabará hasta el último momento.

Sin embargo, y aunque este título presenta las situaciones más bizarras y desconcertantes, tiene la virtud de mantener un hilo conductor que lo dota de equilibrio, elocuencia y sentido común una vez vamos desenmarañando toda la historia, quedando al final de la misma muy satisfechos y realmente sorprendidos. Algo muy de agradecer, ya que no son pocas las veces que los desarrolladores presentan algo bizarro y no saben como cerrarlo. Este no es el caso.

En definitiva, Sanitarium es por todo lo comentado arriba y por muchas más cosas que no he querido desvelar, una sobresaliente aventura gráfica que no te dejará impasible mientras la disfrutas. 

Si te gustan las aventuras gráficas clásicas, el terror y lo desconcertante, Sanitarium es un juego obligado en tu biblioteca de Steam. Además, el idioma no será un problema, ya que hay una traducción al castellano disponible para nuestro deleite personal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030516476', 'num_games_owned': 5534, 'num_reviews': 465, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1447081061}
review:
La réputation de ce jeu n'est plus à faire, un grand classique de l'horreur, un jeu culte dans sa catégorie aventure en Point and click, chef d'oeuvre pour certains, mystique pour d'autres,  une chose est sûre, ce titre controversé et supprimé des ventes à son époque a beaucoup fait parler de lui et suscité l'intérêt des plus curieux d'entre nous.

Plus qu'un simple jeu, Sanitarium fait partie de la catégorie des titres qui marquent les esprits, celle-là même qui vous retourne la tête, pose à questionnements et vous laisse tout bouleversé.

Son histoire est bien ficelée, et vous fera voyager au travers de plusieurs personnages tous reliés entre eux (j'ai plutôt envie de dire à LUI) dans un univers étrange et glauque, dans le fin fond d'une conscience dérangée. 

Par moments, vous vous demanderez pourquoi d'un tel endroit vous vous retrouvez dans la peau de quelqu'un d'autre, plongé dans un univers complétement différent et des plus bizarre que l'on puisse imaginer, mais plus vous avancez dans l'histoire, plus le puzzle s'assemble, et vous commencez à comprendre le pourquoi des choses...

Malgré ses 20 ans d'âge ce jeu est encore acceptable graphiquement, on y jouera pour son ambiance et son histoire horrifique et malsaine. Un must have à découvrir.

Jouer à "sanitarium" c'est prendre un ticket pour un séjour en hôpital psy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051068301', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1457992511}
review: As other reviewers have said, this game came out when Point-and-Click games were losing appeal and thus was largely ignored, which is a shame because Sanitarium is an unique horror game. Having played it originally when it was released this port offers the exact same experience as the original, which can be quite frustrating at times. It's difficult for laptop players without a mouse to play it as the game offers no configuration to switch from mouse to keyboard controls, but the constant hand cramps you're bound to experience playing Sanitarium should not put you off. Yes, the dialogue is a bit cheesy and the voice acting is worse than Shenmue's but at the end of the day there has not been a game like Sanitarium, it's an interesting experience that will leave an impression on you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1446354517}
review:
Sanitarium always struck me as one of the unsung classics of the adventure genre. Releasing originally in 1998, it came right before a significant lull in point and click games. It's hard to say if it would have garnered more or less attention had it come out during one of the prime periods, since it does a lot of things right, but still suffers from many of the flaws that hampered its contemporaries.

The game opens with you as an amnesiac named Max, terribly scarred and confused, locked up in the least feasible insane asylum imaginable. Seriously, Arkham has nothing on this place; one of your first tasks is to engineer yourself across a Death Star Tractor Control-style chasm to a guard office suspended above the abyss, all while the oddly medieval tower crumbles around you. It only gets stranger from there as Max is whisked away to towns of zombie children, a circus on an island beset by man-eating squid, and a living hive of human-sized bugs that's even more bizarre than whatever you're imagining.

The real strength of Sanitarium is in its settings, the dark, impossible worlds that each of its thirteen chapters take place in. They are wholly unique and dreamlike, perfectly capturing that backdrop of madness in the same way that Planescape: Torment captured life in an utterly alien city. The graphics are actually quite similar, both employing those early 3D models transposed into animated sprites. The worlds of Sanitarium are not overly large, so the graphics benefit from some excellent detail and extra animations for almost any situation.

There are plenty of NPCs to interact with, each with a unique and adequately voiced personality. Puzzles tend to be pretty clear for the most part, and the game doesn't bog you down with a sprawling inventory like some of its peers. You may run into a few walkthrough situations in the more alien settings, but in general the game does a good job of communicating what you should be doing and how to go about it. Unfortunately, it make take you some time to get it done because your walk speed is on the very low end of tolerable and there's no sprinting or fast travel. The adequate voice work can also drone on for far longer than is welcome, though spoken dialog can be skipped through in favor of the ever-present text.

Story-wise, Sanitarium is almost as much of a fever dream as the presentation. Max clearly has mental issues that are revealed symbolically through the many worlds of the game, but there's a much grander plot at work that reaches farther than most adventure games dare. It's a bit brazen and corny at times, but also woven into the symbolism in some pretty interesting ways. The whole journey is worth seeing through, and as long as you have some patience for slow trudging, overdone VOs, and a few obnoxious pixel hunts, I have no doubt Sanitarium will prove why it deserves to stand among the adventure classics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053099714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1630805135}
review: Nekonvenční a ve své době populární adventura z roku 1998 se hraje i dnes skvěle. Rok 2015 a já hraju Sanitarium poprvé takže si vyškrtněte neobjektivní dojmy spojené s nostalgií. Přesto všechno mě tahle unikátní hororovka dokáže v průběhu hry překvapovat víc než dnešní moderní hry plné konvencí. Ocitáte se v blázinci, vůbec nic si nepamatujete a přirozeně se snažíte přijít na to kdo jste a o co tady jde. Často se střídá realita a bláznivě divné sny, které Vám, ale na konci dají neuvěřitelný smysl. Ve hře narazíte na nemálo sofistikovaných a originálních hádanek, které nepřestanou překvapovat až do konce hry! Na své stáří mě Sanitarium dokázalo neobvykle udržet u monitoru a cosi to ve mě zanechalo. Jestli máš rád hororové adventury a dokážeš překousnout starší herni mechaniky a horší grafiku neváhej a volej jěště dnes. Pokud totiž zavoláš ihned můžeš se vžít do bezejmeného hrdiny s příznaky schizofrenie již za pár minut jelikož data vyžadují na hardisku necelý 1GB. Čeština ke stažení zdarma.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029073737', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1441351931}
review: Jeu culte sorti à l'origine en 1998 et bien vite censuré en France, on se retrouve dans un thriller psychologique admirablement bien ficelé et atypique (surtout pour un jeu de cette époque). La réalisation est impeccable en tout point, les graphismes bien que vieillots désormais sont encore beaux, les musiques collent bien à l'atmosphère, tous les textes du jeu ainsi que les (nombreuses) cinématiques sont intégralement doublés en français de manière plutôt convaincante et le jeu est très riche et varié, proposant une succession de courtes aventures dans des univers torturés et parsemés d'énigmes. Le seul point négatif que l'on pourrait retenir est une courte durée de vie (une petite dizaine d'heures), mais il vaut toujours largement son prix. De toute manière, ce jeu d'un autre âge a tellement posé les bases pour les générations suivantes dans le domaine de l'horreur psychologique qu'il fait partie des incontournables dans la bibliothèque de jeu de n'importe quel joueur qui se respecte alors pour le bien de votre culture de gamer, prenez-le.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207741077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1440712662}
review:
THIS IS A CLASSIC FROM MY YOUNGER YEARS AND IT'S STILL ENTERTAINING TO PLAY ONCE YOU WORK OUT HOW TO MOVE ABOUT AND MANIPULATE THINGS. SANITARIUM IS STORY LED AND PUZZLE ORIENTATED AND IF YOU ARE INTO THAT TYPE OF THING, YOU WILL WANT THIS GAME.

DEVELOPED IN THE 90'S, SOME OF THE PUZZLES ARE A LITTLE ILLOGICAL AND CAN EVEN BECOME A LITTLE FRUSTRATING, BUT ONCE YOU GET THROUGH THEM, THE BIZARRE STORYLINE KEEPS YOU RUNNING FOR THE NEXT CHALLENGE.

LIKE MANY OLDER PLAYERS WHO WERE INTO ORIGINAL POINT AND CLICK GRAPHIC ADVENTURES AND RPG'S, I HAVE LOST TOUCH WITH OLDER GAMES AND IT IS NICE TO SEE A REVIVAL OF THEM ON STEAM.

I LOOK FORWARD TO SEEING MORE OF THIS TYPE GAME AND POSSIBLY EVEN A REVAMP OF SOME ORIGINALS WOULDN'T GO AMISS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056837040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1446410648}
review:
This is a classic point&click adventure. The graphical style held up well, and it's still enjoyable to explore the various settings and interact with the (mostly absurd) characters that you get to meet. Dialogues are well-written and the voice acting is spot on!

author: {'steamid': '76561198201687317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1447468129}
review:
Ein kurzweiliges 3rd-Person-Point-And-Click-Spiel das ich jedem, der solche Spiele mag, uneingeschränkt empfehlen kann.  Aufgrund seines Alters dürfte es auch auf heutzutage sehr schwach ausgestatten Windows-Rechnern laufen.

Die Spieldauer beträgt ca. 8 bis 16h.  Vorsicht:  Das Spiel hat psychedelischen Horror als Hintergrund, ist teils etwas "igitt", und es kommen Leichen, Folter, Böse Clowns, Spuk und Geister vor.  Ist also nichts für Gottesfanatiker oder Heile-Welt-Despoten, aber es dürfte nichts enthalten sein, das "medienerfahrene" Teenager heutzutage nicht schon gruseliger gesehen hätten.  Es sind mir keine sexuelle Inhalte, Szenen oder Anspielungen aufgefallen.  Das Spiel verzichtet auch auf flashige Shock-Splatter-Szenen, die meisten Szenen sind irgendwie "shocking", aber man hat beliebig viel Zeit, sich diesen Horror genüßlich reinzuziehen.

Die Steuerung ist etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig, denn sie stammt aus der pre-Tablet-Ära.  Die - wenigen - "Action"-Sequenzen, die selten ein Zeitlimit haben, kann man endlos wiederholen, allerdings starten sie beim Fehlschlag meisten wieder von vorne.

Das Spiel speichert nicht automatisch, auch nicht beim Verlassen!  Save/Load ist (so gut wie) jederzeit möglich, aber eben manuell.  Man sollte hin und wieder speichern, ich habe mich mindestens 1 Mal in eine Situation maneuvriert, in der die Spielfigur an einer Ecke hängenblieb aus der sie nimmer herauskam.

Man kann sich alle Filmsequenzen usw. nochmals ansehen (leider werden diese nicht chronologisch aufgelistet), und es gibt Untertitel.  Allerdings ist der Unterititelbereich manchmal zu klein um den vollständigen deutschen Texte zu fassen, und manchmal weicht der Text auch minimal ab.  Ansonsten ist die deutsche Umsetzung tadellos.

Es wird alles vorgelesen.  Bis auf die - wie ich finde - kniffeligste Stelle (dem Satz), kann es uneingeschränkt von Analphabeten gespielt werden.  Der Sprechton ist aber aufgrund der zusätzlichen, oft (w)irren, Hintergrundsgeräusche anfangs stark überlagert und deshalb schwer zu verstehen.  Die Spielatmosphäre lärmt nicht selten wie auf einem Jahrmarkt.

Personen mit eingeschränktem APM oder haptischen Einschränkungen werden nur an einigen, wenigen Stellen Probleme bekommen, brauchen dann aber Hilfe von jemandem, der besser mit der Maus umgehen kann.

Das Spiel hat einige sehr kniffelige, manchmal sogar leicht unlogische, komische oder schreckliche Lösungen.  Mit viel Geduld kann man alles selber herausfinden.  Fast immer finden sich alle notwendigen Hinweise im Spiel selbst, lassen sich durch genaues zusehen bzw. zuhören finden oder man muss halt durchprobieren bzw. jeden einzelnen Pixel nach neuen Hinweisen absuchen und einige Dinge halt auch mehrfach durchlaufen, manchmal ändert sich das Ergebnis.

Kommt man wirklich nimmer weiter, gibt es auf Youtube vollständig deutsche Lets-Plays, die man allerdings nicht vorher sehen sollte um sich nicht den Spaß auf das selber-Knacken der teils herrlich abstrusen Aufgaben zu nehmen.

Einige Probleme im Spiel sind wirklich vertrackt, die meisten aber haben einen mittlere bis niedrige Schwierigkeitsgrad.  Logisches Denken (Papier und Bleistift) ist für einige Lösungen notwendig, aber nur zum Mitschreiben.  Mathematik ist, abseits von zählen, nicht nötig.

Dieses Spiel kann trotz oder gerade wegen seines Alters von bald 20 Jahren in Punkto Spielinhalt locker mit den neuen "hübschen" Apps gleicher Art auch preislich mithalten, und diese locker übertreffen, außer halt in der grafischen Darstellung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005204242', 'num_games_owned': 1323, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1432991240}
review:
Sanitarium is a beautifully dark and surreal point and click adventure game with a great story line. 

Use your mouse to click where to take your character, interact with objects or talk with people.  The music locks in so well with every setting you visit and be prepared for some some odd and strange visuals along the way. You'll encounter some puzzles which range from different difficulties, Some may be too easy and some may be rather cryptic leaving you crawling for a walk thru online somewhere. But along its unique environments, freaky music and unsettling atmosphere the story is constructed well, You'll begin with very little and most likely a lot of confusion but as you play onward, bit by bit the pieces come together and you'll be curious to learn more as you venture further more. 

The only down parts I would mention would be the voice acting can be a little bit silly, There are many characters to interact with (I think there's an achievement for talking to all of them but I didn't get it) and most of them scattered amongst the levels will just repeat the same content as many other characters in the level you are in. While it's not the exact same dialog, It'll leave you a tad frustrated because you've heard it nearly 5 times before and you get to the point of reading the subtitles faster than they've finished speaking their first sentence.  Also, the walking controls can sometimes get stuck, walking is often quite slow and since you have to travel back and forth on most levels, it can feel like a drag or an effort to move around.

Sanitarium should be welcomed by the modern gamer for its different style of gameplay that has somewhat gone a bit quiet these days. There's some 'Random' games out there but nothing like the twisted and weird games which only the famous retro games on MS-dos and PC back in the day delivered. It's well admired from the retro gamers world wide and now, maybe its time for you to hook it up and indulge in a classic world with the nostalgia style of game play that entertained many of years

author: {'steamid': '76561197986360343', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 866, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1429437607}
review:
Sanitarium is a point-and-click adventure game released by the now-defunct DreamForge Intertainment back in 1998. The story is quite engaging: our protagonist has a car accident after which he wakes up in an asylum. He does not know how he got there nor does he remember what happened to him (let alone his name).

If you look at the pictures on the store page you can clearly see not every event takes place in reality - our hero goes through various environments impersonating different persons throughout different ages (or planes, if you will). It makes the story a bit convoluted but eventually you will get all pieces of the puzzle together.

Oh, puzzles! Normally, you have a couple of items in your inventory and making a progress is fairly easy but from time to time you need to solve puzzles. These require some finesse and you do not get the help you would in today's games.

Sanitarium is a good game but aged much throughout the years. Since the story is still interesting and some of the artwork looks haunting (the game gradually gets under your skin without having any jump scares) I can recommend it not just to those people who used to own this game but also to those who loved the genre back in the '90s.

PS: I played it upon its release when it crashed frequently. An update not long ago was applied which seems to have eliminated all the CTDs completely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082635307', 'num_games_owned': 774, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1425102334}
review:
It seems ironic that a game about amnesia would be so unforgettable.

Our hero wakes up in an insane asylum, covered in bandages and unable to remember his own name.  As he learns more about his situation and remembers more about himself, his sanity comes further and further into question.

While Sanitarium is filled with intriguing puzzles and memorable characters, its surreal mood and well-written story are the real draws.  The game is packed full of foreshadowing and symbolism that won't register on the first playthrough.  The bizarre occurrences can be explained once you know the whole story, and when our hero triumphs in the end, the player will feel very satisfied.  The levels combine realistic elements with incredible fantastic notions in a creepy crescendo of madness, putting the player increasingly on edge until the final truth is revealed.

Admittedly, since its creation in 1998, parts of Sanitarium have not aged well.  The cutscenes in particular will underwhelm today's audience.  One might also criticize the game's rather slow pacing and occasionally ridiculous voice acting.  At the end of the day, however, these elements merely add a level of nostalgic charm.

In short, Sanitarium is well worth playing at least twice - more, for the twisted levels and puzzles that you particularly enjoy.  It brings some of the best material that old-school point-and-click adventure games have to offer, and remains an excellent example of video games as art and entertainment both.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974123817', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1424890284}
review:
Un vieux point and click des 90' ?

Non, bien mieux. Si vous cherchez un jeu immersif, c'est ici !

++ Scénario - Ambiance - Court - Diversifié ++



Niveau histoire, ça se démarque du lot par son originalité, et la manière dont le scenario est amené.

L'ambiance malsaine de ce jeu vous fera oublier les graphismes un peu vieillis.
La bande son et le level design sont immersifs, et si vous vous surprennez à vous sentir opressé par les buits de fond... c'est peut être parce que vous êtes fou, dois-je vraiment vous le rappeler ?

Au niveau du gameplay, on dira que c'est un "adventure's point & click"...
Même si le genre n'existe pas, j'entend par là que les enigmes restent facilent, intuitives et logiques.
On suit plus le raisonnement du personnage principal qu'on ne se met à réfléchir. 


Et comme on a tous trop de jeux, et qu'on veut savoir dans quoi on se lance, il se finit en ~~10h de jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969716707', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1468110948}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198097743431', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1422176772}
review:
This game. The 90's really astound me. With the limited technology they had, they created such masterpieces. Sanitarium is a point-and-click genre game in which you control a wrapped-up mental patient, who is, and is not, mad. It's up to you to find out, if you can.

I won't lie. Some puzzles are very hard to solve and I needed to consult a walkthrough. But I think it's partly my fault because pay REAL close attention to what they're saying because they do hint things. And if you're the nost type horay for you because you should click every single thing you can see and hear what he has to say.

The story and the designs!! God the designs. They say Silent Hill is the forefather of psychological horror like Resident was to survival horror, but no one mentions this gem. The subliminal designs, meanings and purpose in each of the situations you delve into is just mind-blowingly genius for its time. Graphics are great for its time and still looks great when brought forward now. The voice-acting was average on some, absolutely brilliant and haunting on the others. The story and boldly horrifying things that they dare to show are simply perfect. The only thing I would complain about is the controls. They are a wee bit clunky but it's the speed of the characters walking sometimes throughout a large map that gets me nodding off to sleep sometimes. Another thing is the cutscenes, where I think they could be added to just produce a more satisfying effect. Like the ending of The Hive.

You will want the character to proceed. You will want to help him find what he is seeking to find. You will emphathize with him. It's how immersive this is.

Verdict? Astounding. Such classic. Prepare the tissue cuz' you might need one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155925812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1505678166}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050498466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1693174049}
review:
Sanitarium is creepy as hell and full of puzzles to solve. You play as a man who has lost his mind and his memory and must journey through his own madness to discover the truth.
The controls are very simple (you only ever use the left and right mouse buttons) and the puzzles vary in difficulty. Some are straightforward visual puzzles whereas others require you to memorize information. There are some sequences that require you to fight off monsters, as well. I would say the story is the main reason I love this game, though. It's fun to play the first time to discover the truth, and just as fun to play a second time around so you can notice bits of foreshadowing and the ways in which the main character's delusions reflect reality.
The entire game can be beaten in one sitting. I finished every achievement in about 7 hours, but I played the game previously in middle school and still remembered a lot of the puzzle solutions. If you're starting from scratch, I imagine it will take longer. Either way, it is most definitely worth the $10 price tag.
My primary complaint about this game would be that sometimes the ultra-simple controls backfire and make things a bit difficult to manage. True to form of 90s PC games, there is a lot of clicking you will have to do on seemingly irrelevant objects in order to find, for instance, items required to move forward. I often found myself wishing I could move using arrow keys or WASD. There are also places where you can get stuck, so I recommend making a separate save at the beginning of each level just in case you need to go back (this also helps with getting the rarer achievements, or just for the fun of playing your favorite levels again).
The bottom line is: if you like creepy things and like to figure out mysteries, this is the next game you should buy. You will love it.

review:
I never played Sanitarium the first time round but being a fan of point and click games I love playing through old ones.  This had outstanding reviews mostly from people who played it originally and I can see why.  The animation is so good for it's time and the FMV sequences are brilliant as well.  I like that there is a story and you are somewhat tied to the character and want to know what has happened to him.

The puzzles however... man I spent so much time jumping between the game and walkthroughs.  The puzzles are so obscure.  Maybe when I was a kid and owned one game and one game only and had no internet to speak of, I would have spent hours trying every combination to every puzzle until I had completed the game but now my attention span is too short and I imagine the same is true with most gamers now.  
So for this reason I think something is lost but nonethless I am enjoying playing through and my game has just crashed but I look forward to the conclusion of the story.
