author: {'steamid': '76561198036639853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1417074925}
review:
Je ne connaissais Sanitarium que de nom et les captures d'écran ne me faisaient pas envie (je ne suis pas fan de la 3D isométrique). Force est de constater que ce jeu (qui ne paie pas de mine) est tout bonnement génial: l'intrigue, très travaillée, vaut le détour, et l'ambiance du jeu est purement horrible (déterrer un cadavre pour gagner une partie de cache-cache avec des enfants psychopathes..) et très soignée.
L'intrigue est ponctuée par des énigmes: celles sous forme de minijeux sont globalement simples, mais la progression est tout bonnement labyrinthique. Tout est très 90's (non ??), j'entends par là qu'il faut réellement faire des efforts de reflexion pour avancer, c'est à se taper le crâne contre un trottoir tellement c'est tordu (siphoner un réservoir, puis arracher des cables de liaison dans un tracteur 200M plus loin, pour y aller il faut trouver le seul bon manège qui se cassera, récupérer ce cochon de lait cassé, le jeter sur la rivière, puis allumer la machine avec l'essence et brancher le cable de liaison sur un crucifix que vous aurez planté sur un élément du décor pour tuer un monstre, il faut y penser).
Quoi qu'il en soit, Sanitarium est un très bon divertissement que je ne suis pas pret d'oublier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090568028', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1416931921}
review:
这是一款非常经典的作品，发售于1998年——冒险解谜游戏的黄金时代，同年还有另一款经典《Grim Fandango/冥界狂想曲》
2009年由ChinaAVG进行了汉化，我也是通过汉化才接触到这部作品，如今一晃，又是5年过去了。

伟大的游戏总是拥有永恒的生命力，这款十六年前的作品在一个月前登陆steam，立刻就有好多游戏时间0.1小时的用户送上洋洋洒洒的长文好评，因为这么多年来，他们已经通过CD/GOG等重温了无数遍，这...大约就叫 情怀。

好了，抒情暂时打住，我们来谈谈游戏本身。

《疯人院》，以现在的标准来看，也可以称得上AVG中的大作。 想象一下，1998年2GB容量的游戏，10+的独立场景，大量过场动画，大约20小时的平均通关时间。从疯人院到马戏团，从虫族巢穴到阿兹特克遗迹，光怪陆离，却毫不违和。

游戏的画面在今天看来当然难免显得粗糙简陋，但因为游戏本身的氛围烘托就是晦暗压抑的，过场动画也是特意做了噪点处理，反而丝毫不影响气氛的营造。

游戏的剧情是最大的亮点，贯穿整个流程，处处充满了隐喻和呼应，故事的全貌在游戏进程中逐步展现，从一头雾水到恍然大悟，玩家不知不觉地就沉浸到了剧情中，更难能可贵的是，即使多年之后我再重玩这一遍，依然能发现当年初玩时未曾注意到的细节与隐喻。

谜题的难度适中，设计颇有巧思，但以如今的眼光来看，难免有些过时和简陋，比如两处带点动作元素的谜题，受限于当时的机能，只能说表现一般。

这次重玩下来，最大的问题在于操控，一方面角色的行走速度普遍偏慢，而控制行走的方式又相当反人类——按住右键移动，导致在部分角落处会有卡顿的现象，手感相当不好。这儿提前给大家提个醒了。

游戏中的英文并不难，文本量其实也不算大。觉得吃力的童鞋可以试试ChinaAVG的那个汉化补丁，虽然我确定能不能在steam版上使用。


PS. 本来这次想拿个全成就纪念一下，却没想到与全部NPC对话这个成就怎么也拿不到，也罢，就作为一个瑕疵，留作下次再玩一遍的念想吧，XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198036410850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1600637597}
review:
Одна из первых моих игр на пк и один из самых любимых хоррор-квестов. Достаточно сказать, что все три диска(игра выпускалась на трех дисках, ага :)) храню до сих пор. Давно хотела поиграть в оригинальной озвучке, потому что нашу локализацию знаю уже практически наизусть. Могу сказать, что оригинал определенно рулит(детские голоса, они прекрасны :), но и наша локализация тоже хороша. Музыка, персонажи, сюжет, атмосфера...все на высшем уровне. Для своего жанра игра - классика, поэтому любителям к ознакомлению необходима.

пс. Ни один современный хоррор не способен меня напугать так, как тыквенное поле в этой игре.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038722708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1416596610}
review:
Sanitarium beginnt damit, dass man in einem brennenden Turm, der Teil einer Irrenanstalt ist, erwacht. Allerdings ist bereits dieser Turm so gestaltet, dass man bezweifeln kann, ob dieser Ort real ist. Im Folgenden wird man immer wieder mit seltsamen, surrealen Landschaften konfrontiert, die augenscheinlich einer sehr kranken Psyche entstammen. Oder doch nicht?
Sanitarium entwickelt sich langsam, enthüllt in Filmsequenzen die verloren gegangen, wieder auftauchenden Erinnerungen, so dass sich die Wahrheit hinter den seltsamen Gedankenwelten offenbart. Gelungen ist, dass nicht wahllos groteske Welten geschaffen wurden, sondern diese immer einen Bezug zur realen Welt des Protagonisten des Spiels aufweisen. Auch wenn man bald erahnen kann, in welche Richtung sich die Geschichte entwickeln wird, bleibt das Spiel dennoch spannend.

Das Spiel ist im Grunde ein Point&Click-Adventure, nur dass man Max nicht per Click, sondern mittels gedrückter rechter Maustaste steuert. Ansonsten funktioniert das Spiel aber ganz genauso. Man muss Elemente in der Umwelt finden, aufsammeln und kombinieren. Immer wieder trifft man auf kleine Zwischenrätsel, wie zum Beispiel das Nachspielen einer Melodie auf Kürbissen.
Natürlich ist die Grafik inzwischen extrem veraltet, dennoch hat das Spiel immer noch einen charmanten Look, interessante Charaktere, ein unterhaltsames Leveldesign und es erzählt einfach eine wirklich gute Geschichte.

Ich habe Sanitarium bereits damals gespielt als es frisch rauskam und es hat mich jetzt wieder in seinen Bann gezogen. Den Besuch dieser kranken Gedankenwelt kann ich nur empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071856837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1420441584}
review:
I tried this game on a whim, and I am so glad I did!  The artistic design is neat, and everything's rendered pretty well.  The cutscenes sometimes feature some stiff movement, but that's par for the time, and I'm glad they kept the original graphics and cinematics instead of redoing them.  The story was interesting and creepy, but not in a "I'm going to have nightmares" way.  The voiceacting is pretty good.  The only negative thing is the movement speed, but that's not really an issue unless you are trying to rush or replay a scene.  During normal play the walk speed is great.
The game ran flawlessly on my desktop (running Win7 64-bit).  I didn't have any problems with the game crashing or anything.
I'm overall incredibly pleased with this game.  Great game that runs great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974465711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1419792753}

Una aventura grafica que me ha marcado por el mundo que crea y que siempre lo tendre en mente como referente a uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994624438', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1415310507}
review:
If trippy point and click adventure games are the poison of your choice, you simply cannot have gone through the 90s without ever hearing about Sanitarium. Building entire psychotic worlds over the depressing backdrop, Sanitarium manages to tap into the grotesque, eccentric and sometimes funny subconscious of its protagonist, Max, without losing focus of the meta narrative. It is a rare example of elaborate storytelling that I would argue transcends the video gaming medium and becomes what some refer to as high art. While not particularly long and as linear as a film, Sanitarium delivers the sort of single-serving experience that captures its audience while insanity takes over and the worlds you visit meld into a carnival of metaphors. The puzzles are easy enough to give the plot pacing while the overarching themes give your bandage-faced hero a sense of mental consistence, in spite of all the craziness.

BUY IT if you:
-Collect classic gems.
-Do not know what a 586 is, but love stuff like Jacob's Ladder and Shutter Island.
-Do not feel deterred by isometric 1998 graphics when looking for your mystery fix.

DO NOT BUY IT if you:
-Expect a great deal of gaming hours out of the money you spend on games.
-Are neither nostalgic nor curious about oldies but goldies in the realm of adventure gaming.
-Demand difficult puzzles and think anything less than The Dig is a waste of your analythical brilliance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123918313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1419742554}
review: Jogo antigo, mas com uma história que prende muito a atenção. Tenso e perturbator em alguns momentos, não tem como não gostar. Você sofreu um acidente e se vê internado em um sanatório. Não se lembra do seu nome e nem do que aconteceu. Os NPC's são pessoas extremamente problemáticas e existem inúmeros puzzels para resolver. Sinceramente, deixa no chão muito jogo atual, respeitando, é claro, a jogabilidade e os gráficos da época em que foi lançado. Recomendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054142896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1415276849}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026557524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1586501443}
review:
I want to say that while I have put very little time into this game on steam, I still own the original CDs to this game and religiously play it once per year around Halloween.  When I saw that it was on the steam store, I had to have it.

This is easily the best point and click adventure I have ever played.  Hands down.  No contest.

The controls are a bit dated, and some of the boss fights seem a bit odd... but this game was my childhood introduction to videogaming, and I haven't found as compelling a horror game yet.  Yes, there are ones that will make you jump.  This one will stay with you.

Please, give this game a try.  It's worth the price.  If you try playing it without steam, there are all sorts of workarounds you need to do to get the game FUNCTIONAL (let alone playing optimal).  The price of this game on Steam is easily worth skipping the headache of getting Disc sanitarium to work.  I've put only 10 minutes or so into the game, but during that time I tested the game for the bugs I tend to get in Disc sanitarium.  Haven't found one yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997782037', 'num_games_owned': 1651, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1415450436}
review:
TL;DR: BUY THIS GAME, ONE OF THE BEST HORROR ADVENTURES EVER!

Longer version:

This game is cult classic, ironically not known by many gamers. I remember demo that I played in 1998, which was first episode in asylum tower, after fifteen minutes I knew I had to own this game, so I bought it. 

Back then everything about Sanitarium was simply flawless, locations were beautyful in the eerie, horrific way, voice acting- perfect, sounds and music-unique and integrated with rest of the game, animation and most of all the movies. Oh my god, the movies! They were fantastic back in the day, they were so goddamn good it wasn't even strange that developers decided to put an option of replaying already watched parts in the main menu.

But enough about technical aspects, since they aged (but with  dignity, they're not hurting my eyes today). Sanitarium begins with a man talking via phone on his way to car. He's excited that he finally discovered something, and tells person on the other end of the line, that he will tell all when he'll get back home. So he drives, but becaeuse of his anxiety drives too fast and on the turn car flip out of the road. Next thing you know your (because thats you, main character) face is covered with bandages, you, dont remember anything except accident, including your name, and you wake up in urine soaked cell in some god abandoned asylum. In next few minutes you'll visit administration room, where you'll learn, that wolrd remeber your accident differently than you. From that moment everything is only turning to worse and worse nightmare that will make you clueless for the most part of the game.

Story of the game is great and is brilliantly executed, creating many plots, black holes, situations and dialogs that at first appears to be pointless or simply insane, just to finally be small part of bigger picture, that is giving them sence and makes them suddenly extremely important in process of understanding plot.

That's when we come to great thing about Sanitarium, that is really uncommon in adventure games - replayability. Of course, puzles remains the same, BUT when we finish the game for the first time we have knowledge of what really happened, and suddenly there are TONS of content that we ignored in first run, because it seemed irrelevant. Know it fits, it adds another brick to the big picture.

Horror aspect of game is briliantly build. It's not survival horror, you don't really have to worry about your character getting killed, so monsters jumping from corners wouldnt fit here. Game is buinding whole atmosphere on feeling that you are lost, and very possibly insane, that you are fighting just to acknowledge simple truth- that you are as mad as everyone is telling you. Game is not afraid of gore, or disturbing images, which fits perfectly to graphic desing of Sanitarium. 

Game contains 9 chapters (each is +- 2 hours long) and besides being part of the whole plot each of them is telling it's own story, mostly very sad and disturbing, some may be liked less, because every single one of them is based on different theme (I didnt'd liked The Hive as much as others) but each is small gem. The Innonent Abandoned and Circus Of Fools  are so brilliant that they deserve they own reviews.

Unveiling plot of chapters and the game leaves a player with strage and uneasy feeling, like Silent Hill2 few years later. You know its great, and you wish you could witness it again for the first time, and in the same moment you know that everything about it is depressing. 

And just like Silnet Hill2, Sanitarium is pure gold. For me this game is worth 10/10, poudly standing on the first place on podium for the title of best horror advetunre game ever, ex aequo.

Buy this game, worth so much more than few bucks. But they could fix problem with subtitles in the movies (they crash the game, don't turn them on)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960665902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1611509778}
review:
Let me start off by saying the weird stuff. I hadn't played this game for years, all a sudden it popped into my mind this morning, and I began to google old school reviews on it. The next thing I do is visit the Steam front page, and what do I find as a new seller? Sanitarium. If that doesn't call me to purchase this game, I don't know what the hell else can.

 

For those looking for a trippy adventure title, look no further. 

  The game came out late 90s but I picked it up early 2000 and played it on one of my first PC's I owned. Was quite an experience to say the least.

 

  I remember staying home from school sick with a bad cold due to allergies, popping some drowsy medicine, and playing Sanitarium. 

  I think the meds helped enhance the overall atmosphere of the game because it was impossible for me to put down. Even as sleepy and tired as I was, I kept chugging away at this game throughout my sick day off and neared completion.

  The game has you playing a man who is basically out of his mind. Not sure what is real and what isn't and you are basically playing what's in his head, good and bad.

  I don't want to get into the story or spoilers, but I'll leave it that I think the 2nd chapter stood out as one of my favorites because of all the creepy children and the overall environment. The game has an awesome atmosphere that doesn't let up. 

  Sure this game is old, but it's still a gem and now on Steam, I highly recommend picking it up. I own the original discs still and liked to add this to my Steam collection so I got it here as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047990375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1414941485}
review:
The very first time I played this game the year was 1998. And since then, I have been speaking about this game as one of a kind, ahead of its time whether it be the graphics or the storyline. Like me, I am quite certain a number of gamers would title this game as one of the milestones in their gaming history. 

The graphics of the game might not be as enticing as some of the games that are available in these days. Even if the general atmosphere of the game is horror, do not expect to be "scared", however, you might find yourself very disturbed while playing it. The game uses many cliché horror elements successfully. 

The puzzles are very cleverly designed yet not too obvious nor too hard. The general story takes the player from an asylum to an abandoned bizarre village without any adults but only populated by deformed children, from a spin at a run-down circus to the pages of a sci-fi comic book until finalizing in an Aztec Temple. Regardless of how surreal the plot-line may seem, the ending is quite rational explaining it all.

This game has been one of my favourite games to this day, and I am quite certain hands down its story-line still will be one of the most intellectually written computer game stories, past and future.

There are sadly some downsides for the gaming equipment of today - the game crashes if the subtitles are enabled in the cinematics, and movement is not very precise compared to the modern day games. Apart from these two minor but very tolerable downsides this game is a must-have for any point&click and story rich adventure gamer.

review:
I'm a long time fan of this game, and for a good reason!
The story really kept me curious the whole time, and for every bit of unsettling horror there was great voice acting to go with it. Many characters still shake me up (in a good way!) getting to hear them speak again. Some of the puzzles are very bizzare, and there's still one or two that can trip me up. I genuinely feel bad for the main character as his plot unfolds, and it's very dark. Very satisfying to beat as well! 

I think there's even secret keyboard commands to make the characters say silly things. I remember I used to make Olmec laugh. HA. HA. HA.

I also love having this game on steam now, as I re-bought the original twice in the past. Too many discs! So I always lost them. I'm glad it's still playable, and still as enjoyable as the first time I picked it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082113681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1417570369}
review:
I played and enjoyed Sanitarium back in early 2000 as a kid, and let me say this: The game has aged just fine. Although rough-looking for a game in 2014/2015, Sanitarium more than makes up for it with its well written AND spoken dialogue, story that is rivaled by few in the genre, and the atmosphere is absolutely perfect.

But before I begin to praise Sanitarium even more, I must warn you of one thing that the game really fails at -- its controls. More specifically, the movement of the main character. You move at a crawl and you really have to shove your mouse with some authority to get the direction you want. In fact, some parts of the game have you crawling around (of course not literally, you're walking) for several minutes if you have to backtrack, which will happen on your first playthrough. I can understand the slow movement may be annoying for people who are used to modern games where characters often have the ability to run around, but not in this game. You're going to have to walk around and backtrack. Sorry.

Anyways, now that the bad is out of the way, a quick list of pros.
- Great horror atmosphere. The ambiance, chillingly good voice acting of some characters, the music, the details in areas you'll explore. Good stuff here.
- Extremely captivating story. If by the 2nd chapter you're getting bored I'd be surprised.
- As the steam description says, "...this timeless point-and-click horror game is a must-have for adventure game fans."
Couldn't have put it better myself.

In short, if you like point-and-click horror adventure games and don't mind a character that moves around a little bit slow, then this game is definitely for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970064749', 'num_games_owned': 5549, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1415186561}
review:
Sanitarium, a game that is not known by many, but the ones who do know the game (played the game), will never forget.

[i]Explaining this game without any spoilers is pretty hard but I will try anyways. I suggest you don't watch a lot of screenshots or gameplay before playing.[/i]

Many years ago, a friend of mine bought the game and installed it on my PC for me to play. At that time I didn't play a lot of Point 'n click games yet. A few games I did play were games like Broken Sword, Myst and Put-Put (yes I know...), imagine what my thoughts were when I launched this game. 

Sanitarium takes you on a journey of a man who suffers from amnesia and tries to discover his own identity. The game is a point 'n click psychological-horror adventure with a top down view.

Right from the beginning the game drops you into a world of weirdness and sickness and it only get's worse the game progresses. Pretty much every character in the game is either crazy, weird, deformed, non-human or a combination of those. You will have to solve puzzles and find items like any other point 'n click game. 

Sanitarium is a game that's certainly not for everyone. The game obviously has aged over the years and it's far from perfect but the unique story and world makes this a game you will not soon forget, if you can look passed it's flaws. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198059724280', 'num_games_owned': 871, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1420364061}
review:
Sanitarium или Шизариум, как переводили его наши локализаторы стал для меня одной из самый впечатляющих игр детства. Атмосфера безумия, которая не прекращает преследовать вас от начала и до конца, просто непередаваема, каждая минута, проведенная в этой игре стала для меня бесценной, и если вы сумеете правильно собрать все кусочки мозаики памяти, понять все стилизации, то, ни процесс, ни конец вас не разочаруют.

На мой взгляд Sanitarium это один из тех квестов в который должен поиграть каждый. 

Чем привлекателен Sanitarium? Тем что вы находитесь с героем на равных начиная игру и двигаетесь дальше по ней с одинаковым пониманием или наоборот непониманием происходящего, ведь ваш герой потерял память, а вы знаете только то, что это случилось после автокатастрофы. Все остальное о прошлом, настоящем и будущем героя вам придется познавать вместе с ним пробираясь через безумные локации, которые приготовили для вас не простые пазлы, но что приятно и не такие уж, и сложные чтобы зависнуть с ними до конца веков и бросить игру от бессилия. Каждая новая глава в игре — это отдельная локация со своим злом и по началу кажется, что нет в этих искаженных и изуродованных мирах ничего общего. Но узнав правду вы поймете, что каждый из них это попытки подсознания докричаться до героя дать ему подсказки, чтобы он все вспомнил, снова стал собой и наконец-то рассказал жене и всему миру о том, о чем хотел до того, как случилась авария.

Подводя итог: если вы любите атмосферные игры, то Sanitarium для вас.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012209082', 'num_games_owned': 1561, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1414924386}
review:
Добро пожаловать в лучшее место на свете - в мир сюрреализма.

Мое знакомство с творением компании DreamForge Intertainment (бесславно упраздненной в 2000м году), состоялось несколько лет назад, когда я, изнывая от скуки, решил скачать какой-нибудь квест, о котором я никогда ничего не слышал. Мой выбор (к счастью) пал на проект с интересным названием - Sanitarium. Поиграв некоторое время, я стал задавать себе множество вопросов, ответы на которые я хотел узнать во что бы то ни стало. Что случилось с главным героем Максом? Вымысел ли то, что я вижу его глазами, или это немного искаженная картина реально происходящего? 

Ответы появились. Не одни, а с осознанием мной того, что игра имеет под собой глубокий философский контекст, суть которого можно уловить не с первого раза.

Необходимо сказать о технической стороне игры. Озвучка - на высоте, диалоги не в стиле *написал что попало, прочитай и отвяжись*, но на высочайшей ступени качества! Графика ничуть не изменилась (за исключением подтянутого разрешения экрана для владельцев новых систем, но это играет только на руку!). Особым образом необходимо отметить использование двухмерных задников в изометрической проекции, что отличает данное произведение от тех же серий, как то Monkey Island, Space Quest и многих других. 

В игре присутствует множество игровых персонажей, так же, как и бесчисленное количество второстепенных. Каждый со своей уникальной историей и присущими лично ему повадками и манерами поведения.

Отмечу, что лично для меня было нереально приятной неожиданностью в виде наличия достижений Steam. Казалось бы, можно было просто выпустить продукт с минимальным количеством улучшений, но это меня поистинне удивило.

Подводя итоги, выскажу главную мысль словесного потока мыслей выше. Игра - Шедевр. Именно с большой буквы, Sanitarium полностью оправдывает надежды на проведенное время с пользой для личного удовольствия.

Спасибо, DreamForge Intertainment. Спасибо, Steam. Вы снова сделали невозможное, поразив меня до глубины души.

Отличный хоррор квест с просто шикарным сюжетом (даже, можно сказать, несколькими). Отличное звуковое сопровождение, музыка - шик, голоса детей - до дрожи пробирает. Однозначно - игра прекрасна.
Именно такое было впечатление, когда я играл в нее в первый раз. Сейчас - ничего не изменилось. Все так же цепляет сюжет, все так же пугает звук. Только что управление вызывает сомнения и визуальная составляющая. Но если откинуть эти предрассудки - однозначный WIN!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966408323', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1414784439}
review:
The moment I spotted this on Steam, I instantly purchased it.  After what seems like an eternity, Sanitarium is finally on Steam. Currently, I have the CD (3 discs + insert) sitting right next to me, and the GOG version installed and bookmarked through my library (not anymore).  

I used to play this game several times a week, just because it was so engrossing. When this game released, it came at time when Point-and-Clicks were fading out (post-LucasArts and Sierra), so it became somewhat of a cult game. 

This is one of my all time favorite games, providing an eclectic variety of atmospheres, horrors, and oddities. Between the isometric view, diverse scenes, the ominous soundtrack, clever puzzles, and amazing storyline, Sanitarium has always stood out.  I most definitely recommend this game. 

"Youth hides the key to Salvation."

author: {'steamid': '76561197984993665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1434704183}
review:
Ich habe dieses Adventure schon vor über 10 Jahren gespielt. Sanitarium ist ein Psycho-Adventuregame. Das besondere ist, das man im Lauf der durchgespielten Abschnitte immer mehr über den Protagonisten und seine Arbeit erfährt.
Die Abschnitte sind zum Teil sehr schockierend.
Als Nachteilig empfinde ich ein paar schwere bis unfaire Actionsequenzen. So muß man im zweiten Abschnitt ein Kürbisfeld überqueren, das es in sich hat, bewaffnet nur mit einer Sense, die schwer zu handhaben ist. Neben der gruseligen Handlung kommt noch die gruselige Musik hinzu.
Die endgültige Wahrheit erfährt man erst mit Vollendung des allerletzten Level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022774118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 7398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1669333516}
review:
About time this got a Steam release! One of the most immersive point & click adventure games ever released, Sanitarium offers an extremely thick atmosphere, excellently voiced dialogue and a plot that will keep anyone who appreciates a good, abstract story on the edge of their seats.

In Sanitarium you play the role of a patient, bound in rags with no immediate recollection of who or where he is but soon finds himself in a very twisted and obscure world, far different to our own in which he must converse with interesting characters, seek answers to riddles and solve puzzles in hopes of finding an answer to the madness which surrounds him.

Not much can be said about Sanitarium without taking away from this unique experience other than it’s an extremely solid point & click adventure game for both hardcore and newcomers to the genre and one of the most memorable experiences in all my years of gaming.

This Steam version works well, my only current complaint, as far as my knowledge, being that you cannot choose the aspect ratio but other than that everything is intact here! Very interesting game that I could easily recommend to people that have never played anything from the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028055098', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1656025170}
review:
This is my very first steam review, so bear with me. At the time of writing this review, I have had zero hours played of this game IN STEAM. While I have not played this game through steam, I have played through it at least five times in the past straight from the disk. I can say without a doubt that this is my favorite point and click game. Not only is it simple, but it has a compelling story, some very creepy elements, and is overall a well thought out, and well balanced horror game.

     First of all, the story of this game is very immersive. It really puts you into the protagonist's shoes and makes you want him to progress and find whatever it is that he needs to find. (Trying to avoid any and all spoilers in this) This tactic of turning you into the protagonist really compells you to progress in the game.

     A good point to also make is that the characters in this game are all VERY diverse. There are a wide range of individuals in this game, and they are truly individuals. They have their own voice, action set, and personality. This makes the game seem realistic no matter how crazy it all seems.

     True Horror. This game isn't a new game, obviously. It is before all of this jump scare nonsense. A lot of people can't stand them, and I am one of them. Instead of throwing things at your face, his game uses it's storyline while constantly and consistently sprinkling creepy people, places, and ideas to get under your skin and really make your heart pump.

     The music in this game is very good in my opinion. It adds a lot of subtle creepy tones to the game that couldn't be attained with such a magnificent soundtrack.

     You may see point and click and think "Too easy. I would be done in minutes." This isn't the speedrun kind of game. It actually has given me some difficulty. The game really makes you think about what needs to be done next.

     Puzzles, puzzles, puzzles! This game has many uniquely puzzling puzzles. It has just enough to make your brain work without bringing you out of the game's atmosphere.


Overall, I think this game is very well worth the five dollars that I payed for it on sale even though I know the story by heart and all the places to click are stored in my brain. I honestly can't think of anything negative to say about this game. I have loved it for years upon years and I will keep loving it as the simple, yet eerie and enjoyable game that will stay in my heart forever. 

TL:DR:

Well structured game.
Good cheap horror title.
Great character development.
Perfect music.
Challenging.
Great puzzles.

And creepy as all hell! 

Thank you for reading. I really suggest this game to anyone looking for horror, point and click, casual, adventure, or creep-me-out kind of games. The developers from the past really deserve a pat on the back for this masterpiece.


EDIT: It was requested that I speak more specifically about the story in my review. Hopefully this helps some of you.

     In this game, you wake up in an insane asylum after a tragic car accident. You have amnesia and can not remember your name, why you are there, or many details about your own life and the world around you. You explore different planes of reality and even fantasy to learn the details of your life and why you woke up in the asylum.

I suppose this summary kind of dumbs down the amazingly integrated and intruiging plot of the game, but don't let my horrible preview fool you. The story may seem unrelatable and maybe even boring to some of you, (Trying to figure out your past, present, and future) but once you begin to play this game, you will instantly feel otherwise. I hope this bit helps some of you decide on purchasing this game.
